El grupo lo integran 11 mujeres, las once mujures tienen su negocio y le luchan para ir saliendo adelante para aprovechar todas las oportunidades y sacar mas ganancias de las mismas. al grupo le pusieron el nombre de "Jazmin" porqué una integrante de este grupo se llama así, se reunen en el negocio de la señora Yazmin, por esa razón les parecio que su grupo llevara ese nombre, los nombres de las integrantes son los siguientes;
1.-Florentina P. L.
2.-Margarita L. C.
3.-Maribel C. H.
4.-Maria Alicia H. R.
5.-Lizbeth C. S.
6.-Jazmin G. L.
7.-Maria Elena C. M.
8.-Ofelia S. R.
9.-Laura E. R.
10.-Sandra C. M.
11.-Antonia C. S.

las once integrantes se llevan muy bien y tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse, nos dicen que se conocen desde niñas y son responsables, tambien se ayudan como solidarias que son para apoyar en cualquier dificultad que tengan, se juntaron para hacer el grupo porqué unas que tenian un negocio querian una inversion extra y otras para poder empezar a tener un negocio, de esta forma es como han permanecido en el grupo para echarle ganas y salir adelante. Doña Maribel es la presidenta de este grupo tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos una mujer y un
 hombre que los dos estudian la primaria, doña Maribel es madre soltera, ha sido muy dificil para ella debido a que no tiene un apoyo para sus hijos mas que el de sus padres, pero lo que gana es todo para sus hijos, la casa en donde vive es prestada y es de sus padres, pero nos platica que aun así no es facil ya que sus hijos nesecitan una figura paterna. El negocio de doña Maribel es vender sabanas por catalogos, ella se va por los pedidios a la ciudad de Toluca Edo. México, y los trae para la gente que se los encargo. Tambien trabaja como empleada domestica en las mañnas para ayudarse un poco mas con el dinero, nos menciona que lo dificil en su negocio ha sido fiar las cosas porque en ocaciones se vuleve un problema cobrar, las ganancias las ocupa en los gastos de los niños, en ropa y en lo que piden en la escuela, la meta o el sueño de doña Maribel es hacer un local para vender ahi colchas, cobertores, sabanas y almohadas. De esta forma ya no tendria que caminar y la mimsa gente llegaria a ver aho los productos.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Jazmín” and is located very near to the center of San Felipe del Progreso, about a ten minute walk.  The community where the group meets is called Cabecera.  The community is advanced in that it has all services, paved streets, sports fields, etc.  One can also find everything needed for meals and others because there are many businesses everywhere and people don’t have to go far to get meat, tortillas, water, soft drinks, etc.  The community is populous, there are many houses and it’s somewhat large.

The group is made up of 11 women who have their business and struggle to get ahead taking advantage of every opportunity and gleaning as much profit from them as possible.  

They called the group “Jazmín” because that’s the name of one of the group members and they meet in her business so they thought it would be a good idea for the group to be named after her.  The names of the members are:

1.-Florentina P. L.
2.-Margarita López C.
3.-Maribel C. Hernández
4.-María Alicia Hernández R.
5.-Lizbeth Crisóstomo Sánchez
6.-Jazmín González López
7.-María Elena C. M.
8.-Ofelia Sánchez R.
9.-Laura E. R.
10.-Sandra C. M.
11.-Antonia C. Sánchez

The eleven members get along quite well and have known each other for a long time.  They tell us that they’ve known each other since they were little girls and they are responsible.  Also, they help each other out and are very mutually supportive whenever a difficulty arises.  They got together to form a group because the ones who already had businesses wanted to invest more in them and the others wanted to start businesses.  This is how they have stayed together to work hard and get ahead.

Maribel is the President of this group.  She is 33 years old and has two children, a boy and a girl; both are in elementary school.  Maribel is a single mother and it has been very difficult for her because she does not get any help for her children except from her parents.  However, whatever she makes is for her children. The house she lives in is borrowed from her parents but she tells us that even like that it’s still not easy because her children need a father figure.

Maribel’s business is selling bed sheets via catalogue.  She picks up her orders in the city of Toluca, Estado de México, and brings them to the people who ordered them.  She works as a domestic employee mornings to earn a bit more money, also.

She tells us that the difficult part of her business is providing her goods on credit because occasionally it becomes a problem at the moment of collecting payment.  She needs the profits for her children’s expenses, for clothing and for whatever they ask for at school.

Her goal is to have a locale in which to sell the bedspreads, comforters, sheets and pillows so as not to have to walk; her customers could come by to look at the products there.

loans.use: To invest in a bedsheet sales by catalogue business.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 54 años, es casada, tres hijos. es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun, Tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general en el terminal San Felipe que son buses que salen para el sur D. Ayacucho. solicita un crédito D. 1 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será destinado a la compra D. mercaderias como: árroz, azúcar, fideos, leche,aguas gaseosas, etc. Adela está dos años en Finca Perú, ingreso por la invitación D. su hija,le gusta por la accesibilidad a los créditos, sobre todo pueD. ahorrar, por la capacitaciones que reciben por parte D. sus promotoras en los temas D.:la familia,matrimonio, negocios, que lo ponen en práctica en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
Adela, 54, is married and has three children.   She’s a member of the Kausachun communal bank.  She has a grocery store at the San Felipe bus terminal for buses going to the south of Ayacucho.

She is asking for a 1500 new sol loan to buy merchandise like: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, soft drinks, etc.

Adela has been in Finca Perú for two years.  Her daughter invited her to join.  She likes it because of the accessibility of loans, above all because she can save, and for the training they get from their advisor on topics like: family, marriage and business that they can put into practice in their daily lives.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a radio repair shop

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
Doris, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Pedro (45), que es albañil  y de su hijo que es mayor y trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Hace 8 años, emprendió el negocio de fabricación de muebles con su esposo, y desde entonces ella se dedica a coser, y durante los fines de semana cuando él descansa empiezan ambos con el armado de muebles. Está muy satisfecha pues como trabaja por pedido no tiene perdidas, y le gusta porque es un negocio  que les permite cubrir mejor con los gastos del hogar. Pero lo que no le gusta es que cuando demoran en entregar los muebles listos, éstos se llenan de polvo, pues por la zona donde vive hay bastante tierra. Manifiesta que tiene varios clientes fijos que le compran con regular frecuencia su mercadería pues saben de la calidad y comodidad de sus muebles. Además es una mujer emprendedora ya tiene planeado para el futuro ampliar su negocio y producir mayor cantidad de muebles. Doris tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de material (tela y maderas) que le hacen falta para terminar con un pedido que tiene pendiente, y espera aumentar sus ganancias.

Es el  segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Doris is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Pedro, age 45, who works as a mason. Her grown son works and helps with the household expenses.

Eight years ago, Doris and her husband started a furniture manufacturing business. Since then, she spends most of her time sewing. On the weekends when her husband is resting, they both will spend some time assembling furniture. Doris is very satisfied because their business has not experienced any losses since their work is done according to order. This business has enabled her to do a better job of covering the household expenses. However, Doris dislikes those instances when her customers delay the delivery of completed furniture because the pieces collect dirt since she lives in a dusty area. She says that she has several established customers who buy merchandise from her regularly because they know that her furniture will be comfortable and of good quality. In addition, Doris is an enterprising woman who has future plans to expand her business and produce a higher quantity of furniture. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of materials (fabric and wood) that she is lacking so that she can complete an outstanding order and hopefully increase her earnings.

This is her second loan with MFP. Doris promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that she could continue working and moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & wood

loans.name: Abrhan

texts.es: Abrhan,28 años, es soltero, Socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, es taxista y tambien está estudiando para ser Chef. El préstamo que está solicitando lo utilizará en el pago de seguro de su taxi, compra de llantas. Es su primer ciclo en Finca Perú, ingreso por la invitación de una socia, porque le hablo que se puede ahorrar. Su sueno es ahorrar para poder comprarse otra movilidad.
texts.en:
Abrhan is 28 years old, single, and a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). He works as a taxi driver and is also studying to become a chef. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the insurance on his taxi and purchase tires.

This is his first loan cycle with FINCA Peru. He joined at the invitation of another member because he says that he wants to save. His dream is to save enough money to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: Pay for the insurance on his taxi & purchase tires

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: El sr. Abrahán vive en el barrio Sausalito de la zona norte en casa propia, con su esposa. El se dedica a la jardinería, trabaja con los condominios que hay en la zona donde vive. Tiene un ayudante que trabaja medio tiempo por 15 días. El crédito que esta solicitando es para terminar de construir dos cuartos para darlos en alquiler, el sr. Abrahán es una persona trabajadora, honesta y de una gran responsabilidad con su trabajo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Abrahán lives to the north in the neighborhood of Sausalito. He lives in his own home with his wife. Abrahán works as a gardener and performs landscaping for the condominiums that are in the area where he lives. He has a part-time assistant who works for him for fifteen days.

The loan he is requesting will be used to finish the construction of four rooms for rent. Sr. Abrahán is a hardworking and honest man who demonstrates great responsibility in his work. He is grateful to Emprender for the support being provided.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of four rental rooms

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: Felicita del Socorro de 50 años, tiene un negocio una pulpería, desde 11 años este negocio, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, pues sabe que los financiamientos han servido de gran aporte para su negocio. Sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para iniciar su labor, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad económica. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro is 50 years old and has a store that she has managed for eleven years. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and the loans have been a great help to her business. Felicita knows that she must wake up early every day to begin her work. She is an enterprising woman who enjoys what she does for a living.

The loan she requested will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años, es soltero y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad. Vive en un domicilio en un asentamiento humano, un lugar un poco alejado de la ciudad donde todavía no se cuenta con todos los servicios básicos como luz y agua. Se ubica en la ciudad de Guadalupe, situado en la provincia de Pacasmayo perteneciente al departamento de La Libertad, ubicado a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años, José cuenta con una bodega en su propio domicilio donde vende a sus vecinos alimentos y bebidas entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Adicionalmente, prepara y vende pan. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada en la zona. Además de su negocio, José se dedica al servicio de su comunidad como pastor de una iglesia evangélica cerca de su casa. José es muy conocido y respectado en su región. 

Desea invertir su crédito en su negocio para comprar más mercadería. Desea aumentar su margen de utilidad para seguir cuidando a su familia. También desea realizar algunas mejoras en su casa como arreglar su techo que fue asaltado hace seis meses. Para lograr sus objetivos, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,600 nuevos soles. José es muy trabajador y responsable, y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, single, and has a 14 year old daughter. He lives in a home situated in a squatter settlement, a place located just outside of the city that still does not have basic services such as electricity and water. This settlement is in the city of Guadalupe, which is in Pacasmayo Province, Department of La Libertad, and more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past four years, José has a store in his home where he sells food, beverages, groceries, and other basic necessities to his neighbors. He also makes and sells bread. José has a loyal and established customer base in the area. In addition to his business, he serves his community as the pastor of an evangelical church near his home. José is well-known and respected in the region.

José wants to invest his loan in his business by purchasing more merchandise. This will increase his profits margin so that he can continue taking care of his family. José also wants to make a few improvements to his home, such as fixing the roof which has been in disrepair for the past six months. To accomplish his goals, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1600 PEN. José is extremely hardworking and responsible. He presents good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for his store

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en: Cesar is from the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He is 50 years old and married. He has three children and all are in school. Cesar is retired from the health services industry, but he has started a business with his wife raising and selling poultry. They have been in business for four years, and are requesting a loan to purchase working capital. In the future, Cesar hopes that his business will continue to grow and help support his family.

loans.use: Working capital for poultry business.

loans.name: Diana Clariza

texts.es:
Diana tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera. Vive con su madre en la zona rural del caserío Puerto Malabrigo en el distrito de Razuri, ubicado en la provincia de Ascope, unas horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Diana brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior.  Tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad y cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada.

Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, su herramienta de trabajo. Necesita mantener su moto en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y usarlos para gastos personales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Diana es muy conocida en su caserío. Tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que dicen que es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Diana is 39 years old and single. She lives with her mother in the rural section of the village of Puerto Malabrigo in the District of Razuri. This community is located in the Province of Ascope and a few hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Diana provides transportation services to passengers using her motorcycle taxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin designed for carrying people. She has plenty of experience in this business and an established and loyal customer base.

Diana wants to use this loan to maintain and repair her vehicle, the main piece of equipment for her work. She needs to keep her motorcycle taxi in excellent condition so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her earnings to use for her personal expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Diana is well-known in her village. She has good references from her neighbors and acquaintances who say that she is a hardworking and responsible individual.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance & repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, de 35 años, vive al lado de su esposa Dora (35) y de sus tres hijos menores de edad, juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante. 

Desde hace un año este trabajador hombre instaló en una pieza de su vivienda un pequeño negocio de venta de suministros para construcción (como tubos, pegamentos, herramientas de acero, entre otros), en esta ferretería trabaja al lado de su familia, pues cuando él no puede atender le ayudan sus hijos o su esposa. Dice que obtiene regulares ganancias que invierte en surtir mejor su negocio y le brinda una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Además paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su auto propio en una ruta cercana a su zona. Esta muy satisfecho pues tiene buenas ganancias lo que le permite pagar una buena escuela a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de suministros para el hogar pues por la zona donde vive no tiene competencia. 

Efraín tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de artículos que necesita para surtir mejor su ferretería, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y así seguir progresando. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Efrain is 35 years old and lives with his wife Dora, age 35, and their three young children. Each day they strive to get ahead.

A year ago, this hardworking gentleman set up a small business on his property where he sells construction supplies (such as tubes, adhesives, steel tools, and other items). His family works with him. His children and wife manage their hardware store whenever he is not present. Efrain says that he is able to generate steady income by keeping his business well-stocked. This allows him to provide his family with a good quality of life. In addition, he provides transportation services by driving his own car along a route near his district. He is very satisfied because his income enables him to pay for his children to attend a good school. In the future, he wants to expand his home improvement store because there is no other competition in the district.

Efrain plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of items needed to restock his hardware store. He hopes to improve his profits so that he can continue progressing.

This is his first loan with MFP. Efrain promises to complete his payments on time because he does not want to look bad in the eyes of those responsible for making this loan possible so that he could continue working and moving forward.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to sell in his hardware store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine G. owns The Vintage Kitty, a boutique that sells furniture, artwork, antique books, and other eclectic items.  Located with other art and collectible stores in an antique mall, Christine considers The Vintage Kitty a “conscious boutique” both because of the unique artwork she carries and because she uses her store as a venue to raise awareness for animal rescue.

Christine offers consignment for people who don’t have a venue to sell their work. Consignment means that she sells their item at her store without actually buying it from them.  They are compensated if the item sells, but if it does not sell, she is not left with inventory she cannot move.  She says consignment has helped keep her costs and inventory low.  She advertises through Facebook and Craigslist, in addition to her own webpage and blog.  If necessary, she will even go door-to-door to ask people if they have things they want to sell.

As Christine continues to grow and develop The Vintage Kitty, she looks to further hone its image by carrying more selective work.  Christine says that she is not necessarily interested in carrying “exclusive artwork,” but instead focuses on carrying smart, unique pieces that show creativity.  She does not plan to limit her business contacts to professional artists, but also is interested in talented, amateur artists that create for fun.  

Christine heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana through theredshoes.org, an organization that empowers women through personal and spiritual development.  Christine is using this loan to improve the store’s appearance through new displays, and to grow her inventory.    

Christine strongly believes that with will-power, you can achieve anything.  She was the first person in her family to graduate from high school, and the first to attend and graduate from college.  Christine actively works with the local Baton Rouge animal rescue.  She keeps her store stocked with animal rescue literature, and uses her home as a foster home for rescue cats.

Her long-term goal is to move The Vintage Kitty to its own location.  Having a stand-alone store would provide her the freedom to better create the image she wants for her business, as well as let her use her store as a center for rescue cats.  The rescue cat center would be separate from her business, and would be maintained and supported by the local animal rescue center.

Check out The Vintage Kitty at http://thevintagekitty.com/index.htm.  On her website, she also has links to her blog and a link to The Vintage Kitty’s Facebook page.

loans.use: Increasing inventory, purchasing displays for store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank, is 47 years old and married with three children; two are in college and one is still in high school. 

Gladys sells spices in the Nazarena Market in the city of Ayacucho. Business has been somewhat slow lately due to the unseasonable rain in Ayacucho. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years now and has learned a lot from the training they offer. She would like to expand her business, and also hopes that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase spices to sell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 48 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Felicia se dedica a la venta de fruta que trae de la ciudad de Yanatile. Ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su casa. Su sueño de Felicia es abrir un restaurante.
     
Felicia pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She sells fruit that is brought in from the city of Yanatile. Felicia has been in this business for seven years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to maintain her home. Her dream is to open a restaurant.

Felicia belongs to the Communal Bank “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength, and Friendship). She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Pay for home maintenance

loans.name: Fritz Francisco

texts.es:
Fritz tiene 43 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, él nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Fritz trabaja en la Escuela de Bellas Artes “Diego Quispe Tito” de la ciudad del Cusco como administrador personal y también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. 

Fritz pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fritz, 43, has two children.  He was born in the city of Urubamba and currently lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Fritz works in the “Diego Quispe Tito” Fine Arts School in Cusco as a Personnel Administrator; he also has a small grocery store.  He has had his store for 10 years now and does very well.

He needs a loan this time around to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

Fritz is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank and he’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  At the same time, he pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and many other things.

loans.name: Saturnina Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 62 años D. edad y tiene tres hijos, ella viven al ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Zoila nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. ropa, ella hace chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros a pedido del cliente y también venD. los domingos en la plaza Túpac Amaru D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo hilos, lana y otras cosas más que se necesitan. 

Zoila pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoila, 62, has three children.  She lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Zoila tells us that she has a small dressmaking workshop.  She makes sweaters for children, babies, women and men to order and also sells Sundays in Cusco’s Túpac Amaru square.  She’s had the business for several years now and does very well.  This time around she needs a loan to buy materials like thread, wool and other things that are needed.

Zoila is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank.  While pledging to repay in a timely fashion she also expresses her gratituD. for the opportunity provided by this means.

loans.use: To buy materials like wool, thread and others.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria tiene 47 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Maria se dedica a la confección de chompas de lana para bebes, niños y adultos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  madejas de lana. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la confección de chompas y le va muy bien.       
     
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and has three children; she lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  María makes sweaters for babies, children and adults.  On this occasion she wants a loan to buy skeins of wool.  She has been making sweaters for several years now and does very well.

María is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank.  While expressing her gratitude for the opportunity provided through this means she also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy skeins of wool.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 49 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Marcelina se dedica a la venta de ropa, la socia Marcelina nos cuenta que viaja a la ciudad de Anta los días domingos para vender ropa. Ya son 10 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas y otras cosas más.
     
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old, has five children and lives in Cusco, Peru.  Every Sunday she travels to the city of Anta where she sells clothing.  She's been in this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her.  She plans to use the loan to buy items such as sweaters, trousers, shirts and other clothing articles.

Marcelina is a member of the "Unión, Fuerza y Amistad" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, trousers, shirts and other clothing items

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 34 años. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra y vende limón. Realiza esta actividad en un pequeño terreno que heredó de su padre. Vende sus productos a una clientela ya establecida en el mercado local. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro.

José desea comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de limón. Espera mejorar su producción y la calidad del producto para que pueda venderlo para un buen precio. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own home in the rural area known as El Porvenir Hualtaco III in the district of Tambogrande.  This agricultural area is located in the province of Piura, some four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For five years now he has been growing and selling lemons on a small plot of land that he inherited from his father.  He sells his products to an established customer base in the local market.  He learned his business from his father and knows it very well.

José wants to buy fertilizer for lemon crop maintenance.  He hopes to improve production and product quality so he can sell at a good price.  To reach his goal he has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his lemon crop

loans.name: Miguel Sebastian

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 39 años y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del caserío El Prado ubicado en el distrito de Yonan en el departamento de Cajamarca, una zona agrícola a más de 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadera. Realiza esta actividad en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Aprendió este negocio de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro. 

Miguel desea usar su crédito para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero. Su meta es vender la leche al mercado local y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles. Miguel es muy trabajador y, con su negocio, desea seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children.  They live in their own home in the rural area known as El Prado which is located in the district of Yonan in the department of Cajamarca.  This is an agricultural area more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For ten years he has been a farmer raising livestock.  His farming activity is set up on a small piece of land where he lives.  He learned the business from his father and knows it very well.

Miguel plans to use the loan to buy more dairy cattle.  His goal is to sell milk at the local market so he can generate more income and improve his quality of life.  He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  Miguel is a hard worker and with his business hopes to provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Sartawi De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Concepción, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Josefa y la secretaria de actas la señora Santusa. .   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de vinos, tejido de chompas, macramé de mantas, tejido de variedad de prendas, venta de abarrotes y verduras.
 
La señora Josefa, tesorera de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE”  2 ciclos, aproximadamente  un año.  La señora Josefa  solicitó su primer crédito para impulsar su negocio de tejido de buzos para niños,  ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de trabajar con una tienda en su propio domicilio y quiere el crédito para surtir la tienda.   Debido al tiempo que requiere la atención de una tienda de barrio, ella comenta que le ayudarán  sus hijas mayores.  La señora Josefa está casada, es madre de siete hijos y considera que el trabajo que tendrá con la tienda le permitirá atender a sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The "SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE" communal bank will begin its second year in Pro Mujer as part the the Panamerican Focal Center.  The group has eight members and is lead by a board of directors with Mrs. Concepción as president, Mrs. Josefa as Treasurer and Mrs. Santusa as secretary.  The members' businesses are varied and include sales of: wine, knit sweaters, macrame blankets, clothing fabric, groceries and vegetables.

Mrs. Josefa, the treasurer of the communal association, has been a member of the "SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE" group for approximately one year.  She requested her first loan to start her business of knitted children's clothing.  Now she has the opportunity to set up a shop in her own home and needs a loan to stock the shop.  Because of the time needed to run the business her oldest daughters will help her.  Mrs. Josefa is married and the mother of seven children.  She feels being able to run the shop will help her attend to her children's needs.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says its the companionship she shares with other members.

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as bread, softdrinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Teresa

texts.es: CLIENTE RECURRENTE TIENE 56 AÑOS D. EDAD CUENTA CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO D. PAGO VIVE EN CASA D. SUS PADRES TIENE DOS HIJOS ES SEPARADA HACE MAS D. 11 AÑOS CUENTA CON NEGOCIO EN EL MERCADO SANTO DOMINGO TIENE UNA BODEGA BAZAR CUENTA CON UN PUESTO PROPIO SOLICITA CREDITO PARA INVERTIRLO EN CAPITAL D. TRABAJO
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Teresa is 56 years old and has a good credit record.  She lives with her two children in her parents'  home and has been separated for over 11 years.  She has a stall in the Santo Domingo market where she has set up a grocery store.

She plans to use the loan as working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold, 49, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a house on land that they have owned for 21 years. His two children attend college and his wife helps him with the business.

Ganbold started his carpentry business with his wife in 2001. They operate their carpentry and woodcraft business in a workshop that they built in 2004 using their business profits. In the future, they are planning to enlarge their workshop and operate it all year long. Ganbold is a hardworking and modest person who says, " We want our children to finish their college and begin their own life without any difficulties. We work hard to pay for our children's tuition fees". Ganbold is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en:
Tsedendamba, 41, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land that his parents owned for 40 years. His wife is unemployed and his son works at a local police station.

Tsedendamba has been operating his ironsmith business at his home consistently since 1991. Now he is popular in his area and people come to his shop to place orders. In addition to his ironsmith business, he operates a welding service too. His business is the main source of his family's income. Now he is building a house and will use one room as a workshop. Tsedendamba is a hardworking and kind person who says, "Operating the business at home is difficult and I want to have my own workshop." He is requesting a loan of 350,000 MNT to purchase more materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj, 27 years old, lives with his wife and 3 year old son in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in their own ger, a traditional nomadic tent and fence. His wife takes care of their son at home and sometimes helps her husband.

Dashdorj, in 2002, graduated from the university of auto repair and plumber. Between 2003-2006 he operated a grocery store and since 2010 he has operated an auto repair center from his own home. In future, he plans to operate a business that will service autos and bicycles, as well as plumbing services. He is making his workplace in his own yard, and he says "I will finish construction of my workplace in the coming spring".  He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase tool and equipments for bicycle repair for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tool and equipment.

loans.name: Fazri

texts.en:
Fazri is a 40 year old man. He is married to Ruth, a 38 year old lady. From his marriage, Fazri has been blessed with 2 children, namely Gloryanti, 16 years old who is in the 1st grade of senior high school, and Imanuel who is in the 2nd grade of junior high school. Fasri and his family live in Oesao Village.

Fazri generates money by working as a motorcycle mechanic. He started this business using initial capital of IDR 500,000. He bought simple mechanical equipment while he uses his house as a repair shop. By using inadequate tools, Fazri needs more time to repair a motorcycle. Usually, Fazri needs about one week to repair 1 or 2 motorcycles. The income is usually spent on rice, side dishes and other daily needs. 

Fazri wants to set up a repair shop which is more strategic. However, he also needs more mechanical equipment to support him in doing a better job. According to Fazri, adequate equipment is very essential to the progress of his business. Fazri is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase the mechanical equipment. He really hopes that he can improve his business well.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman who lives in Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a pig-fattening business. Her husband Noel, who is 52 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 18 and 29 years old. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future house renovation. E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia P. is from the village of Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Remegia is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remegia owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Remegia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remegia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remegia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating pig fattening and charcoal businesses. She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and charcoal businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Analyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 to fund operations. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Analyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Kalybek

texts.en:
Kalybek A. is 54 years old. After serving in the army, Kalybek returned home and began to work as a driver at the local state farm.  After breakdown of the Soviet Union, Kalybek decided to engage in cattle breeding. He started with the initial capital of 6,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS) and managed to earn about 6,000 KGS in a month. With the revenues, Kalybek was able to improve his living conditions and give good dowries to his daughters.  

Being a very purposeful and positive person, Kalybek works hard to support his family.

Kalybek plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Kalybek is planning to buy a car for his family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya resides in a city called Gujranwala, Pakistan. Gujranwala is located in Punjab and famous for its industry and rice crops. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family  for many years. She is a housewife and copes with her household work by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and tries to do her duties very well. 

He husband is a civil servant and works in a government organization. After his day job, he does loading work with his donkey cart. He is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Surriya is the mother of two daughters and a son. All of them are studying in a local high school. When Surriya was a child, she was very fond of education but her parents couldn’t educate her due to poor financial conditions. Surriya doesn’t want the same destiny to befall her children, and that’s why she has enrolled them in school so they get an education and make their future bright. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new donkey cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas. She is hopeful that by purchasing a new cart her husband will be able to do his work better and increase his income.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena is a housewife as well as a working woman. In order to financially support her family, she works in people's homes. Her husband operates a furniture polishing business. He polishes furniture made of iron and wood. He has been doing this business for the past 4 years and is known as an expert in his work. 

Meena has given birth to five sons and a daughter. All of them except the youngest one are enrolled in local schools and are getting their education. Meena works very hard to pay their school fees. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her husband’s business. With the loan he will purchase polishers and brushes to further expand his business. 

Meena is sure that an investment will be profitable for him and she will repay the loan easily. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Meena lives in Gujranwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is famous for its industry and rice crops. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house with her family for many years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Meena.

loans.use: To buy polishers and brushes for furniture polishing business

Cherono is 33 years old and a single mother of 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested for a loan of KES 65,000 through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will enable her to take care of her children andto  improve her family's living standards. She faces the challenge of diseases and lack of enough poultry feed.

loans.name: Norsita

texts.en:
Norsita A. is 41-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating three business ventures: selling ice candy/ice, buying & selling gasoline/diesel and farming.  She lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Norsita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Norsita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces milk, vegetables, eggs and bananas. She has been in the farming business for eight years now and sells his products to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested for a loan of KES 81,600 through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to improve the livelihood of his family. He plans to acquire at least 5 more dairy cows and a posho mill in the next 5 years. He faces the challenge of diseases and the high cost of artificial insemination services.

Andrew is 40 years old and married. He has 6 children whose ages rage between 18 months and 18 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan lives in Jaranwala, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a single room brick house for almost 35 years. Shareefan is a widow. Her husband, who worked for the government, died a few years ago. She receives his pension which helps her to pay the utility bills. 

Shareefan lives with her 20-year-old daughter. Both do sewing work to survive financially. They are good at their work and receive regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve their sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine for her daughter because they are currently using a single machine. The new machine will enable them to finish the orders on time and help them to receive more orders every month. She hopes that this investment will help them earn more profits. 

She is a regular borrower of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In her previous loan years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shareefan

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old, married and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a ticketing outlet, an internet café and broadcasting. She lives in Escalante, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Helen is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Helen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very supportive woman. In order to financially assist her family, she has operated a milk sales business for the past 10 years. She keeps a buffalo at her home, milking it and selling its milk to her community clients at reasonable rates. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her milk sales business. She will use the loan money to buy another buffalo, which will help her produce more milk and serve more clients. Nasreen is hopeful that her business will grow and that she will be able to make more profits after investing the loan.

Nasreen's husband, M. ahmed, works in the fields and grows different crops. Nasreen has 7 sons and a daughter. Her two eldest sons work with their father in the fields. The third son works in a factory while two others are bus conductors. Her remaining children are too young to work. Nasreen and her family have lived in Jaranwala for the past 25 years in a 2-room brick house. Jaranwala is a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Nasreen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

Note: In the photo, Nasreen is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

texts.en:
Rhodabelle is a married woman who lives in Escalante, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling ready to wear clothing. Her husband John, who is 30 years old, works as a pump boy (Shell Corp.) to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Rhodabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rhodabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business operation and family needs. Rhodabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

texts.ru: Тагаева Кенджа проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 47 лет. Вдова, имеет троих детей. Дочка находится в России на заработках. Сама Кенджа работает рядом с сауной "Шифо". Она занимается торговлей семечек. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Kendja T. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 47 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Her daughter is now working in Russia. Kendja works next to the spa "Shifo." She sells seeds and has been in this business for ten years. She is asking for a loan to increase sales volume.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Julynda's Group

texts.en:
Julynda B. is from the village of Mansabay bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is 35 years old. Julynda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Julynda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Julynda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood product, such as, fish in the local community. Julynda has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julynda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julynda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Julynda B.'s group is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julynda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

He has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

This will be the second loan taken out by Teodoro from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the his business.

loans.name: Shernalyn

texts.en:
Shernalyn is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and frozen foods. She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and frozen foods businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Shernalyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 to fund operations. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Shernalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Zakia M., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three children. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for three years. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Zakia's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more sarongs, fabrics, bedsheets and curtains and has repaid her loan successfully. Zakia hopes for a loan to start selling food in remote areas.

Zakia will share this loan with her loan group, DDC, which has 17 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Zakia is in the front row, second from right.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline, 45, is married with 6 children who are between the ages of 10 and 26 years. Three of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for ten years now in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces eggs, maize, milk and beans that are sold locally.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn P. is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  perfumes/cosmetics sales and a ready to wear clothes/shoes business. Her husband Domingo, who is 43 years old, works as a foreman to earn his living.  They have five children who are 12 to 22 years old. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use to pay for more buy more stock for her business so she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marilyn P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Annabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as junk foods and beverages, to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a widow who lives in the municipality of Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fish vending and a general store. 

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 which she added to her own capital helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,500, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business activities. Despite her old age, she works hard to satisfy her family's needs. Lolita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda T. is from the village of Villaflor Oroq,City. She is 49 years old. Rosalinda married and has 2 adult age children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces maize, beans, and tomatoes. She has been in the farming business for five years now and sells her products to the local market. She is 43 years old and married with six children who are between the ages of 4 and 16 years. All the children attend school except one.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to improve her family's livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough water for her dairy cows especially during the dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Hệ  Trần Thị  (20203040079) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hệ  is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 2 (Nhóm 10).


Hệ  is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hệ  owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  Hệ  has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hệ  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hệ  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hệ  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Bá D. (0) is a 29 year-old male who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Trần Thị L. (0) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Cao Thị H. (0) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 2.464.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Thuyên (0) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hệ  Trần Thị  (20203040079) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hệ  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 (Nhóm 10).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ B.n hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hệ  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hệ  kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hệ  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hệ  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Bá D. (0) là 29 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trần Thị L. (0) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Cao Thị H. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.464.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Thuyên (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn B.n thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita E. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 63 years old, widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. Marianita owns and operates a farming business, generating a monthly net income of 1,500 PHP. She has been operating her business for more than 30 years.

In 2006, Marianita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for her business. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for a check up after her tumor surgery. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Marianita from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for a post-surgical check up

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna G. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Paterna has been operating a business selling cosmetic items for 5 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP.

In 2008, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for her business. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used pay for her child's tuition. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Paterna from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
