This is their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and they are requesting a loan in order to satisfy their cutomers demand. This group of women sells cosmetics, ginger, frankincense, condiments, clothes, etc.. 
One of them is Kadia K.. With this loan she wants to buy thirty-five kilograms of ginger and fifteen loads of firewood carts. She purchases her products at the big market of Sikasso as well as in the surrounding villages of Ouelessebougou and resells them at the market of Ouelessebougou and door to door, cash and credit; her customers are both men and women. 
She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be partly used to support her husband with the daily expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of retail products

loans.name: Slayman

texts.en: Slayman is a 55 year-old married man and father of a single boy. Slayman has worked in construction since 1975.   He specializes in sanitary work.  He started a new small business and wants to improve it through a loan from Al Majmoua. His business is to curve iron sanitary pipes and sell them. He states that this work is going to be better from the moment he gets the suitable tools for it. Slayman deals with a lot of contractors who like his way of treating clients. He 's well known in the region and he's of a good reputation. Through the loan, Slayman will pay for his son's university fees and hopes he can see him as an important man in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools for his new business, and to pay for his son's university fees

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann G. is from the village of Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, eggs and vegetables which are all sold to the local market. 

Stephen is 55 years old and married with five children whose ages range from 16 to 32. Three of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to buy a posho mill in the near future to help supplement his farming income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is 62 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a sari-sari store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products, like dried fish and firewood, in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital for selling fish. This loan will be the second taken out by Estrella from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Tanios

texts.en: Tanios is a 42 year-old married man, living with his wife and two kids in Tayouneh. Tanios has owned a car rental company since 2002. In Lebanon, this kind of business is doing well, because tourism is the main source of financial support to this beautiful country. To keep this business going well, the government set up some regulations  which a business must follow.   An annual maintenance check-up and mandatory insurance are now required. Tanios is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for such requirements.   He already saved some money, but he needs to complete the requested amount. This is his first time dealing with Al Majmoua, and he believes that it's worth trying it. Most of his clients are tourists and Lebanese citizens who need a car for a certain period of time. He plans to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his car's governmental annual check-up and maintenance fees

loans.name: Banchani

texts.en:
Banchani is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for six years now and sells his milk, eggs and vegetables at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family.

Banchani has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve their livelihood. He says that in the next five years he plans to have four dairy cows and a power saw.

Banchani is 33 years old and married with no children yet.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 36-year-old married man, the father of four kids, living in Tayouneh region. Ziad has been selling religious clothes since 1998. His business is doing well since such clothes are in high demand in his area. He is a good businessman, knows his job well and knows what's needed. He always tries to add new designs. He seeks out different clients' ideas and opinions. His work is exciting and hard, as he claims it's hard to address all customers' likes and dislikes. Ziad hopes to expand his business so that one day his children can start a company of their own to take care of and expand. All of this led him to request a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital by buying a new collection.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Christopher Y., who is in his late thirties, is single with one child. He sells vegetables along Bagamoyo road. He has been in this business for one year. He works for 5 hours a week only, from 6am to 7am daily, and is able make a small monthly profit.

This will be Christopher's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants a loan to increase his stock of vegetables. He normally buys from farmers and sells to people who pass by his place.

Christopher will share this loan with the 15 members of the Becham group.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Christoper is in the middle, in a brown shirt.

loans.use: To increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26 year old single man, planning for an engagement very soon depending on the requested loan from A. Majmoua. This loan is going to be used to buy necessary tools for his shop in addition to paying for his engagement party expenses. Ali is well known in his region. He's trustful, a man of honor, and polite. He loves his work a lot, and he takes good care of his shop's decoration and cleanliness, since most of his friends spend a good time there. He started his business in 2004 with 11 years of experience in his field. He's planning to open a hair dresser shop so he can fulfill both male and female needs.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his shop and to pay for his engagement expenses

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21 year old single man who has been the owner of a barber shop since 2009 with 11 years of experience. Ali started working early because of his family's low income, so he had to work while he was still a child who needed to play. He is regretting that he did so, because his family comes first and he became mature as he knew life's real face early. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to do necessary renovations to his shop such as changing the painting color, pasting floor tiles and fixing the shop's roof top. Ali might also change his chairs if he saves any money after making the requested changes. Through his last loan, Ali paid for an advertisement for his shop, which came with positive feedback and increased his clients and income at the same time. He was a borrower in good standing, and he's planning to be the same with this requested loan.

loans.use: To do necessary renovations to his barber shop

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KHADIM RASSOUL est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI

Khady T. assise devant la photo en troisième position à partir de la droite, de noir vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant mais elle a la charge de ses trois neveux et une nièces.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique au marché centre de son village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Mais ce prêt sera utilisé pour l'achat de tissus qu'elle va revendre dans le village.

Elle participe à la prise en charge des enfants de son frère. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The Khadim Rassoul solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 18 women who are all from the same village. They share ties of friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Palene Coki.

Khady T. is the group leader. In the photo, she is seen sitting in the front row, third from the right and dressed in black. She is 36 years old and single with no children, although she does have three nephews and one niece in her care.

She runs a shop at the central market of her village. She also practices sheep fattening. The loan, however, will be used to buy fabrics for resale in her village.

She helps to take care of her brother’s children. Her goal is to boost her savings and support herself.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Urweze Group

texts.fr:
Yvette N. est une commerçante âgée de 21 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de pataes douces dans le centre de négoce de Rugombo depuis 3ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 5e année. Elle  est mariée  et  mère d’un enfant de 1an et 18 mois. Elle  arrive au 2e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital   en achetant de grandes quantités de patates douces à revendre à ses clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle  sera à mesure de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et realiser son reve d’etre une grande commercante

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Urweze».
texts.en:
Yvette N. is a 21-year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Rugombo commune of Cibitoke province, in West Burundi. Her business has been in sweet potatoes at the Rugombo trade center for three years, whereas she used to be a farmer before starting in this trade. Yvette has studied through the 5th grade. She is married and the mother of one child, aged 1 year and 8 months.

Yvette is now on her second community loan cycle with Turame. She is requesting the Kiva loan to increase her capital by buying large amounts of sweet potatoes to resell to her customers. In this way, she will be able to increase her savings.  With this loan and the savings in hand, she hopes to provide for her family and over time to realize her dream of becoming a major merchant.  

She is a member of the community group Urweze.

loans.use: Growing her capital by buying large amounts of sweet potatoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Maginga M., who is in his late forties, is married with 7 children. He has been running a bar business for 5 years. He works from 4pm (afternoon) to 10pm.  He works for 6 hours and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maginga's 6th loan from Tujijeng Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy chairs and tables, and he expanded the bar hall.  He has paid back the loan successfully.  He wants a loan to top up the products which are out of stock, and the drinks especiA. because they sell out fast. His dream is to open a hardware shop.

Maginga will share this loan with the Ulezi loan group, which has a total of 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Maginga is the first man on the left.

loans.use: To increase stock for bar business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane  S. habite a Baye laye. Il est marié et évolue  dans le domaine du commerce depuis 1989. Monsieur S. est d’origine guinéenne  et a hérité de l’activité de ses parents. Il gère une boutique ou il commercialise  des produits et denrées alimentaires de toute sorte. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour. Il aime bien les périodes de fête car ce sont des moments ou son activité est plus rentable. Il est membre du guichet de Baye laye depuis novembre 2005. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destine  a compléter  son épargne et acheter un terrain qui lui est proposé dans la localité de Bambilor. Ainsi ce financement pourra contribuer  à réaliser une ambition tant souhaitée.
texts.en: Mr. Ousmane S. lives in Baye Laye. He is married and has worked in business since 1989. He is from Guinea and inherited the business from his parents. He manages a shop where he sells all kinds of products and foodstuffs. It is a business that he chose out of love. He likes the holiday periods as those are times when his business is more profitable. He has been a member of the Baye Laye microfinance association since November 2005. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used to supplement his savings and to buy a plot of land offered to him in the locality of Bambilor. This financing will contribute to his realizing a longed-for ambition.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41 year old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and two kids. Ali works as a tailor. In addition to his work, and because of the expensive financial situation everyone is passing through these days, Ali opened a small grocery store in his shop where he sells milk, coffee, chips, candies, rice, oil and water. He opened this shop in 2007, and work is going fine. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new textiles and tailoring tools necessary to improve his business. This is Ali's third time dealing with Al Majmoua. All his loans were for improving the business, and had a good impact. he hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy new textiles and tailoring tools

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en: A. Sabohat is 45 years old, married and has one child. Sabohat’s business is sewing national women’s dresses. Eight years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She does this work with only one sewing machine right now. She sells finished clothes in the market. Fortunately, the good service that Sabohat offers, and the good materials she uses, have helped her to expand her small factory. As a result of a large number of orders, she needs a loan for different kinds of fabrics so she may fill the orders. Sabohat thanks you for your trust and support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: A. Mavjuda is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children. For more than six years, Mavjuda has run her own business. She has a small shop where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large; consequently, there are lots of marriages and Mavjuda has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to her family’s income. Today Mavjuda requests $2000 which she is going to use to purchase more new wedding dresses. Mavjuda has earned a reputation for taking responsibility for her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase new wedding dresses

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.en: Niginamo is married with three children. She sells clothing at the local market. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Niginamo believes her consistent efforts and perseverance have helped her achieve success in her business. She is willing to work hard to see her business expand. She wants to continue to support her family which is why she hopes to keep her business sustainable and receive a stable income. Niginamo says she will put in many hours to get the job done and make sure that her venture achieves its full potential. She is requesting a loan of $1500 US to increase her inventory. loans.use: To increase working capital for business development

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is a married woman with one child. Her husband is an entrepreneur and his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So, understanding that, Matluba learned to sew dresses. Then she bought herself a simple old sewing machine. Matluba started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men's and women’s national dress on demand. But now she understands that her simple sewing machine is not good enough to sew better designed dresses. So Matluba decided to purchase a new sewing machine with better technology and sew better dresses for her clients. loans.use: To purchase a computer-based sewing machine

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.en: Sadridin is married and has four children. He sells foodstuffs from his little food store. His business is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Sadridin knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 12 years. His business has been consistently stable. Sadridin is hoping to invest a loan of 5000 somoni in additional merchandise which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Sadridin's vision is to expand his business and the loan will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Sadridin to persist, take small steps at a time, and achieve success, which seems to be absolutely inevitable. loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Shogado

texts.en: Shogado is married and lives with his wife and five children. He sells men's clothing at the central market. Shogado has been in this business for 14 years. He is young and full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income in their family. Shogado would like to borrow $1500 US to increase his clothing assortment. He plans to increase sales during the coming spring season and he needs to get ready for it. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 41-year-old married man, the father of three kids. He has specialized in making the tastiest Arabic sweets ever for the past 25 years. His father's shop opened in 1973 and he inherited the business. His sweets are like homemade ones; they are tasty and smell great. Everyone in the region is his client, in addition to relatives, friends, friends of friends, and passersby.

Bilal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the sixth time. All his previous loans were for improving his business and had great impact. He has been a great borrower, since his repayment history is perfect. This time the loan isn't for his business – it's requested to pay for his children's school fees. He hopes to provide the best education for his children; one that he couldn't get.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 20 years old and married with one child who is one year old. She is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where she has been farming for three years. Her mixed farm produces eggs, vegetables and tomatoes which are sold at the local market. 

Anne has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to expand her business and save for the education of her children. She would like to buy at least four dairy cows and a chuff cutter in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: V. Mavjuda sells women's clothes at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Mavjuda has been in this business for 12 years. She has a very good location that brings many clients her way. A large assortment provides them with good choice and increases her sales. Mavjuda is a very warm and caring person. She treats her clients well and they come back. Mavjuda is requesting a loan of $2,300 to purchase an assortment of spring clothing. Mavjuda hopes to diversify her clothing so she can offer her clients what they need. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase working capital with the purpose of developing the business.

loans.name: Uwele Group

texts.en:
Hamida M., who is in her mid-thirties, is married. She sells food and "bites" (snacks) to school children at a school just outside the city centre.  She works from 9:30am to 5:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamida's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants a loan to increase her stock of food and snacks.  Her dream is to have a wholesale shop selling hardware.

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, Uwele, which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans. 

In the picture, Hamida is in front row, first on the left in a flowered dress.

loans.use: To increase her stock of food and snacks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, age 41, has worked as a taxi driver since 1995. He and his wife have three children. Haydar works hard to provide for his family and to keep his car in good shape in order to keep his business moving ahead. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua so as to do necessary maintenance on his car. He also plans to buy a new television and a washing machine for his family, since those he has are currently inoperable. 

Haydar has a good reputation, and he sometimes receives requests for transportation across the country. Such long-distance requests benefit his family's income greatly, and he considers these trips a source of unexpected extra income that is helpful in bad times. He hopes to expand his business by buying an additionA. car.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance repairs on his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan has been a livestock farmer since 1996. He raises calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has three children who he needs to support and give a proper education. Hasan has improved his financial situation considering that he has been engaged in this type of business for a long time. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (such as dairy products) to the surrounding community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Hasan is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en: S. Orifjon is a married father with 4 children. Orifjon has been a farmer for the last 17 years. Farming is a passion to him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce he produces on his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all his land because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees so was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant his whole farm. Orifjon is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Doricah

texts.en:
Doricah has been in the farming business for seven years now. She has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her farm produces vegetables, tea, milk, and coffee that are all sold locally. She also operates a kiosk in the same location.

Doricah is 35 years old, married, and has four children who all attend school.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to have a total of three dairy cows and acquire more land to expand her farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, age 46, has owned a grocery store for eight years. He and his wife have two children, and he is requesting his fifth loan from A. Majmoua for a number of reasons: to buy extra products to sell in his shop, to pay his children's school fees, and to buy a wedding day gift for his daughter. Mahmoud is a hard worker who retired from his career as a soldier in order to settle down into a lucrative business. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his business, and he has proved himself to be a highly dependable borrower. He hopes to expand his business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy extra products to sell in his shop, to pay his children's school fees, and to buy a wedding day gift for his daughter

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Lucy T., who is in her late thirties, is married with 5 children. She has had a cosmetics business for one year. She works from 3:00pm (afternoon) to 6:00pm, for just three hours, and is able to make a small monthly profit. She sells her products from door to door.

This will be Lucy's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more cosmetics and has successfully paid back the loan.  She wants a loan to increase her stock.  Her dream is to buy iron sheets to build her mother a house.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group, Ebenezer, which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Lucy is holding a small baby in the front row.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anogile Group

texts.en:
Kisa M., who is in her early thirties, is married with four children.  She has been operating a food business for two years. She works from 7:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Kisa's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to increase her food business inventories.  Her dream is to open a shop for selling cosmetics and clothes.

Kisa will share this loan with her loan group, Anogile, which has a total of sixteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Kisa is in the front row in a green dress.

loans.use: To increase stock of her food business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est âgée  de 63 ans. Elle habite à Baye Laye. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a démarré par la  vente d’huile de palme mais actuellement elle commercialise l’encens. Par soucis de ne pas rester inactive elle a choisi cette activité qui pourra lui générer des revenus. Elle  est mère de famille et a  à sa charge des orphelins. La vente de thiouraye lui procure beaucoup de bénéfices surtout en période de froid. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis aout 2000 et sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs. Son intention est de se procurer de l’encens avec l’intégralité de la somme financée  en vue de renforcer son stock et aussi de mieux développer son commerce. Madame S. souhaite accroitre ses revenus, renforcer son épargne pour mieux entretenir sa famille. Ses financements lui permettent d’éviter la dépendance financière.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou S. is 63 years old.
She lives in Baye Laye. 
She is married and has been in retail trade for more than 5 years. 
She started by the sale of palm oil but currently she markets incense. 
She decided to remain active and chose this activity which will be able to generate income. 
She is a mother and cares for orphans. 
The sale of thiouraye (an aromatic herbal based incense oil) especially gets her many benefit in periods of cold.
She is member of the credit unioon of Baye Laye since August 2000 and requests a credit of 250.000 frs. 
The intent is to get incense with the entirety of the sum financed in order to increase her stock and also to better develop her trade.
 Mrs S. wishes to increase her income, to reinforce her saving for better maintaining her family. 
Her financings will enable her to avoid financial dependence.

loans.use: augmentation fond

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. He has been in the farming business for eleven years and sells his maize, french beans, potatoes and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle transport business in the same area. He is 42 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children who attend school.

He has requested for a loan of 47,700Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his two children. He plans to construct rental houses in the future to help supplement his farming income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad is an 18-year old single man who has worked as a barber for four years. Mouhamad is requesting a loan from al Majmoua, in order to buy extra chairs for cutting hair, in addition to an extra shower chair.   As he stated, "More chairs, less time, more income!"   Mouhamad is liked by most of his neighbors, and all of them wish him the best.   He hopes to succeed in his business since he couldn't succeed in education.

loans.use: To buy new chairs for cutting hair, in addition to a shower chair

loans.name: Keba

texts.fr: Monsieur Keba Cissé est un homme de 42 ans qui habite  à Baye Laye. Il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Il exerce l’activité d’artisan depuis 1990 et confectionne des sacs. Monsieur Cissé a d’abord été tailleur avant de se convertir en artisan. Il a surtout été attiré par l’aspect rentable de cette activité. Aussi l’ONG CARITAS l’a beaucoup encouragé à faire son choix. Monsieur Cissé sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour compléter  son fond car il a gagné un marché et doit livrer des sacs qui ont été commandés. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de gagner dignement sa vie.
texts.en:
Mr Keba Cissé is a 42 year old man who lives in Baye Laye. 
He is married and father of 4 children. 
He carries on the activity of artisan since 1990 and makes bags. 
Mr Cissé initially was tailor before converting himself into artisan.
 He was especially attracted by the profitable aspect of this activity. 
Also ONG CARITAS encouraged him much to make his choice. 
Mr Cissé requests a credit of 150.000 frs designed to supplement his funding because he gained a market client and must deliver bags which were ordered. 
This financing will enable him to increase his well being and to earn his living with dignity.

loans.use: augmentation fond

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a farmer from the town of Litein in western Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His mixed farm is currently producing eggs which are sold to the local market. He is 40 years old and married with no children.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The proceeds from this loan will enable him meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes that in the next 5 years he will be supplying broilers to the local hotels in the area.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 37-year old single man and owner of an electrical goods shop since 2006.   He has 15 years of experience in this area. Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the 8th time, in order to buy new items to offer.   All his previous loans helped in getting better prices from the market. Samer is an excellent borrower, in addition to being a smart businessman. His clients come from everywhere, and his work is improving day after day. Samer hopes to expand his business and start wholesale trade some day.

loans.use: To buy new items to offer

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar G. est un jeune habitant de Baye laye. Il est âgé de 33 ans. Il a d’abord été chauffeur  de clando avant de se lancer dans le commerce depuis un an. Il se sert de sa voiture, achète  des marchandises  et fait  des placements auprès de ses clients.  Son choix a été surtout motivé par l’aspect rentable de l’activité. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juillet 2004. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur dans l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de parfums qui seront destinés à la vente. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr Matar G. is a young inhabitant of Baye Laye. 
He is 33 years old. 
He has initially been driver of unregistered taxi before launching out in the trade for one year.
 He makes use of his car, buys goods and transports them to his customers. 
This choice was especially justified by the profitable aspect of the activity. He is member of Baye Laye credit union since July 2004. He already refunded a former loan in the institution. He requests a credit of 150,000 frs envisaged for the purchase of perfumes which will be intended for resale. This financing will enable him to better develop his trade.

loans.use: augmentation de fond

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES TRABAJANDO” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Elena, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Silvia y la secretaria de actas la señora Delfina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: elaboración de productos en macramé, librería, tejido a mano, venta de api (bebida caliente en base a harina de maíz morado, se sirve con empanadas fritas o buñuelos), carnicería, venta de ropa.
 
La señora Elena, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “MUJERES TRABAJANDO” desde hace quince meses.  La señora presidenta tiene como negocio, desde hace 20 años, el tejido artesanal de camas, se dedicó a este trabajo por necesidad, ella comenta que le faltaba dinero para cubrir las necesidades del hogar,  ahora ha solicitado su crédito para comprar una vaca en la feria de  Patacamaya.    La señora Elena, mujer adulta de 57 años de edad, está casada, es madre de ocho hijos.   
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajando” (Women Working) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing body the head of which is Elena, President.  Silvia is Treasurer and Delfina is Recording Secretary.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied: making macramé items, bookstore, hand knitting, sale of “api” (hot beverage made from purple corn that’s served with fried turnovers or fried dough), butcher shop and clothing sales.

Elena, communal bank President, states that she’s been a member of the “Mujeres Trabajando” communal bank for fifteen months.  Madame President has had an artisanal bed weaving business for 20 years.  She states that she needed money to cover household expenses.  On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy a cow at the Patacamaya livestock fair.  

Elena is an adult woman of 57 years, married and the mother of 8 children.  When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu H., who is in her mid-forties, is single and has two children.  She has been selling tea and snacks in a place called Sinza just outside the city center. She works from 5:00am to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mwajabu's 4th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She has paid back her previous Motisha loans successfully. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business by buying more drinks to resell.

Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group, Arusha, which has a total of fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Mwajabu is the first one on the left, in orange.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase capital by buying many food products to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Loudes requiere un crédito para la reparación y mantenimiento del vehiculo de su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer en el Sindicato de Transportes Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Lourdes es comerciante y su esposo es transportista. Estas actividades son la fuente de ingreso que tienen para su familia.

Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona de Valle Hermoso de la Ciudad La Paz.
texts.en: Lourdes needs a loan to service and repair her husband’s vehicle.  He works as a driver in the Miraflores Transportation Syndicate in the city of La Paz.  Lourdes is a merchant and her husband is in public transportation.  These activities are the source of income for their family.   She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s Valle Hermoso zone.

loans.use: For her husband's passenger transportation vehicle's repair and maintenance.

loans.name: María Ricardina

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que reside junto a su  hijo y su madre en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años dicha actividad la aprendió de su padre.

Ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado ya que la demanda aumenta y desea incrementar sus ventas, asimismo realizar algunos arreglos en sus corrales donde cría a su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María es una madre  soltera bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María, 22, is a mother living with her son and her mother in the Hualtaco hamlet in Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in Piura region, over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises sheep in her back yard to sell and when they reach a good level of development she sells them to various merchants that frequent the area where she lives.  She learned this skill from her father and has been doing it for four years.

She wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock since demand is rising and she wants to increase sales; she also wants to do some repairs to the corrals where she raises her livestock.  For this reason, she has thought it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a single mother who is quite devoted to her family; she is always watchful of their wellbeing and development.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Sumac Soncco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SUMAC SONCCO”; el banco  comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac,  provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzina; La socia tiene 21 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene un bar Restaurant club llamado Dayane; La socia invirtió todos los ahorros junto a su conyugue y les está yendo muy bien y desea invertir en la implementación del local y ponerlo cada vez más acogedor para que sus clientes se sientan a gustos rodeados D. una atmosfera relajante y muy bien decorada. La socia también alquila este su local a diferentes instituciones públicas y privadas en ocasiones especiales como eventos D. confraternidad entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. muebles y equipar con la decoración el restaurante bar club.

Los otros socios se dedican la carpintería, docentes, tenemos dos odontólogos, venta D. ropa, zapatero, un albañil y un maestro D. obras.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Luzina, 21, is a member of the “Sumac Soncco” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She has a restaurant/bar called Dayane.  She invested all her and her spouse’s savings and they are doing well.  She wants to invest in the locale making it even more welcoming so that her customers will feel comfortable surrounded by a relaxing and well-decorated ambience. She also leases out her locale to various public and private institutions on special occasions like fraternal events, among others.

She needs the loan to buy furniture and for the décor of the restaurant/bar.

The other members are carpenters, teachers, we have two dentists, clothing sales, a cobbler, a bricklayer and a master construction worker.

Luzina values the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy furniture to equip her restaurant/bar.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona se dedica a la crianza de ganado Lechero y solicita un crédito para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para mejorar sus volúmenes de leche y por ende sus ingresos.

Petrona vive con su esposo y un hijo en  casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi, Capital de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja en interior mina. 

Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Petrona's business is raising dairy cows and she is requesting a loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to improve her milk volumes and, consequently, her profits.

Petrona lives with her husband and child in her own home which is located in the town of Achacachi, capital of Omasuyos province, in La Paz department.  Her husband works down a mine.

This is Petrona's first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a pair of dairy cows to increase her milk sales volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home remodeling

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo German de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, se encuentra el puesto de frutas de Isabel, sus principales productos son las naranjas y mandarinas, las cuales trae desde el poblado de Kimiri. Todas las mañanas abre su puesto para atender con mucho cariño y respeto a todas las personas que desean comprar sus sabrosos productos, ya que sabe que si les brinda una buena atención, volverán. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta y así informarse de las cosas que pasan en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, puesto que el viaje es muy largo y cansado. En adelante, espera contratar una persona para que le ayude en la atención hacía los clientes. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siente que tiene la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, es por eso que es muy respetada por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más naranjas, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 45 year-old German, and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Isabel's fruit stall is located in La Merced town market.  The main products she sells are oranges and mandarins which she transports from the town of Kimiri.  Every morning she opens her stall to serve all the people who would like to buy her tasty products.  She serves her customers with a lot of affection and respect as she knows that if she provides good customer service they will come back.

What Isabel most likes about her work is chatting with her fellow saleswomen.  This is how she finds out what is happening in the market.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products since the journey is very long and tiring.  In the future, she hopes to hire somebody to help her serve her customers.

This is Isabel's first loan with MFP and she feels that she must make all her repayments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is very well respected by the her fellow group members.  Isabel will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more oranges to better stock her sales stall.

loans.use: To buy more oranges to better stock her business

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad y reside junto a su  esposa y sus dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío Cruceta del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hermes se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino en un corral ubicado en su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años dicha actividad la aprendió de su padre por ello cuenta con clientela establecida..

El desea adquirir alimento balanceado para engorde de su ganado ya que la demanda aumenta y también construir un nuevo corral para criar a su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Con esta ayuda podrá lograr su objetivo que es incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermes is a 48 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in his own home, in the small village of Cruceta, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a rural area of Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Hermes' business is selling sheep that he raises in a pen on his land.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit his area.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  He learned the trade from his father and so has an established customer base.

Hermes would like to acquire balanced animal feed to fatten his flock since demand is rising.  He would also like to build a new pen where he can raise his animals.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this help, he will be able to achieve his goal of increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” se formó con la unión de vA. vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas y preparación de comidas rápidas.
Pero como las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido fueron capaces de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Bonifacia es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de productos  varios y mini carga (crédito para teléfonos celulares muy común en las despensas del barrio) para la comunidad. Y necesita del crédito para aumentar el tamaño de su tienda de comestibles.
En fin, es un señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos.
texts.en:
The Tenacious Women Communal Bank was formed by the union of various neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of the bank’s members carry out different business activities like sales and preparing fast food.

However, as the members formed a very united group, they were capable of jointly carrying out their activities. This strengthens their camaraderie.

Bonifacia is one of the members of the bank.  She sells various products and “mini cargas” (credit for cell phones, which is very common in the neighborhood general stores) for the community.  She needs the loan to increase the size of her grocery store.

In closing, she is a very creative woman, and her customers greatly admire her work.

loans.use: Expand her grocery store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que Martha se dedica, es el cultivo de maíz y plátano. Todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que de ello depende para obtener una buena calidad de sus frutos y así asegura poder vender toda su producción y aumentar sus ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen. En adelante, espera sembrar todas sus tierras, pata obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más insecticidas, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas de insectos.
texts.en:
42 year-old Martha is a very sincere and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 47 year-old Alfredo, and her 3 beloved children who she would like to provide with a better future.

Martha's business is growing corn and bananas.  Every day, very early in the morning, Martha goes to work on her crops since she knows that she must do this if she wants to obtain good-quality produce, so that she can sell it all and increase her profits.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land since that makes her feel that all the months of hard work have borne fruit.  Martha has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land since there is always the risk that the chemicals will make her sick.  In the future, she hopes to sow all her land so that she can obtain better profits.

This is Martha's first loan with MFP.  She says that this support will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive of her fellow bank members.  Martha will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more insecticides since she would like her fields to be free of insect pests.

loans.use: To buy insecticides to eliminate insect pests

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
Ada habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo  que la labora como técnico en electricidad ya que  con estos ingresos le apoya con los gastos del hogar  para la mantención  de sus hijos que actualmente estudian y requieren de sus cuidados. Comerciante desde hace varios años de ropa usada y nueva; a la vez de algunos electrodomésticos tales como plancha, licuadora, cafeteras, etc. Se siente muy contenta ya que con el primer crédito que se le otorgo logro crecer  con mercadería como zapatos para poder tener un mejor ingreso y poco a poco cambiar su estilo de vida ya que sueña con comprar un tramo donde ella pueda ofrecer todas su mercadería, la mayor afectación de sus ventas fue debido a la alza de los precios. 
 Este préstamo será invertido en la compra de artículos escolares como. Cuadernos, borradores, tijeras, block, lapiceros entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ada is a resident of Ticuantepe municipality, where she lives with her husband, an electrician. His earnings help with the household expenses and to support their children who are in school and need their care. Ada has been selling new and used clothing for several years. Sometimes she also sells some small appliances like irons, blenders, coffee pots, etc. She feels very happy because this, her first loan, will help her increase her merchandise, like shoes, in order to bring in better earnings and little by little to change her quality of life. She dreams of buying a lot where she can offer all of her merchandise. In the past, the greatest effect on her sales was caused by an increase in prices.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies like notebooks, erasers, scissors, writing tablets, and pens, among other products.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for embroidering clothes

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar es chapista, arregla abolladuras y otros problemas de movilidades que han tenido accidentes de tráfico; el crédito lo requiere para adquirir herramientas modernas de trabajo, lo cual facilitara el trabajo en menos tiempo. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingreso que tiene el para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa de su suegra ubicada en la Zona de Tacagua  de la Ciudad La Paz. 

Cesar está casado y tiene un hijo. Está satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.
texts.en: Cesar is a “chapista;” he repairs dents and other problems on vehicles that have been in traffic accidents.  He needs the loan to acquire modern work tools that will facilitate his work and cut time.  This activity is his source of income to support his family.  He lives in his mother-in-law’s house located in La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  Cesar is married and has a son.  He’s satisfied with the loans we’ve granted him.

loans.use: To buy tools for his auto detailing job.

loans.name: Gloria Liliam

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Ella reside junto a sus padres y hermana en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a sus vecinos en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio donde ofrece también productos de consumo diario, golosinas y bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años y desde entonces con muy buena acogida, debido a la buena atención que ofrece a su clientela.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Gloria ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, permitiéndole incrementar sus ingresos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Gloria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives together with her parents and sister in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in Piura province, in the region of the same name, which is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Gloria's business is selling cosmetics through catalogs.  She offers her products to her neighbors in a small store located in her home.  In her store she also offers her customers essentials, candy and drinks such as beer and sodas.  She has owned her business for three years and it is very popular owing to the good customer service that she provides.

The growing demand that Gloria's store is experiencing has led her to think of expanding it and acquiring more products.  This will allow her to increase her profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Gloria is a hard-working woman of good character.  Those who know her have a great deal of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Land Purchase

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and separated. She has some university education and is requesting a loan to cover educational costs so that she can continue her studies. She currently works as an office assistant to help with some of her educational expenses. She has been working for nine years and hopes that this loan will help her obtain her degree and further develop her career.

loans.use: School Expenses

loans.name: Alicia Angelica

texts.es:
Alicia, de 61 años, vive al lado de su esposo Aníbal (61), que es profesor, y de sus dos hijos mayores de edad. 

Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica, desde hace 18 años, a la repartición de comida en un comedor popular de su zona, empieza al mediodía y termina a las dos  de la tarde, además  dice que le gusta mucho esta labor pues esta acostumbrada y es muy conocida por las buenas raciones que brinda. Además, desde las seis de la tarde, todos los días  instala una pequeña parrilla afuera de su casa y empieza con la venta de trozos de pollo y carne a la parrilla, junto a su hija menor, y esta muy satisfecha pues tiene muchos comensales a diario es por esta razón que obtiene regulares ganancias. Alicia tiene muchos planes para el futuro y uno de ellos es comprar una pequeña máquina productora de panes con hot dogs calientes para empezar este productivo negocio junto a su nuera. 

Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de una máquina productora de panes con hot dog calientes pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias para terminar de construir su casa de material noble.

Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Alicia, 61, lives with her husband, Aníbal, 61, who is a professor, and her two adult children.

This dedicated woman has been selling food in a popular eatery in her neighborhood for 18 years.  She starts at noon and finishes at two in the afternoon.  She says she enjoys the work very much because she’s used to it and is very well known thanks to the good portions she provides.  Besides, from six in the evening on she sets up a small grill outside her house and starts to sell grilled chicken and meat daily with her youngest daughter.  She is very satisfied because she gets lots of diners daily and this produces regular profits.  Alicia has lots of plans for the future.  One of them is buying a small machine that produces hot dogs and hot bread to start this productive business with her daughter-in-law.

Alicia plans to use the requested funds to buy a machine that makes hot bread and hot dogs because she wants to improve her profits in order to finish building her house with substantial materials.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who make the money possible that will allow her to stay in business in search of progress.

loans.use: For a hot dog machine.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia G. C. vive junto a su esposo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de los Aquijes. La Sra. Felicia es propietaria de un automóvil que alquila diariamente. Su esposo trabaja como chofer del vehiculo. La Sra. requiere el crédito para hacerle mantenimiento a su vehiculo. Su sueño segun nos comenta es comprar un nuevo vehiculo. La Sra. está muy agrdecida por el crédito que le podamos otorgar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicia Gutiérrez C. lives with her husband.  She has her own house located in the Los Aquijes district.  

Felicia owns a car that she leases out daily.  Her husband works as the driver.  She needs a loan for vehicle repair and service. 

Her dream, according to her, is to buy a new car.  She is very grateful for the loan we might grant.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Manitos De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANITOS DE ORO” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un varón.  La asociación comunal “MANITOS DE ORO” está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Gloria, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Sonia y la secretaria de actas la señora Vicenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: comerciante de cosméticos, venta de chompas de macramé, productos de belleza, venta de dulces, venta de papa, venta de comida, venta de jugos,  librería, venta de ropa semi – nueva, venta de salchipapa (comida rápida que tiene papa frita y delgados trozos de salchicha retostada con aderezos de mayonesa, kepchup, mostaza y llajua – salsa picante de tomate, quirquiña y locoto).
 
La señora Gloria, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “MANITOS DE ORO” gracias a la invitación de su cuñada.  La señora Gloria tiene como negocio la venta de productos de Belleza AVON, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 3 años.   La venta de su mercadería es realizada de manera ambulante, a oficinas y domicilios donde se encuentran sus clientas.   La señora Gloria, mujer trabajadora de 44 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos.   El crédito que está solicitando le permitirá comprar más productos y  aumentar su capital.
texts.en:
The “Manitos de Oro” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has eleven members, ten women and one man.  Manitos de Oro is led by a governing board at the head of which is Gloria, President.  It also includes Sonia, Treasurer, and Vicenta, Recording Secretary.  The members have a variety of businesses such as: cosmetics merchant, sale of macramé sweaters, sale of beauty products, candy sales, potato sales, food sales, juice sales, bookstore, semi-new clothing sales, sale of salchipapas [fast food made of fried potatoes and thin slices of grilled sausage with mayonnaise, catsup, mustard and llajua-a spicy tomato, quirquiña (herb) and locoto (hot pepper) sauce].

Gloria, communal bank president, states that she’s been part of Manitos de Oro communal bank thanks to an invitation from her sister-in-law.  Gloria’s business is selling Avon beauty products; she’s been in the business three years.  She sells her merchandise door to door at offices and homes where her customers can be found.  Gloria, 44, is a hard working woman living with her three children.  She will use the requested loan to buy more products and increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Gladys Erika

texts.es:
Gladys, D. 29 años, vive al lado D. su esposo José (30), que es chofer, y D. sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y esta labor le permite educar a sus hijos con esmero. Realiza su labor durante sus ratos libres y ofrece variedad D.  cosméticos enseñándole a sus amigas el catalogo D. dos marcas reconocidas, luego que ellas le piden, les trae los productos y le pagan al crédito. L. experiencia le ha enseñado a proveerse D. productos en stock y luego también los venD. al precio real por lo que obtiene ganancias extras. Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio, pues le permite no solo obtener dinero además le permite ganar electrodomésticos por L. cantidad D. ventas, y en el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su negocio e instalar un pequeño bazar en una pieza D. su casa. 

Gladys tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en productos D. belleza que necesita pues tiene muchos pedidos que espera concretar. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her husband José, who is 30 years old and a driver, and their two small children.  Together they work to make progress each day.  

This hardworking woman sells beauty products by catalog.  This job lets her raise her children with great care.  She works during her free time, offering a variety of cosmetics to her friends from two well known catalog brands.  Once they place orders, she delivers the products and they pay her on credit.  Experience has taught her to keep products in stock and then sell them for their real price for additional earnings.  She is very satisfied with her business because not only does it enable her to make money, but she can also win appliances for the number of sales she makes.  In the future she plans to expand her business and install a small shop in one of the rooms in her home.  

Gladys plans to use this loan to purchase beauty products which she needs because she has many orders which she hopes to fill.  

This is her first loan with MFP.  Gladys promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to leave a bad impression with the people who have provided the money that will allow her to continue working and get ahead.

loans.use: Beauty products for her to sell to customers

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.es:
Yennifer, de 18 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, al lado de ellos y de su hermana menor, juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Yennifer tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor, pues quiere aumentar la cantidad de platillos que ofrece, de esta manera espera seguir adelante. 

Desde muy pequeña esta trabajadora joven ayudaba a su madre en su restaurante, así aprendió a preparar muy bien diversos platillos. En la actualidad trabaja como socia de su madre en su restaurante, ella cocina y ofrece almuerzos durante el día, con  el apoyo de su mamá, y ya por las noches su madre ofrece caldo de gallina (sopa típica peruana) y ella la apoya; esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias. Trabajan de lunes a sábado durante parte de la mañanas y noches, así transcurren los días de esta joven, que a pesar de su corta edad ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de estudiar para ser abogada, pues ese es su sueño a largo plazo y sabe que lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Yennifer is 18 years old.  She lives with her parents and younger sister.  Together they all try to make progress each day. 

Yennifer plans to use this loan to purchase ingredients wholesale, because she wants to increase the number of meals she offers, and in this way get ahead.  

Since she was very young, this hardworking young woman has helped her mother in her restaurant.  She learned how to make many meals very well.  She now works as her mother's partner in the restaurant.  She cooks and offers lunches during the day, with her mother's help.  At night, her mother offers chicken soup (a typical Peruvian soup), and Yennifer helps.  She is very satisfied because she has regular earnings.  They work from Monday to Saturday for part of the morning and at night.  That is how this young woman spends her days, and despite her young age, she has many plans for the future such as studying to become a lawyer.  This is her long term goal and she knows she will achieve it with hard work and dedication. 

This is Yennifer's first loan with MFP.  She promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to leave a bad impression on the people who have made it possible for her to continue working to get ahead.

loans.use: For ingredients to increase the number of meals she offers

loans.name: Jireh Group

texts.es: Doña Lilian Amanda M. D. P. D. S., es casada, tiene 35 años D. edad, es perito contador, tiene 2 hijos, cuales esta estudiando, el prestamos lo utilizara para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, en la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo, cuenta con el apoyo D. sus esposo que se dedica a la talabateria, inicio su negocio a los 10 años D. edad, ayudando a su mamá aprendió y luego se independizó, por lo cual ella se decidio reunir a nueve compañeras para organizar un banco y solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo como capital D. trabajo para cada una D. ellas. Las integrantes D. este baco realizan actividades productivas como: comercio, artesania (bordado a maquina y a mano), y tienda D. consumo diario, esperan ver su negocio granD. uy contar con tiendas y suscursales para la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo.
texts.en: Doña Lilian Amanda M. D. P. D. S., is 35 years old and married.  She is an accounting expert and has two children who are in school.  She is requesting a loan to raise capital for her business which is selling cosmetics by catalog.  She has the support of her husband who makes leather goods.  She started this business when she was 10 years old, and learned by helping her mother.  She then began working independently and decided to get together 9 friends to organize a lending group and request a loan for each of them to invest as working capital   The members of this lending group work in various activities such as; business, crafts (hand and machine embroidery), and a convenience shop, They hope to see her business grow large and have stores and branches for catalog sales of cosmetics.

loans.use: Cosmetics sales

loans.name: Marvin Giovani

texts.en:
Marvin is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Both of his children are currently studying in school. Marvin went to school through the primary grades and currently works as a doorman at an electronics store in the highland region of Totonicapan, where he has been working for half a year. He started his work as a doorman at a high school. His wife works as a weaver. 

He is requesting a loan to pay fees and supplies for his own continued education. He wishes to receive a better education so that he can develop another career that will better support his family.

loans.use: to pay for schooling fees and supplies

loans.name: Palomas De La Villa Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Palomas de la Villa se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ella son la señora Joaquina Godínez Rodríguez va a comprar con su préstamo maíz, platos, papel estraza, servilletas, cueritos, aceite para surtir su negocio, la señora Manuela M. Hernández va a comprar carnes frías, sopa maruchas, mayonesa, chiles en vinagre para surtir su negocio, la señora Mariana Z. Hernández va a comprar con su crédito  carne, platos, vasos, un comal para surtir su negocio, la señora  Maricela M. G. va a comprar leche, cuajo, frutas para su yogurt vasos para surtir su negocio la señora Aurelia C. V. va a comprar platos, maíz, carne, aceite, carbón para surtir su negocio de venta de pozole y tostadas, la señora Mariana Z. Hernández es la representante del grupo, tiene 29 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo trabaja de albañil, ellos tiene 3 hijos Alondra tiene 8 años de edad estudia la primaria, Paloma tiene 3 años de edad y Joaquín tiene 13 años de edad ya no estudia se va con su papa a ayudarle a trabajar como peón de albañil, ella tiene su negocio de venta de taquitos de suadero, longaniza, carne enchilada los vende en la escuela primaria en la tarde, ella solicito su crédito para invertir en el negocio va a comprar carne, aceite, verduras, tortillas, platos, cucharas, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años ella aprendió viendo como preparaban los taquitos, anteriormente vendía tostadas, tacos de arroz ya después le ofrecieron vender los taquitos le dijo un maestro que si quería vender  y acepto, ella inicia con un dinero que tenia de las colchas y lo invirtió en la comida para preparar los taquitos, ella también vende zapatos, colchas, ropa interior por catalogo sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos y familiares en sus tiempos libres, su negocio esta a una cuadra de su casa llega caminando a la escuela primaria para vender los taquitos.
