Su negocio es importante porque va cayendo dinero para sus hijos y para ir comiendo, su parte favorita de este negocio es despachar, tener muchos clientes y se siente contenta de ver que les gustan los taquitos que ella prepara con mucho gusto para los niños y que están satisfechos sus clientes que son los niños y los maestros, su negocio es popular  porque es muy conocido por los niños por el buen sabor de los taquitos, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir en la comida para seguir vendiendo, para pagar el préstamo, para sus hijos, para la escuela, ella quiere comprar un brasero y un comal para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y lo piensa lograr por medio del préstamo, Cd. Ayala le gusta porque es bonito hay mucho ambiente muchas personas transitan por la calle, hay balnearios el Axocoche y el Colibrí en estos balnearios nace le agua hay arroyos donde va corriendo el agua que nace, celebran la navidad en grande hay misas del nacimiento del niño Dios a las 6:00 y a las 8:00 de la noche ya después de las misas se van a su casa y en las calles arrullan a los niños Dios le canta y lo arrullan, dan cubetas, jícaras, canastitas con colación, su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a salir adelante con sus hijos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son construir una nueva casa bien desde abajo y arreglarla bonito, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro de sus hijos son salir adelante darles estudio a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Mariana está feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque es una oportunidad que va a invertir en su negocio le va a ayudar mucho, las mejorías que desea para sus hijos son que estudien, que se superen y lo pienza logran con la ayuda de este préstamo como va invertir en el negocio de ahí va sacando para seguir comprando y para sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad Gracias por pensar en nosotras y gracias a ustedes salimos adelante en los negocios, gracias por otorgarnos el crédito se les agradece porque nos prestan con bajo interés y que siempre están pensando en nosotros.
texts.en:
This group is called Palomas de la Villa and is located in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, México.  It is composed of five women who are neighbors and who know each other.  They are:  Joaquina Godínez Rodríguez who will use her loan to buy corn, plates, brown paper, napkins, pork skin and oil to stock her business; Manuela M. Hernández who will use the loan to buy cold cuts, Maruchan soups, mayonnaise and chilies in vinegar to stock her business; Mariana Z. Hernández who will use her loan to buy meat, plates, drinking glasses and a griddle to stock her business; Maricela M. G. who will buy milk, rennet, fruit for her yoghurt and glasses to stock her business and Aurelia C. V. who will buy plates, corn, meat, oil and charcoal to stock her pozole and tostada sales business.

Mrs. Mariana Z. Hernández is the group representative.  She is 29 years old and finished 6th grade.  She’s married and her husband works as a bricklayer.  They have three children: Alondra, 8, who is in elementary school, Paloma, 3, and Joaquín, 13, who doesn’t go to school anymore and goes to help his father working as a bricklayer’s assistant.

She has a business selling suadero (thin cut of beef from the brisket) taquitos, longaniza and meat with chili at the local elementary school in the afternoons.  She asked for a loan to buy meat, oil, vegetables, tortillas, plates and spoons.  She started the business five years ago.  She learned by watching how the taquitos were prepared.  She used to sell tostadas and rice tacos and later was offered the opportunity to sell the taquitos.  A teacher told her that if she wanted to sell them she could and she accepted.

She started out using money she had from the bedspreads and invested it in food to prepare the taquitos.  She also sells shoes, bedspreads and underwear via catalogue.  She goes out daily to offer her wares to neighbors and relatives in her free time.  Her business is a block from home; she walks to the elementary school to sell the taquitos.

Her business is important because it produces money for her children as well as food to eat.  Her favorite part of the job is tending to the customers and she feels happy when she sees how much her customers, who are the children and teachers, like the taquitos that she prepares so gladly.  Her business is very popular because it’s very well known by the children because of the good flavor of the taquitos.  She uses profits from the business to reinvest in the food to continue selling, to repay the loan, for her children, for school.  She wants to buy a charcoal grill and a griddle to provide better service to her customers and intends to do so thanks to the loan.

She likes Ciudad Ayala because it’s very pretty, has a nice ambience and there are many passersby in the streets.  There are two spas: Axocoche and El Colibrí.  There are springs here and streams where the water from the springs runs.  Christmas is celebrated in grand scale.  There are Nativity masses at 6 and 8 at night.  After mass people return home to lull the Baby Jesus; they sing to him and lull him.  They hand out little buckets, gourds and little baskets with treats.

Her business has helped the family get ahead with the children.  The improvements she wants to make to her house are to rebuild it from top to bottom and fix it up nicely.  Her plans and hopes for the future of her children are to get ahead and provide an education for them and to have a better quality of life.

Mariana is happy with the loan she’s getting because it’s an opportunity she’s going to invest in her business and it will help her much.  

The improvement she hopes for her children is that they study and improve and she feels they will accomplish this with the loan’s help because she will invest it in her business and from it will be taking out a little to continue to buy and for her children.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: thank you thinking of us because thanks to you we get ahead in our businesses.  Thank you for granting the loan.  It is appreciated because you lend to us at low interest because you are always concerned for us.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, tortillas, vegetables, plates and spoons to stock her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Virgen de Juquila, se encuentra localizado en barrio San Miguel Cohuecan, estado de Puebla, México, esta integra por 7 mujeres trabajadoras que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Ernestina R. Ramírez va a comprar con su préstamo barro y tierra blanca para elaborar los jarros los vende crudos, la señora Petra Constantina V. M. va a comprar barro para la elaboración de las jarros, la señorita Luisa S. González va a comprar leña, barro, tierra blanca para la elaboración de las ollas y cazuelas, la señora Maura A. V. va a comprar barro, para la elaboración de los jarros rústicos, la señora Diana Martínez López va a comprar medicamentos, antiinflamatorios, jarabes, analgésicos, para surtir su farmacia, la señora Manuela S. S. va a comprar barro, leña, para la elaboración de sus pedestales, la señora Gabina R. A. va a comprar Barro y tierra blanca para elaboración de las cazuelas, la señorita Luisa S. González es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 36 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria obteniendo su certificado, ella es soltera vive con su mama y su hermano ellos se dedica a la alfarería elabora jarros cazuelas y ollas, ella solicito su préstamo para compra leña, barro y greta para surtir su negocio de los insumos y tener material para elaborar los jarros, cazuelas y ollas, ella inicio su negocio hace 28 años, ella veía como cortaba el barro su mama y fue aprendiendo solita, el negocio es familiar ahí trabajan todos los de la familia su negocio está en su casa y es muy importante su negocio porque se mantiene uno de ahí, a ella le gusta trabajar la alfarería elaborar las cazuelas y pintarlas, y está orgullosa porque trabaja, cuando hornea y toda la producción sale bonita, también le ha servido para la mayordomía hay 8 días de fiesta dan de comer a toda la gente, dan los arreglos, las ceras para la Iglesia, sus clientes son de Jaloxtoc, Ahuatlan, Tepetlixpa, su negocio es popular por el buen trabajo y terminado de los jarros, cazuelas y ollas, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el clima cuando llueve no se seca el barro, no se puede trabajar, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de que todo el pueblo trabaja en la alfarería, las ganancia las vuelve a invertir, para sobrevivir, para comer, para pagar el préstamo, ella está planeando surtir mas de material su negocio para tener almacenado y seguir trabajando junto con su mama y su hermano que también ellos le ayudan a pagar el préstamo, este negocio ha ayudado mucho a la familia a la alimentación a vivir mejor,  las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son repellar su casa, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro son seguir trabajando y que estén bien de salud, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo que le dan porque va a tener dinero para comprar el material. San Bartolo Cohuecan es un pueblo tranquilo, se ve el volcán Popocatepet e Iztaccihuatc en el mes de diciembre el volcán Popocatepet se ve rojo, siembran de temporal sorgo, maíz, cacahuate y cebolla, el 24 de Agosto celebran al santo patrono San Bartolo, dura 8 días la fiesta, le dan de comer a todo la gente del pueblo y visitantes, hay música, toritos, juegos pirotécnicos, hay promesas, danzas aztecas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, “muchas gracias por estos préstamos que nos dan y ojala nos presten con menos interés porque esta dura la situación y que no aumenten el interés para que nos alcance mas para los materiales”
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Virgen de Juquila' and is located in San Miguel Cohuecan neighborhood, in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  It is made up of 7 hard-working women who know each other and are neighbors.  They are Ernestina R. Ramírez, who will use her loan to buy clay and white clay to make pitchers that she sells unfired; Petra Constantina V. M., who will buy clay to make pitchers; Luisa S. González, who will buy firewood, clay and white clay for making pots and casserole dishes; Maura A. V., who will buy clay to make rustic pitchers; Diana Martínez López, who will buy medicines, anti-inflamatories, syrups and analgesics to stock her pharmacy; Manuela S. S., who will buy clay and firewood to make pedestals and Gabina R. A., who will buy clay and white clay to make casserole dishes.

Luisa S. González is a member of the group.  She is 36 years old and studied up to the 6th year of elementary school, obtaining her leaver's certificate.  She is single and lives with her mom and brother.  They work as potters, making pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  Luisa is requesting her loan to buy firewood, clay and white clay to stock her business with supplies so that she has the material she needs to make her pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  She started in her business 28 years ago, watching how her mom cut the clay, and she learned all on her own.  It is a family business and all her family work in it.  It is located in her home and is very important because she supports herself with it.

Luisa enjoys being a potter, making casserole dishes and painting them.  She is proud because she works, bakes her products and everything comes out beautifully.  It has also helped her to take a stewardship role in her community.  There are 8 days of fiesta each year when they feed everybody and provide the church with floral arrangements and candles.  Luisa's customers are from Jaloxtoc, Ahuatlan and Tepetlixpa.  Her business is popular because of the good work that she does and the finishing touches that she makes to the pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  The challenge that she faces in her business is the climate.  When it rains, the clay doesn't dry and she can't work.  Her business also faces competition because the whole village makes pottery items.  Luisa re-invests the profits that she makes back into her business, uses some to survive on, some to eat and some to repay her loan.  She is planning to stock her business with more material so that she can have some stored up.  She plans to continue working together with her mom and brother who will also help her to repay the loan.  This business has helped her family a lot.  It has provided them with the food they need and helped them to live more comfortably.

The improvement that Luisa would like to make to her home is to plaster it.  Her plans and hopes for the future are to continue working and for everyone to enjoy good health.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan because she will have money to buy the material she needs.

San Bartolo Cohuecan is a quiet village.  From it you can see the Popocatapetl and Iztaccihuatl volcanoes.  In the month of December, the Popocatapetl volcano turns red and they sow sorghum, corn, peanuts and onions.  Starting August 24th, they celebrate an 8-day-long fiesta dedicated to the patron saint San Bartolo (Saint Bartholomew).  They provide everybody in the village, and visitors, with food, there is music, bullfighting, fireworks, engagements and Aztec dances. 

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Many thanks for these loans that you give us.  We hope that you will lend to us at lower interest rates because the situation is difficult and let's hope the interest rates don't go up so that we have more money for our materials".

loans.use: To buy firewood, clay, white clay for making pitchers, pans and casserole dishes

loans.name: Rosalia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Rosalia de 21 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones para su familia. Por eso vende en el día encebollados (plato típico del Ecuador que se come con plátanos, pescado y pan). 

En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 haciendo encebollados. Cada plato lo vende a $ 1.50 y la mayoría de personas que comen el plato lo hacen en el desayuno. Quiere seguir prosperando por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas y sillas para que sus clientes se sientan cómodos comiendo el encebollado. En el futuro quiere asegurar la vida de sus hijos y tener su propia panadería.
texts.en: Rosalia is 21 and a hard worker with great aspirations for her family. On weekdays, she sells "encebollados," a typical Ecuadorian dish of fish, plantains, and bread.  Her cooking occupies her from 7 a.m. to noon, and she sells each dish at a price of  US$ 1.50.  Most of her clients enjoy her meals for breakfast. Rosalia wants very much to grow her business and seeks a loan to buy tables and chairs to better accomodate her customers. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's prospects by opening her own bakery.

loans.use: Tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increased inventory and product variety

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel F. T. es padre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos a los que desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Con este préstamo será el tercero que tramita en esta institución; el cual ha demostrado tener una cultura de pago muy buena. Con los créditos anteriores el levanto la barda de enfrente este nuevo desea instalar protecciones y un portor para obstruir el paso a personas desconocidas y así su familia mejor protegida.
texts.en:
Miguel F. T. is a father who is conceded about the wellbeing of his children and wants to offer them a better quality of life.  This loan will the his third with the institution; he has shown good repayment habits.

He used prior loans to erect a front wall and wants this one to install safety devices and a front gate to obstruct passage of unknown people thus having his family better protected.

loans.use: To install safety devices.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Yahve Yire, es una nueva Alcancía Comunal conformada por 7 integrantes muy entusiastas y con muchas expectativas, ya que piensan invertir el crédito que se les entregó en sus negocios o implementarlos. Ana María es la presidenta, tiene 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella es cosmetóloga desde hace 18 años,  nos cuenta que empezó con un espejo una mesita y lo básico para cortar cabellos y en un local alquilado pero con el resultado de su arduo trabajo logro comprar un local propio hace 5 años. Actualmente ella se siente establecida profesionalmente, ya que logro ampliar su negocio, pero esta triste a la vez por que tiene un hijo de diez años que sigue un tratamiento porque esta mal de los riñones a su corta edad. Ana María  anhela comprar una maquina  eléctrica para cortar cabellos y el crédito será invertido en adquirir productos como tintes para el cabello. Su sueño es tener su propio Spa de belleza. Su hija estudia cosmética dermatológica, y terminando ayudará a Ana  María en su salón de belleza para así poco a poco lograr su objetivo de poner un Spa . Los integrantes de la nueva Alcom “Yahve Yire” que significa El señor Proveerá están comprometidos  a hacer crecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yahve Yire is a new communal bank composed of seven very enthusiastic members who have high expectations because they plan to invest the loan they got in businesses or to set them up.

Ana María, 38, is the President.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s been a Cosmetologist for 18 years.  She tells us that she started out with just a little table and mirror and the basic tools to cut hair in a rented space.  However, as a result of her hard work she was able to buy her own locale five years ago.

Currently she’s well established professionally and she’s been able to expand her business.  At the same time, however, she’s sad because she has a 10 year old son who is still in treatment because of kidney disease at such a young age.

Ana María hopes to buy an electric hair clipper and the loan will be used to acquire products like hair dyes.  Her dream is to have her own beauty spa.

Her daughter is studying Dermatologic Cosmetics and when she finishes will help Ana María in her beauty salon so that gradually she can reach her goal of opening a spa.

The members of the new communal bank “Yahve Yire,” which means The Lord Will Provide, are committed to making their businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes.

loans.name: Rene Ruben

texts.en:
Rene is married with two children. He operates a minibus business, transporting students and workers around the highland region of Totonicapan. He has been working in the transport business for over eight years, and he started his business from the ground up. His wife works at home. 

He is requesting a loan to use as working capital for his minibus business in order to keep it running smoothly. He has hopes of growing his business with help from ASDIR and Kiva lenders. This is Rene´s 3rd loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: working capital for his minibus business.

loans.name: Creativa 4 Group

texts.es:
Yudelka es una D. nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta D. productos misceláneos como cosméticos, para uso del hogar, belleza, entre otros, su metodologia es venta ambulante, llevándolo a las casas D. sus clientes. Es una joven soltera D. apenas  26 años, trabaja con la finalidad D. proveer sus necesidades, estudiar y poder formar su familia en un futuro. Pertenece al grupo Creativas 4, compuesto por 5 micro empresarias, D. la ciudad D. Santo Domingo norte

Yudelka esta recibiendo su quinto prestamos con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido reforzar su negocio y hacer buenas inversiones, Sus planes para este nuevo préstamo es para invertir en la compra D. productos cosméticos, sandalias y algunas piezas D. ropa D. playa, ya que viene una buena temporada para estas ventas. las ganancias serán para reinvertido en estos mismo productos. Gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Yudelka is one of our enterprising women dedicated to selling miscellaneous products like: cosmetics, home use items, beauty supplies, among other.  She sells door to door taking her wares to her customers’ homes.  She is a young, single woman, just 26 years old.  She works with the goal of providing for her needs, to study and help form a family in the future.  She is a member of the Creativas 4 (Creative Ones 4) group which is composed of 5 micro entrepreneurs from north Santo Domingo.

Yudelka is getting her 5th loan from Esperanza Internacional thanks to her payments being timely.  He has managed to strengthen her business and make good investments.  Her plans for this new loan is to buy cosmetics, sandals and a few items of beach wear since a good season for sales is approaching.  She will reinvest profits into the same kind of products.  Thank you for your support.

loans.use: For miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Kory Ampara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY AMPARA” (en idioma aymara “Manos de Oro”) iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho mujeres, una característica que llamó la atención fue que de las ocho personas 7 tenían un bebé de pecho, sólo una de ellas era soltera y no tenía hijos;  al darse cuenta las señoras se rieron pues parecía que se hubieran puesto de acuerdo.

La asociación comunal “KORY AMPARA” está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Rosalía, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Tiburcia y la secretaria de actas la señora Teresa.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: tienda de barrio y carnicería, elaboración de fajas, carpintería, venta de comida, artesanía-macramé, una socia iniciará el negocio de costura.
 
En el caso de la señora Rosalía, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que tiene como negocio el trabajo de elaborar macramé en las mantas. Su mamá le enseñó el macramé, realiza esta actividad desde hace diez años.   El trabajo es realizado a pedido de sus clientes.  Ahora la señora Rosalía piensa que podrá comprar una máquina bordadora para adornar las mantas,  también necesita comprar flecos para realizar el macráme de las mantas que fueron ya encargadas por sus clientes.
La señora Rosalía, mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los bajos intereses, la garantía solidaría.
texts.en:
The Kory Ampara group ("Hands of Gold" in the Aymara language) will start their first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Point for Germán Busch.  The group is composed of eight women.  One notable feature of the group is that of the eight members, seven had recently given birth and only one was single with no children.  Upon realizing this, the ladies laughed because it seemed as if this had been doe on purpose.

The Kory Ampara association is directed by a board headed by its president, Rosalía.  Tiburcia is also the treasurer and Teresa the recording secretary.   The businesses in which the group participants engage are varied: a convenience store, a butcher shop, belt making, woodworking, food sales, crafts, macrame, and a sewing business.

Rosalía, the association's president, makes blankets using macrame techniques.  Her mother taught her to macrame, which she has done since she was ten years old.  She takes on jobs at the request of her customers.  Rosalía is thinking of buying an embroidery machine to decorate rugs.  She also needs to purchase macrame fringes for the blankets that were already ordered by her customers.  

Rosalía, a hard-working, 25-year-old woman, lives with her two children and her husband.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the low interest rates and the group liability agreement.

loans.use: Purchase of an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Yazmin

texts.es: Yazmin R. R. y su esposo son una pareja muy joven que comienza a formar su patrimonio para ofrecer a sus futuros hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Yazmin es un mujer muy trabajadora por lo que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar desde hace 1año el cual desea surtir en mercancía de ropa de temporada así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Yazmin R. R. and her husband are a very young couple who have started to build their wealth in order to offer their children a better quality of life. Yazmin is a very hard-working woman, so for the last year, she has been selling used clothing and home goods on the weekend. She wants to stock up on seasonal clothing so she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to stock seasonal clothing

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel Ramírez C.  es un joven muy trabajador que desea prepararse cada día mejor académicamente. El hace unos meses se graduó de la universidad pero a aun esto no lo detiene a estudias un lengua extranjera. Joel en este momento solicita del apoyo para poder pagar un curso de Ingles y comprar libros de esta manera podrá obtener mejores ofertas de trabajo y así sus ingresos sean incrementados.
texts.en: Joel Ramírez C. is a very hard working young man who wants to improve his education every day. He graduated from university a few months ago but even this will not stop him from studying a foreign language. Now, Joel is requesting a loan to pay for an English course and to buy his books. This will help him obtain better job offers and therefore increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for an English course

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 52  años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.  

Otilia, se dedica a la Venta de ropa de segunda mano. Por lo que cuenta con  clientes fijos que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. También va de casa en casa a ofrecer su  mercadería a sus amistades más cercanas, así como a los pueblos aledaños semanalmente. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado, ya que genera sus propios ingresos, que lo utiliza para cancelar sus cuotas mensuales de su banco comunal. Otilia es una mujer emprendedora y a su edad se siente capaz de seguir ejerciendo su negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas en fardos como: pantalones en diferentes colores, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para damas, caballeros y  niños. 

Agradece la oportunidad que le ofrece el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de  contar con los préstamos que la ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Otilia belongs to the "Las Aguerridas II" ("The Brave Women II") Communal Bank in the district of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín.  She is married, 52 years old, and the mother of four children who are all independent now.

Otilia sells second-hand clothing. She counts on regular customers who she knows and who are familiar with her business. She also goes house-to-house offering her merchandise to her friends nearby, and travels weekly to adjacent villages. The fortitude and perseverance that characterize her also help her to grow as an independent woman, and she is very proud of what she has achieved. She is generating her own income, which she uses to make her monthly repayments to her communal bank. Otilia is a very enterprising woman and at her age she feels capable of continuing with her business.

She will use this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to buy bales of clothing for women, men, and children, such as: different colors of pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses in every size and style, polo shirts, and dresses.

She is grateful for the opportunity offered by Movimiento Manuela Ramos, whose loans are helping her to develop as a woman and small business owner.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Willian Enrique

texts.es:
Willian de 48 años, empezó hace 10 años atrás con su negocio  de venta de bisutería. Haciendo pulseras con materiales de madera, tagua. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y fue conocido porque el mismo hacia las bisuterías. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm en un puesto vendiendo artesanías de madera y tagua con ayuda de un familiar. También realiza grabados de nombres en las artesanías de madera al instante. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y haciendo diversas bisuterías. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hilos, tagua, madera para hacer diversas bisuterías. Su meta de aquí en los próximos años es tener su propio local ya que ahora tiene un puesto en la calle.
texts.en:
Willian is 48 years old and started a business ten years ago selling trinkets. He makes bracelets made of wood and ivory palm nuts. His business has grown over time and he is now known because of his trinkets.

Willian currently works from 8am to 6pm at his vending post where he sells wood and palm nut trinkets with the help of a relative. He also does on-the-spot engraving of names on the wooden pieces. Willian has aspirations for his business because he wants to continue working and making different trinkets.

Willian will use this loan to buy thread, ivory palm nuts, and wood for making different trinkets. His goal within the next few years is to open his own shop since he currently has a vending post on the street.

loans.use: Purchase thread, wood, and ivory palm nuts for making trinkets

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Mirlanda is one of many enterprising women who sells goods, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, canned products, vegetables and other products. She is a young mother of 3, and they live together with her long term partner. Mirlanda's most difficult challenge is to work hard to own her own home. While she works to reach her dream, she will continue enjoying to work and attending to her family. She is part of the group called Luz y Progreso, which consists of 10 micro-entrepreneurs from the city of Samana, located in the northeast coast.

She is receiving her 6th loan from Esperanza International. Thanks to her prompt repayments, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments. Her plans for this new loan are to invest in the purchase of food & musical equipment. The earnings will be reinvested in more goods and savings. Mirlanda is grateful for the support.

loans.use: Purchase food & musical equipment

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Agueridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Jessica, inició su negocio con la venta de jugos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y de esta manera, hoy en dia implementó su  negocio de Venta de Abarrotes. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria.  Ahora ha  ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.

Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija, entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar, donde allí encuentran todo lo necesario y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma y simpatía que la caracterizan. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos de productos como: leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras de la zona, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Jessica está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Aguerridas II”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of two dependent children.

Jessica started a business selling juices. By saving a little bit over time, she was able to open a grocery store that she manages to this day. Jessica has always been known for her fighting spirit. The desire to succeed on her own led her to become a businesswoman. She has now gained experience, confidence, as well as recognition and respect from her customers. Now she has an established customer based that consists of local friends, residents, and neighbors who come by her store to shop. She offers everything they need and personally attends to her customers with her charisma and charm.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy different types of products such as milk, cases of canned fish of various brands, oatmeal packets, tea in different flavors (chamomile and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Jessica is content with the business that she manages every day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La Sra. Anita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y es madre de 01 hija, que aun depende de ella.

Anita se dedica a la venta de ropa, cuenta con  clientes fijos que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. También va de casa en casa a ofrecer su mercaderia a sus amistades más cercanas, que son clientes seguros. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza la ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y está muy orgullosa con lo logrado, ya que genera sus propios ingresos mensuales, que lo utiliza para cancelar sus cuotas mensuales de su banco comunal. Hoy en dia, con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, es una mujer emprendedora y se siente capaz de seguir realizando muchos sueños aun.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas como: pantalones en diferentes colores, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para damas, caballeros y  niños. 

Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ofrece el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los préstamos que la ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.  Cree que vale el sacrificio que ejerce dia a dia, tiene muchos sueños y metas por cumplir.
texts.en:
Sra. Anita belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Aguerridas II”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of a daughter who is dependent on her.

Anita sells clothes and has established customers who know about her business. She also goes from house to house, offering her merchandise to her closest friends who are regular customers. Anita is known for her strength and perseverance, which helps her grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of her accomplishments since she is able to generate a monthly income which she uses for her payments to her Communal Bank. Today, with great dedication and effort, Anita is an enterprising woman who feels capable of pursuing many more dreams to come.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy clothes such as trousers in different colors, shorts, sneakers, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and outfits for women, men, and children. Anita is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing loans to help her develop as a woman and a small business owner. She believes daily sacrifice will help her accomplish her many dreams and goals.

loans.use: Purchase different types of clothes for women, men, and children

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. Eva pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

El fuerza luchadora, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Juanes (plato típico) en las afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Trabaja también con pedidos de algunas entidades, para diferentes eventos, ya que su sazón es muy buena. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Eva M, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día  y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalyptus) which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of two dependent children who are in school.

Eva is a strong determined woman who has always been known for her desire to succeed through her own abilities. She started her own business selling “juanes” (a traditional Peruvian dish) outside of her home. Over time she has become well-known among her customers and today she says she is doing very well in her business. Eva also receives orders from a few organizations for different events because her food tastes good. She has been working in her business for several years and is very happy to be doing what she does.

With this loan of 1500 PEN, Eva will buy supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, native hens for making “juanes”, butchered chickens for making kebobs, and cooking utensils so that she can provide quality service to her customers and pensioners.

Eva M, as she is affectionately called, is very proud of the work she does day after day. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & cooking utensils

loans.name: Maria Odilia

texts.es: La señora Maria Odilia T. Ramírez desde hace años quedo viuda por lo que tuvo que salir adelante para mantener los gastos de la familia. Odilia cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años, donde ofrece variedad de estilos y tallas para el gusto de cada persona. En este momento desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Odilia T. Ramírez has been a widow for several years, so she has had to move forward in order to cover the family finances. Odilia has been managing a business selling used clothes for three years. She offers a variety of styles and sizes that suits all tastes.

At the moment, she requests a loan so that she can restock her business with seasonal clothing.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Artemio

texts.es: El señor José Artemio V. T. es un hombre muy trabajador  que la mayoría del día se la pasa fuera de su casa, al igual que su esposa para apoyarse con los gastos. Artemio desea instalar protecciones en las ventanas en su casa para brindar a su familia mayor seguridad y mejor vista a su vivienda, para poder realizar su proyecto necesita capital para realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. José Artemio V. T. is a hardworking gentleman who spends most of his day away from home. Likewise, his wife also helps with the expenses.

Artemio wants to install metal grilles on the windows of his house to provide his family greater security and to improve the appearance of his home. He requests the necessary capital to complete this project.

loans.use: Install metal grilles on the windows of his home

loans.name: Jessica Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”,  del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 27 años y es madre de una niña que aun dependen de ella.

Jessica Irene, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, hace 03 años viene dedicándose a la  venta de Lenceria en las marcas Leonisa y Peter Pan, esta actividad la realiza en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan.  Nos cuenta que en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, inició su actividad comprando sus productos para tenerlo en stock.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles comprará lencerías como: sostenes, bikinis, calzones, bockser, pijamas, todo esto en diferentes tallas, modelos y colores,  para damas, caballeros y niños.


Jessica Irene, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y perseverando día a día.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Irene belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Aguerridas II”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, single, and the mother of a daughter who is dependent on her.

Jessica Irene is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past three years, she has been selling lingerie from the Leonisa and Peter Pan brands. She operates her business from her home, where she attends to her customers who come by day after day. Jessica says that she is happy because her business has done very well. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she started her business by purchasing products to build up her inventory.

With his loan of 800 PEN, Jessica will purchase undergarments such as bras, bikinis, socks, boxers, and pajamas in different sizes, styles, and colors. She will have products for women, men, and children.

With great strength, Jessica Irene believes that she can continue to work and persevere each day. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her find opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for women, men, and children

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marleni, tiene 2  hijos,  es conviviente  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Marleni  es integrante  del grupo “Madres Unidas”, grupo conformado por 12  integrantes. Marleni trabaja vendiendo dulces  desde hace 8 años y a su vez también vende comida en su casa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado comprar un terreno y así brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería  y seguir vendiéndolos. Sabemos que Marleni   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Sra. Marleni is in a common law marriage and has two children. She has been working with EDAPROSPO for one year. Marleni is part of the group “Madres Unidas” (United Mothers), which consists of twelve members. She has been selling sweets for eight years and also sells food from her home. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she was able to buy a plot of land so that she could provide her children a better quality of life.

To keep growing, Marleni is requesting a new loan to buy supplies so that she can continue making sales. She will be able to accomplish her goals through work, effort, and the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Flor De Mburukuya Group

texts.es:
El comité “Flor De Mburukuya” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Es un grupo que lleva un buen tiempo trabajando con nosotros. Se muestran bastante sólidas y responsables, tienen muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya.
La sra. Betsabe es la presidenta del grupo, ella encamina el comité en el que todas las miembros se dedican a la venta de alimentos; ella desea invertir su crédito en la ampliación del local donde vende sus comidas, para poder atraer más a los clientes y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The committee “Flor de Mburukuya” was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joining together.

This group has had a good time working with Fundación Paraguaya. The members have demonstrated that they are strong and responsible individuals. They are eager to continue working with Fundación Paraguaya.

Sra. Betsabe is the president of the group who heads up the committee for all of the members. She has a business selling food and wants to invest her loan in expanding her establishment. This will enable her to attract more customers and generate better revenues.

loans.use: Expansion of a food business

loans.name: La Independencia Group

texts.es: Doña Maria Antonia O. C., es soltera, tiene 27 años de edad,tiene como profesion maestra de educacion primaria, quiere solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo en la venta de ropa para niños, ya que quiere ser comerciante, inicia su negocio en su casa, quiere ver un negocio prospero con muchos clientes, por este motivo se decidio a reunir unas compañeras para formar un grupo y solicitar un prestamo que les beneficie a todos los miembros, las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: venta de ropa de niños, venta de comida, venta de productos de tienda y venta de lociones. Esperan mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del prestamos que hacen a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Antonia M. O. is single, 27 years old, and a primary school teacher. She wants to apply for a loan to invest in selling children's clothing since she wants to be a merchant. She is starting her business at home and hopes to see a thriving business with many customers. For this reason she decided to gather some colleagues to form a group and apply for a loan that will benefit all members. 

The members of this group work in various activities like selling clothes for children, food sales, store sales,  and sale of lotions. They hope to improve their living conditions through the loans they request from ASDIR.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eloisa Francisca

texts.es:
Eloisa es una madre D. familia D. 40 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Ascope, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia D. Trujillo en la Región La Libertad, ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. calzado por catalogo para todo tipo D. edades. El tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y la calidad del calzado le permite que sus clientes la recomienden y así generar más ventas D. esta manera cuenta con una clientela fija.

Eloisa desea adquirir más calzado con nuevos diseños ya que se acerca la temporada escolar y por enD. su cantidad D. clientes aumente más. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores D. la zona en donD. resiD.. Las personas que le conocen le consideran como una persona con ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eloisa is a mother, 40 years old, and lives with her husband and children in the Ascope district, a rural area that belongs in the Trujillo province in the Liberty region located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells shoes for all ages by catalog. The time she has spent working and the quality of her shoes has allowed to have a stable clientele since they recommend her.

Eloisa wants to acquire more shoes with new designs since the back to school period is coming and her clientele grows even more. She wants to request Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan to help her with these goals.

She is well known and respected by the townspeople in her area. The people who know her consider her to be a person with a drive to succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: David 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Altagracia es una de nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta y elaboración de pan y dulces caseros, ella prepara dulces de coco, leche y pastas o mermeladas de frutas, con las cuales combina los dulces, y elabora el pan de harina de trigo. Su préstamo es para la compra de un saco de Harina de trigo, cientos de coco, azúcar, leche y otros ingredientes. Los cuales vende en su comunidad y en la ciudad de Romana, conocida como un mega del turismo y de la elaboración de azúcar.

Altagracia tiene 5 hijos, los cuales aun viven con ella, junto al padre de sus dos hijos menores. Es una señora mayor, que desde temprano esta en el afán de su negocio, amasando harina para elaborar los panes, y guayando coco para los dulces; pero aun así su actividad favorita es dedicar tiempo a su familia, cocinar y asistir a la iglesia. 

Altagracia esta recibiendo su sexto prestamos con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido reforzar su negocio y hacer buenas inversiones. Partes de sus ganancias eran utilizadas en las necesidades de su familia y también para ahorrarlas, y poder tener un buen ahorro para el futuro poder emprender cualquier proyecto. Unos de sus sueños es tener un local para sus productos.

Altagracia es una de los miembros del grupo David 3, 4 & 5. Compuesto por 15 miembros, todos dedicados a la venta de diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Altagracia is one of our entrepreneurs.  She makes and sells bread and home-M. sweets.  She makes sweets from coconut and milk, which she mixes with dough or fruit marmalade.  She makes bread from wheat flour.  

Her loan is to buy a sack of wheat flour, hundreds of coconuts, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.  She sells them in her community and in the city of Romana, which is known for a lot of tourism and for making sugar.

Altagracia has five children who still live with her and the father of her two youngest children.  She is an older lady who is enthusiastic about her business.  Starting very early she kneads the dough to make the bread, and she scrapes the coconut for the sweets. Her favorite activities are spending time with her family, cooking, and going to church.

This is Altagracia’s sixth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  Thanks to making her payments punctually, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments.  She used part of her earnings for family necessities.  Also they were used for savings so that she was able to have good savings.  She did this so that she would be able to undertake any project in the future.

One of her dreams is to have her own place for her products.

Altagracia is one of the members of the David 3, 4, & 5 Communal Bank.  It is comprised of 15 members.  All of them sell different products.

loans.use: Flour, sugar, coconuts, and butter, etc.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s embroidery business. With the loan he will buy embroidery supplies such as fabrics, colored thread and beads in bulk to offer better quality services to his clients by preparing different varieties of embroidered clothing. He operates his shop in the market and is well known among his clients for his good quality work. Tahira is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve after the loan investment which will result in making her family’s life better. 

Tahira was married eight years ago and has four children. Two of them are studying and the others stay at home. She wants to enroll her remaining children in school, for which her husband needs to improve his business income because he is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Tahira lives with her family in Mian channu, which is a small city located in the Punjab province in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house where she moved seven years ago. 

She is a new loan user, and this is the first time she has applied for a loan from Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a good decision for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Roberto  est le coordinateur  de son groupe Puissance de Philibert

  Il est marié et il a 2 enfants.

Roberto  habite dans la région philibert d’Haiti il n’a pas de l’éléctricité   et de l’eau est très limitée.

Roberto a dirigé son charbon pendant les dernières 3  années.

   Avant  de commencer ce commerce, Roberto  était un professeur

Roberto voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à bois; et des sacs transport

Roberto  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à progresse

Des autres membres de puissance de Philibert  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  Charbon; poison; vertement et produit divers

Roberto dit que son défi principal  est manquement  de l’argent

Roberto  dit que son but   principal   être devenir un grand commerçant  et est  faire plus de bénéfice son rêve est d’acheté  des bœufs.
texts.en:
Roberto  is the coordinator of his group called "Puissance de Philibert" (Strength of Philibert). He is married and has two children. He lives in the Philibert region of Haiti. He has no electricity and access to water is very limited. 

Roberto has been running his charcoal business for the last three years. Before beginning this business, he was a high school teacher. He would like to use this loan to buy wood and sacks for transport. He hopes that this loan will help him get ahead. 

The other members of "Puissance de Philibert" need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, fish, clothing, and various items. 

Roberto says that his main challenge is a lack of capital. He says his principal goal is to become an important businessman and make more income. His dream is to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to invest in wood and sacks for transport

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Odina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la costura. Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 2 hijos y es madre soltera. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo y solicita el crédito para la compra de más telas y otros artículos para la costura.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras Group (Enterprising Women) started with some neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso getting together.

The members started a very united and capable group to form their businesses together and be strengthened by their camaraderie.

Odina is one of the group members. She is a seamstress. She is a very creative woman and her customers love her work.

She has a tight-knit family with two children, and she is a single mother.

She is very satisfied with the activities and trainings that the group does, and she is requesting this loan to purchase more fabric and other items for her sewing.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La sra. Estela P. de 35 años de edad está casada hace 17 años con el señor Ever Cristaldo de 39 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 17 y 8 años respectivamente, el primero terminará este año su secundaria y el otro va empezar el tercer grado.
La señora Estela empezó el negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo, quien se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, con eso compró ropas usadas y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.
La señora quiere que su negocio crezca cada día  y con el crédito aumentará sus ingresos para que el día de mañana pueda hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que  en el futuro sean unas personas de bien.
Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pantalón, short, zapatos, blusas, conjunto para criaturas, camisa, remeras, zapatillas y materia prima para su marido que está en el rubro de carpintería y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela P., 35 years old, has been married for 17 years to Ever Cristaldo, 39 years old. This marriage has produced two children who are 17 and 8 years old. The first will finish high school this year, and the other is going to start third grade.

Estela started her business five years ago with a little bit of money that her husband gave her. He builds furniture. With the money she bought used clothing, and over time she turned this into a clothing business.

She wants her business to grow each day, and with this loan she will increase her revenue so that someday she can pay for her children to go to college and be successful people.

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as slacks, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, and sneakers, as well as materials for her husband who does carpentry so that she can offer a variety of items to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's jeans, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, underclothes, sneakers, and perfumes.

loans.name: Barrio La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Heidy Xiomara V., es madre soltera tiene 29 años de edad, cursos el segundo basico de estudios, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a vender ropa, tiene 3 años de experiencia, empezo como vendedora ambulance en su vecindario, sueña tener un negocio con un local propio, por esta razon decidio reunir a algunas compañeras para formar un grupo con el fin de solicitar un prestamos, que lo utilizaran como capital de trabajo. Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como son: venta de ropa, venta de churrascos, venta de lociones, venta de tortillas y la venta de productos mexicanos. Esperan que con este prestamos mejorar su negocio, sus ingresos de ganancia, su condicion de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Heidy Xiomara V. is a single mother who is 29 years old. She is in her second year of college. She has three children who are all in school. She sells clothing and has three years of experience doing this. She started as a traveling salesperson in her neighborhood. She dreams of having her own store, and this is why she decided to join with some friends to form a group to apply for loans which they will use for working capital. The members of this group have a variety of businesses such as: clothing sales, grilled meat sales, lotion sales, tortilla sales, and Mexican handicraft sales. They hope that with this loan they can improve their businesses, their revenues, and the quality of life for themselves and their families.

**Translator's note: The group's name is Barrio la Esperanza, which means Hope Neighborhood.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Khursheed Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed bibi is a resident of a city named Mian Channu in Pakistan. Mian Channu is a small city known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two room house there and lives in it with her family in the area of Mohalla Rehmania. 

Her husband's name is M. S. and he is involved in a catering business. He offers his services to his clients by providing catering for their special functions, like birthdays and weddings. He has been in this business for many years and is well known for his work. 

Khursheed herself is a housewife, and she prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy crockery and table covers to further expand his business. She is hopeful that the loan investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy crockery and table covers for catering business

loans.name: Esperanza Asegurada 1 Group

texts.es:
Berta es una de nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta de ropas y productos misceláneos, su metodología es venta ambulante, andando por la ciudad y desde su casa. Es una joven madre de 3 hijos y vive junto a su pareja sentimental, ambos producen para sustentar las necesidades del hogar, y Berta de manera muy puntual trabaja día a día para darles un buena educación a sus hijos. Pertenece al grupo Esperanza asegurada 1, junto a otros 4 vecinos, que ambos luchan por llevar mas estabilidad a sus familia.

Berta esta recibiendo su sexto préstamos con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido reforzar su negocio y hacer buenas inversiones, Sus planes para este nuevo préstamo es para invertir en la compra de productos diferentes tipos de ropas para hombre y mujer, ropa de cama y accesorios.  Las ganancias de sus ventas son utilizadas para ahorrar y pagar la educación de sus hijos. Gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Berta is one of our businesswomen.  She works selling clothes and miscellaneous products both as an itinerant street vendor, walking the city streets, and from her home.  She is a young mother with 3 children and lives together with her partner.  They both work to support the needs of their household and Berta works every day to provide her children with a good education.  She belongs to the "Esperanza Asegurada 1" group together with 4 neighbors who also work hard to bring more stability to their families.

Berta is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have been made punctually, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments.  Her plan for this new loan is to invest in her business, buying different types of clothes for men and women, bedclothes and accessories.  She uses the profits from the sales she makes to save and pay for her children's education.  Thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, sheets, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Teodora M. de 54 años, es soltera, con 2 hijos.
Doña Teodora se dedica a este rubro hace más de 12 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.998; comenzó con el capital que su hija le envió de España, comprando perfumes y habilitando una despensa, en la actualidad ya tiene muchas clientas por que vende a cuotas, una clientela ya formada.
Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías(perfumes y comestibles para su despensa).
texts.en:
Teodora M., 54 years old, is single with two children.

Teodora has had her business for more than 12 years, since about 1998. She started with some money her daughter sent her from Spain, buying perfume and starting up a grocery store. Now she already has many customers because she sells on credit; she has a group of customers.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise (perfumes and food for her grocery store).

loans.use: Purchase perfume and food

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El sr. Juan vive en la zona primero de mayo desde hace 2 años en casa propia, es soltero y vive con su hermana. El sr. Juan tiene un vehículo propio con el cual se dedica al transporte publico. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la reparación de su vehículo y compra de llantas. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito ya que es una persona joven pero desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar para ayudar a su familia para el sustento de la misma,  tiene muchas ganas de superación, es un joven muy trabajador con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan lives in the populous part of the 1st of May zone. He has had his own home for two years; he is single and lives with his sister. Juan has his own car, which he uses for public transport. The loan he is requesting is to repair his vehicle and purchase tires. This is the first time he has requested a loan since he is so young, but he started working at a young age to help sustain his family. He has many hopes of succeeding. He is a very hardworking young man with hopes of moving forward and improving his quality of life. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
La Srta. Nathalia R. de 24 años de edad es soltera, vive con sus padres y 5 hermanos más, juntos se ayudan para llevar adelante el negocio que tienen que es un vivero que  funciona desde hace 11 años.
Nathalia está llevando adelante este negocio que es muy importante para toda su familia por que de este depende toda la familia para costear el sustento diario, los gastos del estudio y otros gastos normales de una familia.
Ella terminó una carrera técnica de artes plásticas de dos años y más adelante si tiene la oportunidad quiere seguir otra carrera universitaria.
Solicita este préstamos para compra de plantas hornamentales, flores y semillas para plantitas que se utilizará para reforestación.
texts.en:
Ms. Nathalia R. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents and five siblings. They work together to run their family business, which is a nursery they have had for 11 years.

Nathalia is working to continue this business, which is very important to the whole family because they depend on it to cover their daily needs, school expenses, and other typical family expenses.

She finished a two-year technical program in plastic arts and she would like to pursue another university degree sometime in the future.

Nathalia is requesting this loan to buy ornamental plants, flowers, and seeds for seedlings that will be used for reforestation.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants, flowers, and seeds for seedlings that will be used for reforestation

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El sr. Jaime, vive en la localidad de Sacaba cerca del coliseo de sacaba, es casado tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, El Sr. Jaime es peluquero la actividad que realiza es de hace 15 años, por lo que es muy conocido en su zona el préstamo lo invertirá para compra de material de trabajo como maquinas eléctricas para su peluquería, Su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico y céntrico de la localidad de sacaba, tiene ya muchos cliente por el buen trabajo que realiza, es muy trabajador y siempre se actualiza en los cortes ya que muchos jovencitos le piden cortes modernos, el Sr. Jaime esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime lives in the town of Sacaba near the coliseum.  He is married and has two school-aged children. He runs a barber shop which he has had for 15 years and is very well-known in the area.  He plans to use the loan to buy work supplies, such as electric equipment, for his shop.

His business is located in a strategic, focal point of the town.  He has many customers because of his good service.  He is very hard-working and stays abreast of all the latest fashion since many young men ask for the latest haircuts.  

Mr. Jaime is very grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy electric equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliza pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Está Casada, tiene 47 y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Eliza se dedica al Servicio de Alquiler de cuartos, su primer crédito de S/. 300.00  Nuevos Soles lo utilizó realizando mejoras y acondicionamiento en las habitaciones que alquila, para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que ejerce.

Con este crédito  de S/ 800.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará materiales como: bolsas de cementos, ambientadores, pinturas, esmaltes, mesas y sillas. 

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con su actividad. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con ella y otras mujeres que necesitan de un préstamo.  Su meta es implementar mejor su negocio para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliza is a member of the "Las Aguerridas II" communal bank which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martin.  She is 47 years old, married and the mother of two minor children.

Eliza has a room renting service.  She took out a first loan in the amount of 300 PEN which she used to renovate the rooms she rents in order to provide good service to customers.  She is still in the same busienss and very happy with her work.

She plans to use the new 800 PEN loan to buy material such as cement, air freshener, paint, enamel, tables and chairs.  She is very excited about pursuing this activity.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting her and other women in need of a loan.  

Her goal is to do all she can to improve her business in order to provide the best service possible.

loans.use: To buy material such as cement, air freshener, paint, enamel, tables and chairs

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Damaris es una de nuestras mujeres empresarias, dedicada a la venta productos misceláneos como: prendas de plata, ropa y zapatos. Su préstamo es para la compra de varias prendas como pulseras, anillos, aretes. y ropas y zapatos por encargo. Los cuales vende en su comunidad, una zona rural rodeada de campos de caña de azúcar de la ciudad de San Pedro de Macorís, donde también suele tener algunos de sus clientes.

Damaris tiene 3 hijos, los cuales aun viven con ella, junto su padre. Su reto más importante es que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro, por lo cual trabaja y se esfuerza. Damaris esta recibiendo su tercer préstamo con Esperanza internacional, y gracias a que sus pagos han sido puntuales, ha podido hacer crecer su negocio por la reinversion recibida en cada préstamo. Inicio su negocio hace 2 años vendiendo solamente ropa. Desea ahorrar sus ganancias para poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y poder darle un techo seguro, ya que también tiene planes de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris is one of our businesswomen.  She works selling miscellaneous products such as silver jewelry, clothes and shoes.  She will use her loan to buy various items of jewelry such as bracelets, rings and earrings.  She will also order some clothes and shoes.  She makes her sales in her community which is a rural area surrounded by fields of sugarcane, near the town of San Pedro de Macorís where some of her customers live.

Damaris has 3 children who still live with her, together with their father.  Her most important challenge is to ensure that her children have a good future and she works hard to achieve this.  Damaris is receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment she makes from each loan.  She started her business 2 years ago and at that time only sold clothes.  She would like to save her profits so that she can pay for her children's university education and be able to provide them with a safe home as she also has plans to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy shoes, silver jewelry and clothes

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El sr. Miguel A. de 27 años, está casado con la Sra. Liliana Urunaga de 27 años de edad, ellos aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos, pues se casaron poco tiempo.
Don Miguel se dedica a este rubro aproximadamente desde el año 2.007; el estudió y se especializó en la fabricación de panificados y comenzó con el capital que juntó trabajando como empleado de otra persona, en la actualidad tiene su propio local comercial que esta estratégicamente ubicado, es por eso que acuden muchos clientes a su local.
El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (harina, dulces, uvas, colorantes, aceite, etc).
texts.en: Miguel A. is 27 years old.  He is married to Liliana Urunaga, who is also 27 years old.  They do not have children yet, since they recently got married.  Miguel has dedicated himself to the bakery business since 2007.   He studied and specialized in making baked goods.  He opened his own bakery with the capital he accumulated working as an employee for another person.  His bakery is strategically located, so many clients come to his shop.  Miguel will use this loan to buy supplies for his bakery (flour, sweeteners, grapes, food coloring, oil, etc.).

loans.use: To buy flour, sweeteners, grapes, food coloring, oil, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es: Un grupo con el único objetivo de salir adelante y obtener éxitos económicos en sus negocios, así se caracteriza este grupo de emprendedores comerciantes llamado Grupo Hatarinas. Conformado por nueve integrantes en su mayoría mujeres, un grupo de luchadores y entusiastas por salir adelante, a si se caracteriza el Grupo Hatarinas, muestra de ello es la señora María del Carmen de 44 años de edad y madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos aun son menores de edad. Ella se dedica desde muy temprano a la venta de semillas de café que le manda a la capital desde la selva peruana para su venta, y por otra parte también se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa, estos negocios le permiten mantener un equilibrio económico en su hogar ya que actualmente su esposo no cuenta con trabajo estable. En el futuro le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa y a si poder tener más tiempo para sus hijos y su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para costear los gastos de estudio de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
The "Hatarinas" merchant/entrepreneur group has one goal: to get ahead and be successful in each business endeavor.  The group is comprised of nine people, mainly women.  They are all hard-working and enthusiastic about carving out a future.  

One example of this is María del Carmen who is 44 years old and the mother of three children, two of which are still minors.  From an early age she has had to travel from the Peruvian forest to the capital city to sell coffee beans.  She also sells food out of her home.  Both of these activities have helped her maintain a balanced income for her household since her husband currently does not hold a permanent job.

Her dream is to open a store in her home sometime in the future so she can spend more time taking care of her children and home.  She plans to use the loan to help cover educational expenses for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To cover educational expenses for her eldest daughter

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Está Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Nelida se inició en el negocio de venta de pasamanería y servicio de costura.  An la actualidad y gracias a su energía luchadora que siempre le ha identificado y las ambiciones de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva poco tiempo ejerciendo este tipo de negocio. Poco a poco fue ganando experiencia, confianza y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.
Ahora cuenta con una clientela fija: amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar, donde allí encuentran todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos de productos como: leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras de la zona, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nelida, está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelida is a member of the "Las Aguerridas" communal bank, located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martin.  She is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children who all live independently.

Nelida started out selling lace and working as a seamstress.  But now, thanks to her fighting spirit which she is well-known for and her ambition to get ahead on her own, she runs a grocery store business.  She has only been doing this for a short time but little by little she is gaining experience and confidence and is now well-known and loved among her customers.

She has a permanent customer base comprised of friends and neighbors who buy at her store daily.  There they find everything a homemaker needs and also receive her personal attention.

With this loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN she plans to buy different types of products such as milk, canned fish (in a variety of brands), packaged oatmeal, different flavored teas (camomille and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning utensils and person hygiene items in order to continue providing the best service to customers.

Nelida enjoys her daily routine and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her realize her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy milk, canned fish, oatmeal, tea, vegetables, cleaning utensils and personal hygiene items

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es: La Sra. Maristela, vive en la localidad de Sacaba, es muy conocida por su tienda de Barrio ya que es muy conocida por la variedda d productos que ofrece y por la buena atencion de la Sra. ya que es una persona amable, el negocio lo atiende desde sus 20 años de edad  se encuentra en un lugar muy céntrico ,es soltera  vive en la casa de sus padres tiene 30 años, el préstamo lo destinara para aumentar capital para surtir una variedad de productos, como Arroz, fideo, azúcar aceite y variedad de dulces, es una persona joven muy trabajadora su deseo es el poder comprarse una casita e independizarse, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Maristela lives in the town of Sacaba. She's very well known for her neighborhood store, which provides a variety of products and good customer service. Maristela is a nice person. She has run the store since she was 20-years-old, and it's very centrally located. She's single, 30-years-old, and she lives in her parents house. She will use the loan to expand her capital and stock up her store with various products, such as rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and sweets. She's young and hardworking; her goal is to be able to buy a small house and live independently. She would like to thank the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
