Lucía pertenece al Banco comunal “Nueva vida”, perteneciente a la provincia de Molina. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos específicamente huevos, pan, carnes, verduras y abarrotes, ya que tiene un almacén. Ella trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 5 años. 

Su esposo e hija le ayudan en la atención a clientes y reposición de productos dentro del  almacén.

Lucía compra su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas y la verdura en la feria, mercadería que traslada en un triciclo y locomoción colectiva, tarea que es muy sacrificada para ella.

Con este préstamo, Lucía comprará una cortadora de cecinas y una caja registradora.

Las motivaciones de ella para seguir con éste negocio son los ingresos generados que le permiten mantener económicamente su hogar y cancelar los estudios universitarios de su hijo menor, cumpliendo de esta manera el sueño de educarlo.

Para Lucía los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido importantes para su negocio, ya que le han permitido invertir y con esto generar mayores ingresos. Respecto a su grupo, ella se siente muy contenta, ya que ha conocido personas muy agradables. 

Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Lucía belongs to the "Nueva Vida" (New Life) community bank which is located in Molina province.  She owns a store and sells food, specifically eggs, bread, meat, vegetables and groceries.  She has been working in this business for 5 years.

Lucía's husband and daughter help her to serve her customers and re-stock the shelves in the store.

Lucía buys her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets.  She buys her vegetables in the market.  She transports her merchandise in a three-wheeled vehicle and also by public transport.  This involves a lot of hard work.

Lucía will use this loan to buy a meat slicer and a cash register.

Lucía's motivation to continue working in this business is the income she makes as it allows her to financially support her household and pay for her youngest son's university education.  This fulfils her dreams of educating him.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been important for Lucía's business since they have allowed her to invest and consequently make better profits.  She feels very happy with her group since the other members are very pleasant people.

Molina is a town in the central area of Chile, in Maule region.  It is mainly noted for being one of the big centers of the Chilean wine industry.  As well as the wine industry, the fruit industry is also important, producing apples, pears and kiwi fruit.

loans.use: To buy a cash register and a meat slicer

loans.name: Maribel Valentina

texts.es: La señora Maribel es cliente antigua de la institución,  se dedica al tejido de chompas para niños la cual la realiza a maquina. Ella anteriormente viajaba al interior llevando sus productos en la actualidad ella vende las chompas que teje en un puesto en alquiler en la feria 16 de julio en la avenida panorámica esto debido a que su pequeña hija esta creciendo y no puede ya viajar con ella, es por esto que solicita el préstamo para poder dar un anticipo a la dueña del puesto y mas adelante poder comprar el mismo, la cliente es una mujer responsable y trabajadora.  Ella se siente muy feliz de recibir el préstamo el cual le ayudara a superarse.
texts.en:
Maribel is a long-standing client of our institution.  Her business is knitting children's sweaters with a machine.  Maribel used to travel to the provinces with her products but she currently sells the sweaters that she knits from a rented stall in the '16 de julio market' on Avenida Panorámica.  She made this change because her young daughter is growing and she can no longer travel with her.

Maribel is requesting a loan so that she can make a down payment to the owner of her stall and, in the future, be able to buy the stall.  Our client is a responsible and hard-working woman.  She feels very happy to be receiving the loan which will help her to improve herself.

loans.use: To make a down payment on buying a stall

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 1 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando. 

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos (comida típica de la zona) en el centro de la Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Sus ventas las realiza diariamente  a partir de las 5:30pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.  
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.

Elenita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día, ya que con este negocio hizo profesionales a sus cinco hijos y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the "Noche de Luna II" (Moonlit Night II) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province.  Elena is 48 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in school.

Elena's fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead on her own resources helped her set up her own business selling kebabs (a typical local food) in the city center.  She has gradually become very well known amongst her customers and today she tells us that her business is doing very well.  She makes her sales every day from 5.30pm.  She has been in this line of business for several years and she feels very happy with what she does.

Elena will use this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy supplies such as bag of rice, eggs and creole chickens for making 'juanes' (a traditional chicken and rice meal) and eviscerated chickens for making kebabs.  She will also buy cooking utensils so that she can provide a high-quality service to her customers.

Elenita, as she is affectionately known, feels very proud of the work that she does every day since, through her business, her five children have become professionals.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as bags of rice, eggs and creole chickens for making 'juanes'.  To buy eviscerated chickens for making kebabs.  To buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
La Srta. Maribel, es soltera tiene 24 años  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1  año y medio, Maribel es integrante  del grupo “El Rosario”, grupo conformado por 7 amigas. Maribel  trabaja desD. hace 2 años  como diseñadora D. modas, donD. confecciona ropa en un taller propio, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejores  ingresos económicos y a su vez tiene tres maquinas propias para coser que le permitiran seguir creciendo en su negocio. Con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería. Sabemos que Maribel cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran

dato 
En la foto aparecen 7 personas que estan como pasivas para este prestamo.
1.Salinas Justina es la Sra. D. polo blanco
2.Morales Mercedes es la Sra D. chaleco plomo
3.Robles Petronila es la Sra D. polo negro
4.B. gladyses es la Sra D. chompa negra con polo celeste con negro
5.carrillo sanchez es la Sra D. polo rojo
6.Carhuallanqui Maura es la Sra D. polo rosado
7.Garcia es la Sra D. polo Morado
texts.en:
Maribel is 24 years old and single.  She has been working with Edaprospo for eighteen months.  Maribel is a member of the "El Rosario" group which is maD. up of 7 friends.  Maribel has been working as a fashion designer for 2 years.  She makes clothes in her own workshop and, thanks to her hard work and commitment, she has been achieving better profits and now has three sewing machines of her own which will allow her to continue growing in her business.  In order to continue growing, she has also requested a new loan to buy merchandise.  We know that Maribel will achieve her goals through a lot of work and effort and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

7 people appear in this photo who are not actually receiving this loan:
1. Salinas Justina is the lady in the white top
2. Morales Mercedes is the lady in the gray vest
3. Robles Petronila is the lady in the black top
4. B. Gladys is the lady in the black sweater with light blue and black top
5. Carrillo Sanchez is the lady in the red top
6. Carhaullanqui Maura is the lady in the pink top
7. Garcia is the lady in the purple top

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martin. Es Viuda, tiene 64 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Trinidad es una mujer firme y luchadora que desde muy joven le gusta el negocio y le gusta trabajar. Se dedica a la venta de Mazamorras, arroz con leche y flan (dulces, postres). Lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta de dulces  y nos cuenta que le esta  yendo muy bien, ya que le genera buenos ingresos diarios. Sus ventas las realiza por las tardes  en las afueras de su casa a partir de las 3.00 pm., en una zona donde hay mucho movimiento y como ya es muy conocida, cuenta con clientes fijos. También produce sus dulces a pedidos de diferentes empresas, para diferentes ocasiones o eventos que realicen. Esto es otro ingreso que tiene y esta muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,100.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes.  En cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Trinidad se siente aun con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños anhelados, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province.  She is 64 years old, widowed, and has 4 children who all now live independently. 

Trinidad is a solid and hard-working woman who has liked being in business and working since she was very young.  Her business is selling 'mazamorras' (a corn-based milky pudding) and 'flan' (caramel custard).  She has been selling sweet treats for several years and she tells us that her business is going very well since it makes her good daily profits.  She makes her sales in the afternoons, outside her house, from 3.00pm onwards.  She lives in a very busy area and, as she is very well known, she has regular customers.  She also produces her desserts to order for different companies, for different occasions or events that they are hosting.  This is another source of income that she has and she is very happy to have achieved it.

Trinidad will use this loan for 1,100 Peruvian soles to buy ingredients for preparing her sweet treats such as 'maíz morado' (purple corn), rice and sugar by the kilo, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients.  She will also buy some utensils: plastic cups and spoons.

Trinidad still feels that she has a lot of strength to continue working.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping to fulfil not only her dreams but also those of other women who want to grow and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy purple corn, rice and sugar by the kilo, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Soltera, tiene 50 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Victoria, a la edad que tiene, se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar, hace 10 años que viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de abarrotes, negocio ubicado en su misma casa en un espacio amplio y acondicionado, donde a diario atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que la caracteriza. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de todos los sabores, golosinas en diferentes variedades, shampoo en diferentes marcas,  bebidas gasificadas de diferentes tamaños y marcas y productos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Viki, como le dicen de cariño, se siente una mujer realizada, con ganas de salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su pequeño negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province.  She is 50 years old, single, and has 4 children who all now live independently.

At her age, Victoria still feels that she has a great desire to work.  She has been working in her grocery store business for 10 years.  The store is located in her home, in a large and equipped space.  She serves her customers every day with her notable charisma.  She is currently continuing in this business.  She is very well known and well liked by her customers who come to buy from her every day.

Victoria will use this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different kinds of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products so that she can continue providing a better service to her customers.

Viki, as she is affectionately known, feels fulfilled but still has a desire to get ahead.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her, and other women, to set up their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different types of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is 45 years old and has seven children, two of whom are grown while the other five are still in school. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun", which is in its 48th loan cycle. Gregoria has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now. She has had a timber business for twelve years. She drives to the countryside, purchases wood, and then transports it to sell in a market in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, tiene 64 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Sonia nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella vende de lunes a viernes en el centro comercial “Tahuantisuyo”, los sábados vende en la feria sabatina del “Baratillo” y los domingos viaja a la ciudad de Chincheros donde vende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa.

Guillermina pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Guillermina, age 64, has three children and lives in Cusco, Perú. She sells clothing from Monday through Friday in the Tahuantisuyo commercial center. On Saturdays she sells clothing at Baratillo, a weekend market, and on Sundays she travels to Chincheros to sell her products. Guillermina has been in this business for several years and it is going well, but she needs a loan to buy more clothing.

She belongs to the Kantus community bank, part of the Arariwa Association, and she is very grateful for this opportunity. Guillermina is committed to repaying her loan as scheduled.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Luz Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida, tiene 27 años de edad, tiene una hijo y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.  Actualmente, Zoraida está estudiando en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico Khipu la carrera profesional de administración de empresas turísticas y su actividad económica de Zoraida es la confección de chompas para bebes, niños, damas y caballeros. Ya es un año y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo hilos, lana y otras cosas más que se necesita. 

Zoraida pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 27 years old, has one child, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Currently, Zoraida is studying at the KHIPU Technological Institute.  She is studying for a degree in Tourist Business Administration.

Zoraida's business activity is making sweaters for babies, children, ladies and men.  She has been in this business for a year and a half and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Zoraida needs a loan to buy materials such as threads, yarn and other products.

Zoraida is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy materials such as threads, yarn and other products she needs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Isabel nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde expende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella abre el restaurante desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de  noche de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza, gaseosas y otras cosas que se necesitan para preparar comida. 

Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is 49 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Isabel tells us that her business is selling meals.  She has a restaurant where she serves breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She opens her restaurant at 7.00am and closes at 9.00pm, Monday to Sunday.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Isabel requires a loan to buy more beer, soda and other products that she needs to prepare her meals.

Isabel is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and other products that she needs to prepare her meals

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 71 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos independientes.

Rosa Mercedes, se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria.  Ahora ha  ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.

Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos D. productos como: leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras D. la zona, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa Mercedes está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 71 years old, widowed, and has 5 children who all live independently.

Rosa Mercedes' business is selling groceries.  Her fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead in life on her own resources have helped her become a businesswoman.  She has gained experience and confidence, and is now very well known and well liked by her customers.  She currently has a regular customer base maD. up of friends in her neighborhood, local residents and neighbors who come to her store daily to buy from her.

Rosa Mercedes will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy different types of products such as boxes of different brands of milk and canned fish, packets of oats, different flavored teas (camomile and aniseed), local vegetables, household cleaning products and personal care products.  This way she will be able to continue providing a good service to her customers.

Rosa Mercedes is happy with the work that she does every day and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: To buy boxes of different brands of milk and canned fish, packets of oats, different flavored teas (camomile and aniseed), local vegetables, household cleaning products and personal care products

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Roxana está estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo y curso de Ingles. Su actividad económica de Roxana es la venta de comestible, ella alquila una pequeña tienda donde vende sus productos. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más que se necesita. 

Roxana pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roxana is 22 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is currently studying for a degree in tourism and is studying a course in English.

Roxana's business activity is selling groceries.  She rents a small store where she sells her products.  She has been in this business for one year and it is going very well.  On this occasion, she requires a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and other products that she needs.

Roxana is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and other products that she needs

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Yaneth está trabajando en la provincia de Puacartambo en la comunidad de Patria como docente pero ahora está de vacaciones en la ciudad del Cusco, ella nos cuenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad del Cusco y está a cargo de unos de sus hermanas. Ya son varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. El sueño de Yaneth es abrir un jardín de niños. 

Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 29 and lives with her two children in Cusco, Perú. Yaneth works in Puacartambo Province, in the town of Patria as a teacher, but is currently on leave in Cusco.  She has a small general goods store in Cusco, which her siblings help her manage. Business has been very good and so Yaneth seeks a loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, pasta and other products to increase the store's selection. Yaneth dreams of own day opening a child care center. 

Yaneth belongs to the “Kantus” communal lending bank of the Asociación Arariwa and is grateful for the credit access the group allows her.  She is committed to the timely repayment of her loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as sugar, pasta, rice and other products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Edgar nos cuenta que tiene dos panaderías, él y su esposa Sonia trabajan haciendo panes, tortas y muchas cosas más. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar las panaderías y desea comprar maquinarias. 

Edgar pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edgar is 37 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Edgar tells us that he owns two bakeries.  He and his wife Sonia work making bread, cakes and many other products.  He has been in this business for eight years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Edgar needs a loan to stock his bakeries and also to buy some machinery.

Edgar is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being offered with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To stock his bakeries and to buy some machinery

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.  

Erika se dedica a la venta de refrigerios (Desayunos). Lleva varios años en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores del barrio y amigos conocidos, que saben de su buena sazón e higiene en la elaboración de sus productos, a quienes  ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará: insumos como harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, panes, pollos, y otros para la preparación de kekes, empanadas, sanguches. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de la región  para la preparación de sus jugos y refrescos. 

Está preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante con su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por hacer realidad sus sueños y metas
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 29 years old, single, and has two dependent children.

Erika's business is selling light refreshments (breakfasts).  She has been in the business for several years and is very happy with what she has achieved as her business is going very well.

Erika currently has a loyal customer base.  Her main customers are people who live in the neighborhood, friends and acquaintances, who know that she makes tasty food and employs good hygiene practices in making her products.  She serves her customers with her characteristic charisma and kindness.

Erika will use this loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles to buy supplies such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken and other products that she needs to make her cakes, empanadas and sandwiches.  She will also invest part of her money in buying local fruit for making her juices and soft drinks.  She is ready for anything and feels that she has a lot of strength to continue working and get ahead in her business.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for making her dreams a reality and helping her achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken and other products for making her cakes, empanadas and sandwiches

loans.name: Joshep Christian

texts.es:
Joshep, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Joshep está trabajando en el instituto Nacional de Cultura como restaurador de cuadro. Ya son dos que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para ahorrar pues en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder brindar servicio de transporte urbano. El sueño de Joshep es abrir una empresa de transportes.     

Joshep pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Joshep is 26 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Joshep is currently working at the National Institute of Culture as a paintings restorer.  He has been in this business for two years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, he needs a loan so that he can save as, in the future, he would like to buy a car with which he can provide urban transport services  Joshep's dream is to open a transport company.

Joshep is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being offered with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To save up so that he can buy a car in the future

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Sonia nos cuenta que tiene dos panaderías, ella  y su esposo Edgar trabajan haciendo panes y muchas cosas más. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y otras cosas más que se necesitan. 

Sonia pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Sonia tells us that she owns two bakeries and that she and her husband Edgar work making bread and many other products.  She has been in this business for eight years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast and other products.

Sonia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, yeast and other products that she needs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 1 que aún depende de ella.

Yolanda es una mujer que se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar. Se  dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que se ubica en su misma casa en un espacio amplio y acondicionado, donde a diario atiende a sus clientes. Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de todos los sabores, golosinas en diferentes variedades, shampoo en diferentes marcas,  bebidas gasificadas de diferentes tamaños y marcas, y productos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Yolanda se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su pequeño negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the "Los Eucaliptos” (Eucalyptus Trees) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 48 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children, 1 of whom is still dependent.

Yolanda is a woman who has a great desire to work.  Her business is selling groceries and it is located in her home in a large space adapted for the purpose.  This is where she serves her customers.  Yolanda is currently continuing in this business.  She is very well known and liked by her customers who come to her business every day to buy from her.

Yolanda will use this loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different types of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products, in order to continue providing a good service to her customers.

Yolanda feels fulfilled but still has a desire to get ahead.  She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her, and other women like her, to set up their small businesses.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and sugar, different flavored cookies, different varieties of candy, different brands of shampoo, different sizes and brands of soda, and personal care products

loans.name: Ingrith

texts.es:
La Sra. Ingrith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, del Distrito de Tarapto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Ingrith es una mujer emprendedora y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios la ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes y prendas de vestir (Bazar),  ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de su Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas las realiza diariamente  a partir de las 9:00 am. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con su trabajo.

Con este crédito  de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará Mercaderías como: Ropas, batas, pantalones, blusas, snikers, todo esto tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Parte del dinero también invertirá comprando: paquetes de adornos, jaboncillos, pasta Kolinos, sandalias y productos para la higiene personal.

Ingrith se siente muy tranquila y feliz.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ingrith belongs to the communal bank “Maria Auxiliadora”, in Tarapto, San Martin Province. She is 28, partnered, and has a dependent child.

Ingrith is very entrepreneurial and has opened her own business selling household goods and clothing (Bazar).  She has a shop in the local market in her city, where she has gained a following among her clients and prospered in her business activities.  She opens the shop at 9:00 am. every day. Ingrith has now had her shop for some years and feels very content with the results of her efforts.

With a credit of S/ 2,000.00, Ingrith plans to buy clothes, ties, pants, blouses, shoes, and other items for women, men and children. She will also use part of the credit to buy: decorations, soap, sandals and hygiene products.

Ingrith is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for assisting her in realizing her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy clothing, accessories and personal hygiene products for re-sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married and has five children, aged 28, 25, 23, 19 and 6. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun". She makes a living selling hardware goods to small towns in the jungle outsiD. of Ayacucho. She has had this business for twelve years now and also often transports other products such as groceries with her to sell there. 

She will be using her loan to purchase hardware goods in Lima to resell in the jungle towns. Marina has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and benefits from the training they offer on business development, family counseling, and most of all, savings education. She said that because of her savings she has been able to renovate her home.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware to resell

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es soltero y tiene 28 años, reside en casa de a sus padres en una zona urbano marginal en el Distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años, Elmer brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporta a sus clientes en la ruta entre José Leonardo Ortiz y la cuidad de Chiclayo. 

Elmer desea realizar la compra de SOAT, regularizar sus permisos de operatividad y  algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo, que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elmer is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents in an urban zone next to José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is part of Lambayeque province, 20 minutes from Chiclayo city.

For the last three years, Elmer has been working in public transportation. He drives a mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a passenger cabin. He drives the route between José Leonardo Ortiz and Chiclayo city.

Elmer wants to purchase SOAT (vehicle insurance), obtain his operator's license as a public transportation driver, and make improvements to his motorcycle to keep it in good condition so that he can continue offering good service to his customers. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle insurance.

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Ana es coordinadora del grupo Mi fortaleza en cristo, ella junto a otros micro-empresarios de la ciudad de Santiago, han decidido tomar prestamos para realizar diferentes actividades de negocios, son 10 empresarios con diferentes negocios, algunos venden productos, prendas de plata, ropa, zapatos, tienda de alimentos y Ana quien inicia su negocio, y ha visto la necesidad de vender ropa para animales domésticos, en este su primer préstamo invertirá en la compra de ropas para perros.

Ana esta recibiendo su primer prestamos con Esperanza internacional, con la motivación de darle forma e iniciar su proyecto de negocio poco usual, pero a la vez innovador y pone mucha Fe en que con el podrá lograr sus sueños, uno de ellos es poder tener su propia casa, y mejorar la situación económica por la que en la actualidad se encuentran, sus ganancias la utilizara para reinvertir y llevar ingresos extra a su familia, ayudando a su esposo con los gastos, tiene 2 hijos. Gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of the “Mi Fortaleza en Cristo” (My Strength in Christ) group.  Together with other micro entrepreneurs from the city of Santiago, they've decided to take out a loan to carry out various business activities.  They are a group of 10 business people with different businesses.  Some sell products like silver items, clothes, shoes; others are grocers.  Ana is starting her business.  She has seen the need to sell clothes for pets.  This is her first loan and she’ll use it to buy clothes for dogs.

Ana is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional to structure and start her somewhat unusual, but innovative, project.  She has a lot of faith in that she will make her dreams come true.  One of those dreams is to have a house of her own and to improve the economic situation they presently are in.   She will use profits to reinvest and provide extra income for her family helping her husband with expenses.  She has two children.

Thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pet clothes for dogs.

loans.name: Beldad

texts.es:
La Sra. Beldad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Beldad es una mujer luchadora, eso siempre le ha caracterizado, las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio, ubicado en un campo deportivo cerca su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad, ya que el lugar donde vende, es un lugar con mucho movimiento.  Sus ventas las realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 6:00pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Beldad se siente muy orgullosa y contenta del trabajo que realiza día a día. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Beldad is a member of the communal bank “Los Eucaliptos”, in Tarapoto District, San Martin Province. She is 45, married and the has two dependent children.  Beldad has always been a hardworking woman and has opened a business serving food in the eveinings near an athletic field in her town, and has gained a following among local clients and those using the sports field.  She has been running her business for several years and is very pleased with the results.

With a credit of S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she plans to buy foodstuffs such as rice, eggs, chickens and chicken parts to prepare meals, as well as utensils to better serve her customers.  Beldad is proud of her work and grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy rice, eggs, chickens and cooking utensils

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rocío del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Está Casada, tiene 38 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.

Roció del Pilar lleva 20 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller de Costura, ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, trabaja con pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, compró retazos, telas en metros, hilos de diferentes colores, en la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de máquina, alfileres y botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar, 38, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.  She’s married and is the mother of one son who still is dependent on her and is studying.

Rocío del Pilar has been a dressmaker for 20 years; she has gradually generated her own income and been saving her money.  Because she was skilled in sewing she didn’t hesitate to do it and with support from the Manuela Ramos Movement she decided to set up her own sewing workshop located in her house.  She tells us that she does quite well; she works on orders placed by her customers.  She used her initial, 300 new sol, loan to buy remnants, meters of fabric, assorted colored thread.  She continues in the same business today.

She will use the 1000 new sol loan to buy fabric in assorted colors and types by the meter, tools she uses like scissors, large spools of thread in assorted colors, sewing machine needles, pins and buttons.

Today she feels like a fulfilled woman with more drive to reach her other dreams and have them become reality.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

loans.use: She will buy fabric in assorted colors and types by the meter, tools she uses like scissors, large spools of thread in assorted colors, sewing machine needles, pins and buttons.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. María Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos" tiene 38 años. Es Conviviente y es madre de 01 hijo, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto y Provincia de San Martin. 

María Mercedes se dedica a la Venta de Comidas preparadas por ella misma y lleva varios años en el negocio, se encuentra ubicado en un ambiente muy acondicionado, un lugar muy amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden a su local. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas,  es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.   

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito  de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como, arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, plátanos , maduros en racimos y también  algunos utensilios, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

María Mercedes se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es implementar su propio Restaurant.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 38, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank.  She has a live-in partner and is the mother of a son.  She lives in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.

María Mercedes sells prepared food that she makes herself; she’s been in business several years.  It’s located in a well-equipped, ample and well-conditioned space to take care of her customers who come by daily.  She tells us that her daily sales are good; she’s well known and is well received. She’s still in the same business and is very happy with the work she does day to day.  It is she herself who personally tends to her customers with her characteristic charisma and kindness.

She will use this 1500 new sol loan to buy ingredients for the daily preparation of meals like: rice by the kilo, oil by the liter, cases of chicken, bananas, plantains by the bunch, as well as some utensils to provide better customer service.

María Mercedes feels full of live driven to continue forward.  Her dream is to set up a restaurant of her own.

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to prepare her daily meals as well as some utensils.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Sra. Damaris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 01 niño que aun depende de ella.  

Damaris es una mujer dispuesta y luchadora que dado a su espíritu alegre, lleva hoy en día varios años dedicándose al servicio de lavado de motos lineales y motokares. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar amplio y acondicionado, donde puede atender con gusto a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario acuden muchos clientes, ya que la conocen y saben del buen servicio que brinda, día a día. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles comprará un motor, que le ayuda mucho, con la presión del agua, para un lavado rápido. También invertirá comprando detergentes en cajas, escobillas en docenas y una nueva manguera para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor a sus clientes.

Damaris se siente muy contenta al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos. Agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Damaris, 29, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.  She has a live in partner and a son who still depends on her.

Damaris is a willing, hard working woman who, thanks to her cheerful spirit, today has been providing motorcycle and mototaxi washing services for several years.  Her business is located at home in a roomy, equipped area, where she can tend to her customers comfortably.  She tells us that she has many customers daily who know her and the good service she provides day to day.

She will use this 1700 new sol loan to buy a motor which helps a lot with pressurized water to do a quick cleaning.  She will also buy boxes of detergent, dozens of brushes and a new hose to provide better service to her customers.

Damaris feels happy to belong to a group of women that have helped her become more aware of her rights.  She is quite grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her enter the business world.

loans.use: She will buy a motor, boxes of detergent, brushes by the dozen and a new hose.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus seis hijos en el caserío San Martín del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría gallinas, patos, pavos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años conoce este rubro a la perfección y tiene clientela establecida.

Ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta y así las vendería a mejor precio con mejores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juana, 36, is a mother living with her husband and six children in the hamlet of San Martín in the agricultural Tambogrande district, a farming zone located in Piura region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl to sell.  She raises chickens, ducks and turkeys in her back yard and when they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where she lives.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and knows the occupation perfectly; she has an established customer base.

She wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed for her fowl because demand is increasing and she will thus be able to sell for better prices and obtain better profits.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 26 years old and has three children aged 11, 7, and four months. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun", and has been a member of FINCA for two years now, after being invited by her cousin. 

She has been involved in the production of bricks for many years, and sells them in Ayacucho. She plans to use her loan of 1,250 PEN to buy more land to expand her brick production business.

loans.use: To buy land for brick production

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es: El grupo esta compuesto por 8 personas  de las cuales la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesto de la siguiente manera: la presidenta es la Sra. Juana vive en casa propia  en la localidad de mayu molino zona de Chiñata , vive junto con los hijos  y su esposo, la mencionada señora es  buena líder y se dedica a la venta de papa en la cancha de papas de sacaba  como su principal actividad, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería papa por carga; la secretaria es la señora Rocío vive en casa familiar  de la  zona,  se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en el mismo domicilio, con el dinero del crédito comprara papa para la elaboración de sus salchipapas. Dicho grupo se conocen muy bien por que un 70% del grupo son cercanos por sus puestos de venta en la cancha de papas de Sacaba, es por eso que son muy unidas se ven casi diariamente ya que siempre están en comunicación; el único varón del grupo es portero en la escuela que esta a lado de su casa, el Sr no se encuentra en la foto, El grupo solicita  el crédito para la invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 8 people whose governing board is composed thus:  the President, Juana, lives in her own house located in Mayu Molino, Chiñata, with her children and husband.  She is a good leader.  Her main activity is selling potatoes at the Sacaba Potato Cancha (open air market).  She will use the money from the loan to buy potatoes by the load.

The Secretary is Rocío.  She lives in the family home in the zone and sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage) at home.  With the money from the loan she will buy potatoes to make her salchipapas.

The group members know each other very well because 70% of them have neighboring sales stands at the Sacaba potato market.  Because of this they are very united; they see each other almost daily so are always in communication.  The only male in the group is a doorman at the school next door to his house; he is not in the photo.  The group is asking for the loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy potatoes by the load.

loans.name: Martita

texts.es:
La Sra. Martita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hjos, 01 aún depende de ella.   

Martita, es una mujer trabajadora y dado su espíritu optimista que siempre la ha caracterizado, hoy en día lleva 03 años dedicándose al servicio de duplicado de llaves, negocio ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar amplio y acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes, nos cuenta que a diario acuden muchos de ellos. 

Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará materiales nuevos, como alicates, clavos y muchas herramientas mas, para elaborar sus duplicados de llaves.

Martita se siente muy bien al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le han ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que éstos sean respetados. Agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Martita belongs to the communal bank “Las Aguerridas II" in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province.  She is 48 years old, lives with a partner, and is the mother of 4 children, 1 of whom is still a dependent.

Martita is a hardworking woman and has always been known for her optimistic spirit. For 3 years she has had a business duplicating keys, which is located in her own home.  She attends to her customers in a large part of her home that has been set up for this business.  She tells us that many customers come to her business each day.

With this loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will buy new materials such as pliers, nails and many other tools, to use in her key duplication business.  

Martita feels great about belonging to a group of women who have helped her to understand her rights better, and together, have become well-respected.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for helping her to get started as a businesswoman.

loans.use: she will buy materials to make keys, such as pliers, nails and many other tools.

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 01 hijo.
	
Ante la necesidad de aportar a los gastos de su hogar y motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio de Venta de Cosméticos por catálogo (Unique, Avon, Esika, Natura) obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en su misma casa, desde allí ella puede atender los pedidos y también los ofrece casa por casa a sus amistades y conocidos. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa de alcanzar poco a poco sus metas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00, comprará  mas productos de belleza, para tenerlos en stock como: colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas para damas y caballeros, lápiz labiales y para contornos de ojos , polvos compactos,  y otros productos  mas, todo esto para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Monica Maribel, se siente muy feliz del negocio que realiza y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que brindan a mujeres que quieren salir adelante,  espera que sigan así siempre y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mónica Maribel, 38, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.  She is single and has a son.

Due to the need of providing for her household expenses and self-motivated she started her small catalogue cosmetics sales business (Unique, Avon, Esika, Natura) obtaining very good results from the very beginning.  Her business is located in her house.  She takes orders there but also visits house to house to offer her goods to friends and acquaintances.  She is still in the same business and is very proud to have reached her goals little by little.

She will use this 2500 new sol loan to buy more beauty products to have in stock like: colognes, perfumes, talc, deodorants, creams for men and women, lipsticks, eyeliner pencils, compact powders and other products in order to keep her customers happy.

Mónica Maribel feels very happy with the business she’s in and appreciates the Manuela Ramos Movement for the support they give to women who want to get ahead.  She hopes they stay that way always helping many families and enterprising women.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agricola que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un kiosco instalado en el paradero de carros de la ruta Chepén - Chiclayo. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos como golosinas, chocolates, y gaseosas. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad Clara apoya a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Clara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería y asi  ofrecer variedad de productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Clara is 47 years old, married and lives with her family in the Chepen district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in the La Libertad region, more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Clara has a kiosk that is set up at one of the car stops on the Chepen-Chiclayo route.  There she offers her customers a variety of products for sale, including candy, chocolates and soft drinks.  She has had this business for 10 years, and now has a regular and loyal customer base.  Thanks to this business, Clara helps her husband to support their family and this has helped them to get ahead over time.

Clara wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety of products and satisfy the demand of her customers.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to acquire more products for her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es Soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 02 niñas que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le caracterizo y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva varios años ejerciendo este tipo de negocio. Poco a poco fue ganando experiencia, confianza y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.
Con lo que actualmente logro con clientela fija; amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos de productos como: leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras de la zona, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

 Betty está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Betty belongs to the communal ban “Los Eucaliptos” in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province. She is single, 38 years old, and is the mother of 2 dependent children.

Betty has always been known for her tenacious spirit and her strong desire to get a head through her own means, and this motivated her to start her own grocery store.  She tells us that she has had this business for a number of years.  Little by little, she gained experience and confidence and became well-known and liked by her customers.  

Now she has a regular customer base, including friends from the neighborhood, residents and neighbors, who come to her store daily to buy her products.

With this loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy different types of products such as milk, cases of canned fish of various brands, oatmeal packets, tea in different flavors (chamomile and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Betty is content with the business that she manages every day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy different types of products such as milk, cases of canned fish of various brands, oatmeal packets, tea in different flavors (chamomile and anise), local vegetables, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Milka es una mujer muy alegre y muy preocupada por salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de licores, la cual le ayudaron a poner sus padres hace mucho tiempo, su negocio siempre para lleno ya que vende sus productos a precios muy cómodos. A ella le gusta su trabajo, disfruta mucho el aconsejar a sus clientes, sobre cual es el licor de mayor calidad que pueden comprar. Para ella su mayor prioridad es el tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender toda clase de licores y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lleva 12 años realizando este trabajo y lo más difícil de su negocio es conseguir los licores de calidad y diferenciarlas de las adulteradas. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y desea pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros posteriormente, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le da alegría al resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que recibirá, comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda de licores.
texts.en:
41-year old Milka is a friendly, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her three much-loved children. They are the reason she works so hard. Milka is a cheerful person but concerned about the future so she decided to open a liquor store some time ago with the help of her parents. The store is always full since she sells the products for a good price.

Milka likes her work and enjoys advising her customers about the best quality liquor to buy. Her greatest wish is to have a bigger store where she can sell all types of drinks and thus increase her income.  She’s been doing this work for twelve years. Her biggest problem is obtaining quality liquor which has not been tampered with.

This will be her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and she wants to make her repayments punctually and get another loan in the future. Milka is well-liked by the other members of her community bank since she always makes everyone feel happy. With the money she receives, she plans to buy more drinks and expand the stock in her liquor store.

loans.use: to buy more high-quality drinks

loans.name: Libia

texts.en:
Libia, a native of northern Peru, was a school teacher for 25 years before moving to the United States with her grown children in 1995. Suddenly, she was unsure of what she could do for a living in her new home. “There are so many opportunities in this country, but not knowing English was a huge barrier. Where could I work if I didn’t speak the language?” 
 
Eager to continue working with children, Libia began volunteering with preschool and afterschool programs in San Francisco as a childcare provider and Spanish teacher. A coworker, noticing Libia’s expertise, soon suggested she open her own in-home childcare business. “I didn’t even know such a thing existed!”, Libia recalled. 
 
Libia’s in-home childcare center, called "Nest Garden Heart", has now been in business for nearly 15 years and Libia is a pillar in her community. “It is amazing to work with children and to be able to watch them grow,” says Libia. “Many of them first come to my home when they’re as young as 2 months old, and stay until they are ready to go to preschool. I’m there as they take their first steps and get their first teeth.” 
 
Nest Garden Heart offers a wide variety of activities and resources to help the children learn and grow, including areas dedicated to reading, music, theater and costumes, and art. This encouraging educational environment is particularly important given that many of the children in her care are special needs or at-risk youth who come to Nest Garden Heart via San Francisco family service agencies. Libia also offers overnight childcare to parents who work the night-shift and need a safe space to leave their children.  
 
Since Libia received her first loan from Opportunity Fund in 2006, she has used two microloans to renovate her backyard and set up a garden and play space. Now, with a loan Libia will be able to purchase new equipment and furniture designed for special needs children, replace worn-out and missing educational supplies, and ensure that her small business continues to be a success.

loans.use: For equipment and furniture for special needs children, and to replace missing or damaged educational materials

loans.name: Luis Albeiro

texts.es:
Ofrecerle a sus hijas la posibilidad de acceder a educación universitaria es el sueño de Luis Albeiro Q. Salazar, quien desde hace 25 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de repuestos en la Plaza Minorista de Medellín Colombia. 

Para ampliar su negocio Albeiro necesita de un préstamo que le permita comprar más herramientas y así ofrecer mayores posibilidades de compra para sus clientes lo que permitirá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
To provide his daughters with the chance to go to university is the dream of Luis Albeiro Q. Salazar. He decided to start his own business selling spare parts in the Plaza Minorista in Medellín, Colombia, 25 years ago.

In order to expand his business Albeiro needs a loan to buy more tools so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products and thus increase sales.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 36 años y sus 2 queridos hijos George de 12 y Juan de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Norma ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, los cuales los comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
36-year old Norma is a friendly, hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her 36-year old husband Julio and their two much-loved children George (12) and Juan (8). She wishes to provide them with a better standard of living.

By working hard Norma has managed to make her fields more productive. She grows coffee and bananas which she sells wholesale in the town of La Merced.

Her farm has provided the income necessary to support the household so she wishes to put all her earnings into improving the business. She most enjoys caring for her crops, a job she’s been doing for ten years. The most difficult part of the work is transporting the produce to La Merced as the bags are heavy and make her tired.

In the future Norma would like to buy more land and increase production. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has always been very punctual with the repayments on her previous loans and expects to be the same this time. She is an active member of the community bank, always in agreement with what the group decides.  With the loan money she plans to buy more fertilizer and insecticide to use on her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ebert de 44 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Norma es una de las más visitadas en Kimiri, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo,  ya que no quiere causar problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Norma, 35, is a sincere, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Ebert, 44, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. 

Norma’s store is one of the most popular in Kimiri.  She opens very early in the morning to await her neighbors who come by to buy what they need.  She is a very cheerful, attentive seller since she always welcomes her customers with a smile and is always willing to help them with their purchases.

What she enjoys most about the work is chatting with her neighbors.  She’s been in business for two years and considers having to stay in the store without being able to go out to be the most difficult part of it.  In time she hopes to expand the store and fill it with more merchandise to offer her customers a better selection of goods.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is willing to make all her payments on time because she does not want to cause her communal bank any problems where she is very well liked by the other members.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more products to better stock the store.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en: Guillermina is 60 years old, married, and has seven children who are all in school. She is using her loan of 1,500 PEN towards the construction of a new house. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun" and has been with FINCA Peru for one year, after being introduced by her sister. She has used past loans to purchase grocery products to sell in her store in Pueblo Sucre, several hours outsiD. of Ayacucho.

loans.use: Construction materials for a new house

loans.name: Santos Maritza

texts.es:
Santos tiene 34 años, es casada y reside con  su esposo y sus tres hijos en su domicilio que se ubica en la ciudad de Guadalupe, situado en la provincia de Pacasmayo perteneciente al departamento de La Libertad, ubicado a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido. Para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She and her family live in the city of Guadalupe, province of Pacasmayo, department of Libertad, located over three hours from the city of Chidayo.  

She sells cosmetics to her neighbors and friends by catalog.  Everyday, she strives to attract more customers because the more orders she generates for the company that provides the products, the more income she earns. The business helps her settle her personal expenses and support her husband in maintaining the household budget.

Santos wishes to expand her business by installing a stand in her home to sell her cosmetics. In this way, the products will be close at hand for her customers and they will not have to wait for the order to arrive at the end of the month.  For this reason, she needs to acquire more products. In order to achieve her goal, she believed it was appropriate to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase additional beauty products.

loans.name: Miriam Noemi

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, ella tiene  años 56 años de edad, está separada hace ya algún tiempo atrás y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad solo su hija menor que ya es casada vive en su casa con su familia.

Trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero además de esto se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días de dos a tres horas por dia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todas las  semanas, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 10 años y que le va muy bien, lo que más vende según nos cuenta son los cosméticos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Esta desde el segundo ciclo que se formo el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener recursos suficientes para ayudar a sus hijos a que tengan sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Esperanza Nueva Communal Banks meets in the city of Tosagua, a place that is known for being very dynamic.  Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is also an area of abundant vegetation.  

In this place, we meet Miriam.  She is 56 years old and separated from her husband some time ago.  She has 5 children from this relationship, all adults. Her youngest daughter is married and she and her and her family live at home with Miriam.   

She is a teacher at the town school but in addition she has a business selling Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories).  She works two to three hours a day leaving her products on credit and collecting payments each week.  She tells us that she has been in this business for ten years and that she is doing very well. She also tells us that cosmetics are the product that she sells the most.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  The loan is from the communal bank’s second cycle.  Miriam is pleased because the payments are easy to make.  She dreams of having sufficient resources to help her children establish their own businesses.    
.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Iliana

texts.en:
Flowers were an important part of Iliana’s life long before she realized they could become her profession. While growing up in Guadalajara, Mexico, and after moving to the United States with her husband, Iliana frequently created flower arrangements for family events such as weddings, baptisms, and quinceañeras. 

When Iliana decided to open up her own florist shop, people told her that starting her own business was too difficult and she would fail. Now, six years later, she says that defying those predictions is one her proudest accomplishments. “Everyone told me I wouldn’t be able to do it– but look! Now they see that they were wrong. I was determined to succeed, and I did.” 

Owning a small business has not come without its challenges.
