Iliana and her husband founded the business with their own savings and, by sticking to a tight budget, successfully expanded from mobile flower sales in a parking lot to operating their own shop. “We are growing and earning more money, but it can be difficult each month to pay for our house, or business, and our normal expenses,” explains Iliana. “We didn’t even know that a loan was an option for a tiny business like ours. We couldn’t believe it was true at first!” 

A $500 microloan, her first from Opportunity Fund, helped Iliana to expand her shop’s inventory of flowers and gifts in time for Valentine’s Day, and consequently boost her sales revenue. This loan will also help her begin to establish a credit history and give her the option to seek larger business loans in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory of flowers and gifts for Valentine's Day

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es:
Esther de 26 años, es una mujer trabajadora que está trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicación para sus hijos de 12 y 5 años ya que esta actualmente separada. 

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa en donde vende arroz, azúcar, lácteos y otros productos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando todos los días. Quiere continuar con su negocio con mas víveres comprando con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, plásticos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere tener un local bien surtido con mercadería diversa.
texts.en: Esther is a hard-working 26 year old woman.  Since she is separated at the moment, she is dedicated to her children, ages 12 and 5.  She has a small store in the front part of her home where she sells rice, sugar, dairy, and other products.  Because she has many aspirations for her business, she wants to continue working every day.  In order to keep her business going, she will use the loan  to buy more supplies such as rice, sugar, and plastics.  She has many aspirations for the future and wants to have a local that offers a wide assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, plastics.

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es: Senaida, una mujer de 36 años. Vive junto a su esposo Salomón y a sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de la Merced (selva central peruana). Su trabajo se centra en la realización de cajones de madera que sirven para el almacenamiento de la fruta que es vendida al por mayor. Diariamente Senaida, realiza un promedio de 200 cajones, obteniendo una ganancia neta de 90 soles semanales. También se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, chupetes y helados en su casa; ya todos los vecinos la conocen, tanto así que en época de verano tiene gran acogida. Pero la agricultura, actividad que realiza desde niña, es lo que más le gusta a ella. En el terreno que adquirió, comenzó a sembrar café, lo que cuidó y fertiliza durante su crecimiento; y ya muy pronto cosechará. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es responsable y puntual. Senaida, se está preparando para la primera cosecha de su planta de café que sembró hace dos años, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Senaida, 36, lives with her husband, Salomón, and their three children in her own house located in the city of Merced (Peruvian central jungle).  Her job is making wood crates that are used to store fruit that is sold at wholesale.  Every day Senaida makes about 200 crates earning a weekly net profit of 90 soles.  She also sells soft drinks, frozen fruit treats and ice cream at home.  All of her neighbors know her, so much so that in summer she has a huge welcome.  What she likes best, however, is agriculture – something she’s done since she was a little girl. She started planting coffee on a field she acquired; she cares for it and fertilizes it while it’s growing.  Harvest will be soon now.

She is a member of the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimistic Ones) communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP where she is responsible and punctual.  

Senaida is getting ready for her first coffee harvest from plants she planted two years ago.  She is, therefore, thinking of using the loan to buy organic manure to spread among her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic manure to spread among her crops.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, ella tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 9 y 8 de edad  los mismos que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo está haciendo la rural para Lic. en enfermería. Ella es egresada en Ing. Comercial en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo  como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  envases de plástico y artículos de fiestas infantiles,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, por el momento trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos ya que  su esposo está haciendo la rural, nos cuenta que tiene  su negocio ya por 15 años y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embases plásticos y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic.  Most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raise animals because it is an area with great vegetation.

This is the place where we meet Sonia.  She is 37, married, and she and her husband have three children.  The children are 11, 9, and 8, and they go to school.  Her husband is doing his required service in a rural area for his nursing license.  She is a commercial engineer graduate from Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

She has a store selling consumer goods like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, plastic containers, and items for children’s parties.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Sometimes she works even later.  She now works with help from her children because her husband is doing his required service.  She tells us that she has had the business for 15 years, and it has gone well for her.

She will use this loan to better supply her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, plastic containers, and other products.  She has been in her Communal Bank for five years.  She likes it because she has made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to have her business grow more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María  tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo en el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas como cerveza y chicha de jora, ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 2 años y es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía familiar.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de productos ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María, 48, is married and lives with her three children and her husband in the Valle San Juan Hamlet in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She sells beverages like beer and chicha de jora (drink based on fermented corn) to her neighbors and people who come into the zone to work.  She’s been in business for two years and it is of great help to her family because through it she’s able to help support the family economy.

María would like to expand the business buying products because demand has increased.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her pub.

loans.name: Delia Carmita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Delia, ella tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace tiempo. En la actualidad sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y su hija vive donde ella con su familia. Su esposo es comerciante.

Trabaja de maestra en una escuela en Tosagua, pero además de esto se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todas las tardes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todas las  semanas, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 10 años y que le va muy bien, lo mas vende es la bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el tercer ciclo que se formo el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijas sigan superándose, una de ellas estudia medicina.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic where most of its residents are farmers or raise livestock; it is an area with much vegetation.

This is where we met Delia, 50.  She’s married and had three children but one of them died some time ago.  Currently, her two children are adults but her daughter and her family live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She’s employed as a Teacher in a school in Tosagua but she’s also a merchant; she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every afternoon.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for 10 years already and does very well.  What she sells most is the costume jewelry.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  She’s been a member since the bank’s third cycle and she likes it because the loans have helped her quite a bit.  Her dreams are that her daughters continue to better themselves; one of them is studying Medicine.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y Departamento de Puno.  Está casada, tiene 41 años de edad y  tiene 06 hijos.  Estudio hasta 5to de educación primaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año y medio, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando una vaca lechera, trabaja junto con su esposo,  paralelamente trabajan en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, cebada, habas.  Hilda nos cuenta que su esposo trabaja en construcción civil como obrero. 
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar los ganados.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She’s married, 41 years old and has six children.  She finished fifth grade.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her livestock buying and selling business.

She will ask for a new 1500 new sol loan to buy a dairy cow.  She works alongside her husband in the fields farming potatoes, quinoa, barley and lima beans.  Hilda tells us that her husband works in civil construction as a laborer.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve the livestock.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the training sessions.

loans.use: She will buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es una mujer D. 53 años, que junto a su esposo José cuidan D. sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad D. La Merced (selva central peruana). Hace 10 años que se dedica al trasporte con sus 2 motos carros en el interior D. la ciudad (movilidad a base D. motocicletas acondicionadas), todas las mañanas desD. muy temprano sale a supervisar los vehículos, para después dirigirse a una casa D. venta D. motos, y demás vehículos. Pero conocedora D. este negocio, ella también se dedica a la venta D. accesorios del hogar como: manteles, vasos, platos, secadoras, y demás artículos; es que así que por su variedad D. productos, ella logró obtener muchos clientes, razón por la que más adelante desea instalar una tienda equipada, granD. y sobre todo propia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”,  este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donD. es una socia responsable y muy comprometida. María como es D. costumbre comprará mercadería, por ello con el crédito comprará electrodomésticos para abastecer la necesidad D. sus clientes. Asimismo comprará repuestos para arreglar su motocicleta.
texts.en:
María is a 53 year old woman who together with her husband, José, cares for their two children in their own home located in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central jungle).

For the last ten years she has been providing  transportation services with her two mototaxis in the city (vehicles based on modified motorcycles).  She goes out early every morning to supervise the vehicles to later go to a firm selling motorcycles and other vehicles.  

Because she is well versed in this business she also sells items for the home: tablecloths, glasses, plates, dryers and other articles.  Because of the variety of products she has been able to secure many customers.  For this reason she’d like to set up a well equipped, large, but above all of her own, store in the future.

She is a member of the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimistic Ones) communal bank.  This is her fifth loan with MFP where she’s a responsible, very committed member.

As usual, María will buy merchandise so will use the loan to buy appliances to meet customer needs.  Similarly, she will buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy applianced and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 03 hijos.  La señora no estudio en ningún centro educativo. 
Hace un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará tres unidades de ovejas, trabaja junto con su esposo y sus hijos.  Además se dedica a la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, habas, cebada, etc.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 57 years old, married and has three children.  She did not go to any school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year.  She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her domestic animal buying and selling business.

She will use this 500 new sol loan to buy three sheep; she works alongside her husband and children.  Besides, she also farms potatoes, quinoa, lima beans, barley, etc. in her fields.

Her dream is to improve the business, above all her income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction.

loans.use: Will buy three sheep.

loans.name: Denny Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Denny, ella tiene 32años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 7 y 10 meses de edad de los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y dos  en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y estudia en la Universidad  Ing. En Sistemas.

En esta ocasión ella está realizando el crédito para su esposo ya que este es el soporte de su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura y por el momento quiere sembrar tres hectáreas de maíz, nos cuenta que ya tiene listo el terreno pero no tienen para las semillas,  químicos y abonos que se requieren para obtener una buena cosecha, en el verano cuando no siembran ellos realizan los créditos para la cría de pollos pero que en la actualidad no lo hacen porque en el invierno es muy riesgoso criar estos animalitos.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, químicos, abonos y otros productos para tener una buena cosecha. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro años y le gusta porque los créditos son una gran ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que vive con los suegros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esperanza Nueva [New Hope] meets bimonthly in the city of Tosagua which is known for being very dynamic and an area with lots of vegetation.  The majority of the residents raise animals and work in agriculture for a living.  

Here lives Señora Denny.  She is 32 years old, married and has four children ages 14, 11, 7 and 10 months.  The oldest attends secondary school and two attend elementary school.  Her husband works in agriculture and is studying systems engineering at the university.   

She is requesting a loan for her husband since he is the provider for the family.  He wants to plant three hectares of corn.  She tells us that the land is ready to plant, however, he doesn't have the seeds, chemicals or fertilizers necessary to obtain a good harvest.  In the summer when he is not planting, he uses the loan to raise chickens, but currently, it is winter and this is a risky time to raise these small animals.  

She will use this loan to purchase seeds, chemicals, fertilizers and other products to ensure a good harvest.  She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the loans have been very helpful.  Her dream is to have her own house since she lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc roofing material

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,  estudio hasta 3º de educación secundaria. 
Hace un año y medio viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de animales  como chanchos, ovinos, etc.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará una vaca lechera y un chancho, también cuenta que trabaja en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, habas, apilla, olluco, para luego venderlo.  Trabaja sola a veces le ayuda su sobrina.
Su sueño es mejorar el ganado y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Juliana, 64, is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She’s single and finished third grade.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  Her initial 300 new sol loan was used for her livestock, pigs, sheet, etc. raising business.

She will use this 2000 new sol loan to buy a dairy cow and a pig.  She also tells us that she works her fields farming potato, quinoa, lima beans, apilla (a tuber), olluco (a tuber) to later sell.  She works alone with occasional help from her niece.

Her dream is to improve the livestock in order to improve her income.  

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and what her savings earn.

loans.use: She will buy a dairy cow and a pig.

loans.name: Presentación

texts.es:
Presentación es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío La Pala del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos, cabras, etc en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace dos años y cuenta con clientela establecida.

Presentación desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta además realizar unos arreglos en su corral para el mejor desarrollo de sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Presentación is a 52 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in their own house, located in the La Pala settlement in the Tambogrande region. It is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

He raises and sells young animals and caged birds, such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, goats, etc. He keeps them in a corral in back of his house and when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area where he lives. He has been doing this work for two years and has an established clientele.

Presentación would like to acquire a balanced diet for his birds since the demand for them is increasing. He would also like to make some repairs to his corral so that his animals will develop better. For this reason he decided to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to provide his animals with a balanced diet

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene un hijo. Solo pudo estudiar hasta la primaria.
Hace tres años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales caseros.
Con éste nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará ovejas y una vaca.  Trabaja junto con su esposo, también trabajan en la chacra.  Nos cuenta que su esposo tiene trabajo y ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el ganado y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maritza, 20, is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She’s married and has a son.  She was only able to finish elementary school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business selling domestic animals.

She will use this new 1500 new sol loan to buy sheep and a cow.  She works alongside her husband; they also farm their fields.  She tells us that her husband has work and helps with the household expenses.

Her dream is to have more capital to improve the livestock and her income.

What she enjoys about the communal bank is the meetings.

loans.use: Will buy sheep and a cow.

loans.name: Dioselina María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Dioselina, ella tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de   siete hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 7 años que estudia en escuela y que es como su hijo. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por seis años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de parte de sus compañeras como de la institución.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada la misma que es de dos a tres meses de acuerdo a la raza que ella lleve, nos cuenta que hasta su casa llegan los comerciantes a quienes les entrega a precios razonables y con los cuales le quede ganancias. Lleva algunos años que se dedica a esta actividad, los pollos los compra pequeños en una incubadora en Tosagua.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para estos. Sus sueños son tener una gran comercializadora y productora de pollos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic where most of its residents raise animals and are farmers because it’s an area with much vegetation.

We met Dioselina, 52, here.  She’s a single mother of 7 children who are all adult and independent.  She lives with a 7 year old grandson who is in school and is like her son.  She’s been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the help she gets from her fellow members and from the institution.

She raises chickens.  She has a small farm where she can place up to 200 chicken per season which can last two to three months according to the breed she brings.  She tells us that merchants come all the way to her house and she sells to them at reasonable prices so as to have some profits. She’s been in this work for several years.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Tosagua.

This loan is to buy chicks, feed and medicines for them.  Her dreams are to have a large chicken producing and merchandising firm.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 05 hijos (3 independientes), sólo estudio hasta 2º de primaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año y medio, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará una oveja, chancho y una vaquita.  Paralelamente la señora realiza tejidos como chompas y pantalones.
Trabaja junto con su esposo en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, habas y cebada. 
Su sueño es tener más chanchos porque dice que es mejor venderlos, se obtiene más ganancia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Olga, 48, is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, el Collao province, Puno department.  She has a live-in partner and five children (five independent); she only finished second grade.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her livestock raising business.

She will use this 1500 new sol loan to buy a lamb, a pig and a little cow.  As a parallel occupation she also weaves sweaters and pants.

She works alongside her husband in the fields farming potato, quinoa, lima beans and barley.

What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because the members exchange words.

loans.use: She will buy a lamb, a pig and a little cow.

loans.name: Anabelle Dolores

texts.es:
Anabelle de 52 años, es una microempresaria que comenzó con pocos víveres y ahora tiene una tienda surtida. Tiene con su tienda 10 años ya que la ha sabido administrar bien y ahora la tiene surtida. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm vendiendo víveres. Quiere continuar con su negocio y seguir teniendo ingresos para ayudar económicamente a su familia. Pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para medicinas y poder tener las fuerzas que siempre ha tenido. En el futuro quiere seguir incrementando su negocio
texts.en:
Anabelle, 52, is a micro businesswoman who started out with just a few food items; today she has a well stocked store.  She’s had her store for 10 years and she’s run it well; today it is well stocked.

She is open at present from 6am until 10:30pm selling foodstuffs.  She wants to stay in business and continue to have income to help her family economically.  For now she needs the loan for medicine in order to have the strength she’s had to date.  In the future she’d like to continue expanding the business.

loans.use: For medicine.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia es profesora del nivel de primaria ella da clases a estudiante de 5to grado con 20 años de ser docente , está casada y tiene a cargo 2 hijos los cuales estudian en universidades
Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel este crédito es para la construcción de un cuarto para una de sus hijas
texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia is an elementary school teacher who has been teaching for 20 years.  She currently teaches 5th grade.  She is married and has two children who are university students.

This is her first loan through Ceprodel.  She plans to use it to build a room for one of her daughters.

loans.use: To buy stone, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Edis

texts.es: Edis, una mujer D. 49 años. Vive junto a su esposo Serafín y a sus 2 hijos, en la casa que heredó D. su madre, en la ciudad D. La Merced (selva central peruana). Su pasión, “la cocina”, es la actividad que le genera a Edis, estabilidad económica. DesD. hace 3 años, las vendedoras D. jugo del óvalo D. la ciudad, le compran cada mañana, las ricas empanadas que realiza, pues es muy rico y sobre todo genera gran demanda en los clientes. Diariamente venD. un promedio D. 50 a 60 empanadas. Asimismo está incansable mujer, trabaja por las noches en un restaurante típico, cocinando platos al momento. Ahora Ella planea juntar el capital necesario para poder abrir un restaurante propio, y así podrá ser reconocida y admirada. Ella, pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donD. es una asidua colaboradora. Edis, en los próximos meses comenzará a vender sus ricas empanadas, en mayores cantidades. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos D. harina, mantequilla al por mayor y demás insumos para la realización D. los ricos bocadillos.
texts.en:
Edis is a 49 year old woman living with her husband, Serafín, and their two children in the house she inherited from her mother in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central jungle).  Her passion is “cooking” and it’s also the activity that generates economic stability for Edis.  For the last three years juice sellers in the city have been buying her delicious turnovers every morning because they are so delicious and they generate a lot of demand among the customers.  She sells a daily average of 50 to 60 turnovers.  In addition, this tireless woman works nights in a typical restaurant cooking meals to order.  Now, she plans to save up the necessary capital to open a restaurant of her own so that she’ll be well known and admired.

She’s a member of the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimistic Ones) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where she is a laborious collaborator.  In the upcoming months Edis will start to sell her turnovers in greater amounts so is planning to use the loan to buy several sacks of flour, butter at wholesale and the other ingredients she needs to make these delicious snacks

loans.use: To buy ingredients like butter and flour to make more snacks.

loans.name: Angela Ubilvida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por el apoyo para cualquier actividad y por la responsabilidad del personal. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 17 años que está en colegio, dos de sus hijos viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Este crédito es para el negocio del esposo que es quien mantiene su hogar, ella le ayuda asistiendo a las reuniones y nos cuenta que esta es su forma de contribuir al hogar. El se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres,  
hay días que trabaja en el mercado de tosagua y otros que recorre con sus productos por toda la localidad en su carro. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00, también se dedica a la compra y venta de plátano. Lo que es fruta y legumbres los compra en el mercado mayorista y a agricultores de la zona ya que le salen más baratos.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, frutas y legumbres. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de abarrotes y ganar más dinero para ayudar mas en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank Esperanza Nueva meets every fortnight.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most people work in agriculture and animal husbandry, being an area with abundant vegetation.

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and she is liked for her support for any activity and her personal responsibility.  She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children from this marriage.  Three of the children are already grown and her youngest, a pretty 17-year-old girl, is in high school.  Two of her children live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

This loan is for her husband's business, as he maintains their home.  She helps him to attend meetings and she tells us that this is her way of contributing to the household.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  There are days when she works in the markets of Tosagua and other places and travels all over town with their products in her car.  She works everyday from 5 am till 2 pm and is also engaged in buying and selling plantains.  She purchases the fruit and vegetables in the wholesale market and from local farmers, as it is cheaper.

This loan is to buy plantains, fruits, and vegetables.  Her dreams are to have a grocery store and to make more money to help with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, plantains and other fruits.

loans.name: Johanna Lizbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

Aquí conocimos a Johanna, tiene 22 años de edad,  está soltera y  estudian en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí donde cursa el decimo semestre de medicina. Ella vive en casa de sus padres, tiene cuatro hermanos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro   ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 100 pollos por temporada la misma que es de dos a tres meses, los entrega a los comerciantes de la localidad o también a las tiendas de la zona, sus padres le ayudan en su labor ya que es a través de esto ella se puede financiar su carrera  que  es muy costosa. Los pollos los compra pequeños en una incubadora en Tosagua.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para estos. Sus sueños son graduarse de doctora e irse a especializar a otro pais.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esperanza Nueva (New Hope) meets in the city of Tosagua every fifteen days. This area is known for being very dynamic, with the majority of its residents working in agriculture and in raising animals, and for being a region with grand vegetation.

Here we meet Johanna, who is 22 years old. She is single and studies at the Technical University of Manabi, where she is in the tenth semester of medical studies. She lives in her parents' house and has four brothers and sisters. She has already been in the communal bank for four cycles, and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans.

Johanna raises chickens. She has a small farm in which she raises up to 100 chickens at a time for two to three months. Then she turns them over to local business people or to the stores in the area. Her parents help her with the work since it is through her work that she is able to finance her studies, which are very expensive. She buys the chickens at an incubator in Tosagua when they are small.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for them. Johanna's dream is to graduate as a doctor and go to another country to study a specialty.

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Angela Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen una linda niña de seis años de edad la misma que estudia  en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una compañía y también se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella está realizando el crédito para su esposo, el se dedica a la agricultura y por el momento tiene sembrado dos hectáreas de maíz y otra de maní, ahora necesita para los  químicos y abonos que se requieren para obtener una buena cosecha, el trabaja de lunes a viernes con la ayuda de otra persona a quien le paga un salario a la semana cuando hay que realizar un trabajo en los cultivos.

Este crédito es para comprar químicos y abonos para tener una buena cosecha. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio  y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado de mucho en momentos difíciles cuando no han tenido dinero para financiar los costos de su negocio. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios para Ing. Comercial que dejo inconclusos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esperanza Nueva (New Hope) meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, with most of its inhabitants working in agriculture and raising animals, and for being an area with grand vegetation.

Here we meet Señora Angela. She is 28 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have a pretty little six-year-old daughter who is in school. Her husband works for a company and also works in agriculture.

Angela is taking out the loan for her husband. He works in agriculture, and at this time he has two hectares planted with corn and another with peanuts. Now he needs the loan for the chemicals and fertilizers that are required to obtain a good harvest. He works from Monday to Friday with the help of another person, to whom he pays a weekly salary when he needs work done in the fields.

This loan will be used to buy chemicals and fertilizers to have a good harvest. Angela has been in the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans have helped a lot in difficult times when they didn't have money to finance the costs of their business. Her dreams are to finish her studies in commercial engineering, which she left uncompleted.

loans.use: Buy chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Magdalenas De Telixtac Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA MAGDALENAS DE TELIXTAC, POR HONOR A LA PATRONA DEL PUEBLO LA CUAL ES SANTA MARIA MAGDALENA. ESTE GRUPO CUENTA CON 10 INTEGRANTES, UNA DE ELLAS ES LA SEÑORA BAUDELIA M. P. QUE ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO Y MADRE DE FAMILIA DE 2 NIÑOS DE 12 Y 7 AÑOS DE EDAD, AMBOS ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA DEL PUEBLO, SU ESPOSO DE LA SEÑORA BAUDELIA SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA EN EL CAMPO. LA SEÑORA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO LA CUAL A IDO CRECIENDO CON SUS LOS CREDITOS QUE LE HAN OTORGADO, LLEVA YA 12 AÑOS EN SU NEGOCIO Y MENCIONA QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO SE HA CUMPLIDO, EL CUAL ES, QUE SUS HIJOS CUENTEN CON UNA MEJOR OPORTUNDAD DE SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO PARA BRINDARLES UNA CARRERA PROFESIONAL. ELLA PIDE ESTE CREDITO PARA SEGUIR CUBRIENDO LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES YA QUE CADA VEZ TIENE MÁS CLIENTES QUE LA RECOMIENDAN POR SU DEDICACIÓN Y CALIDAD EN SUS PRODUCTOS.La señora es Delgadina S. es la que no se alcanza a ver porque se movio al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called "Magdalenas de Telixtac" in honor of the patron saint of the village, Saint Mary Magdalene.  It is comprised of 10 members, one of whom is Mrs. Baudelia M. P. who is the treasurer of the group and mother of two children, ages 12 and 7.  Both children attend the village school.  Mrs. Baudelia's husband raises crops.  She has a fruit and vegetable business that she runs out of her own home.  She has been able to increase her activity, which she has been working at for 12 years now, with the loans she has received.  

She says her greatest dream has already come true, meaning her children have had the best opportunity to continue their studies toward a professional career.  She plans to use this loan to continue to meet customer demand.  Her customer base is constantly increasing since she has a good reputation for dedication and product quality.

N.B.  Mrs. Delgadina S. is not pictured in the photo because she moved when it was being taken.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina es una madre de familia de 62 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Malingas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, Jovina cría su ganado en un corral ubicado en su domicilio cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece a los vecinos de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. 

Jovina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar el desarrollo de su ganado y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jovina is 62 years old and is the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and their four children in the village of Malingas, located in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone that is situated in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For many years Jovina has raised and sold sheep. She raises them in a corral at her home. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them to neighbors in the area. She also works in agriculture.

Jovina wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the development of her animals and receive better earnings. To do this, she believed it would be convenient to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Chheun

texts.en: Chheun V. is a 38-year-old fisherman and father, blessed with five children, all of whom are attending the public high school. His wife, Chea Khan, 39, is a palm juice seller at her house, and earns an income $3 per day. In addition to his fishing business, Chheun uses his old motorcycle to deliver passers-by around the community for a fee. He runs his business very well because he has good communicatioin skills with his customers. However, his income is not enough because his motorcycle is too small to carry many passengers. Chheun V. has decided to ask for a loan of $800 to buy a trailer to connect to the existing motorcycle.   He will use it to pick up more passengers.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to the existing motorcycle so that he can use it to pick up more passengers.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Don Juan Francisco habitante de Nueva Guinea,  su familia esta conformada por su Esposa y un hijo, desde hace 17 años labora como docente para el Ministerio de Educacion brindando enseñanza a niños y jovenes, siendo su  principal actividad que le genera ingreso para sastifacer sus necesidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.

nesecita este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales de construccion, para realizarle el piso a su casa de habitacion y asi poder vivir en mejores condiciones,  lo cual espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño.  

Pues su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda y darles lo mejor a su Familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Francisco lives in Nueva Guinea.  His family is comprised of his wife and a son.  For 17 years he has been working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher to children and adolescents.  He is the main source of income for household expenses and improving quality of life.

He is in need of a loan to buy construction materials to add a second level onto his home in order to improve living conditions.  He hopes to receive help from KIVA so he can carry out his dream, which is to improve his home and give his family the best he can.

loans.use: To add a second level to his house

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
From Phnom Penh City, Phan S. is 29 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than five years. He and his wife sell fish that they buy from their wholesale supplier. He is married to Keo Sengheng, 26, who works at selling fish with him also. 

Besides this work, Phan S. has also been planting a rice crop as his annual business. Phan S. is looking for a $500 loan as capital to support his farming business. He will use the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the farmland

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P., age 31, is a photographer in a local shop in Phnnom Penh City. She has worked at this business since 2000. She is unmarried and lives with her elderly mother, a homemaker who cooks good meals for the family members living with her. 

Sok P. would like to request a loan in order to buy furniture for her mother's house. This loan will provide those who live in the house with a greater level of comfort.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her mother's house, where she lives with other members of her family

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa M., age 50, is a local cloth vendor in Phnom Penh. Sa M. sells cloth retail to passersby from village to village around her community. Most of her buyers need her cloth to use for their uniforms and for decorating. She makes a profit of approximately $3 per day from her investment and contributes her income to provide her family daily food. Her husband assists her in selling cloth. Sa M. has four children: two are married and two are students, who also help sell her product when they are not studying. Sa M. is asking for a loan to purchase more cloth to sell in order to gain additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for selling

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin P., 41, lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap. She and her husband currently make a daily income of $7 per day working as porters in the fish market. The couple has five children who are single; most of them are not long in school. To help respond to the family's needs, one of their children works as a porter at the same place. 

She always needs to hire a taxi to go to work because she has no vehicle. Rin P. is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle, which will be used to ride to her job location.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to ride to her job location

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman who lives in Quezon, Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling fruits & vegetables.  Her husband Conrado, who is 59 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 12 to 37 years old. Carmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she added to her working capital, helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell so that she can continue to save up for the higher education of her children and expansion of her business. Carmelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team (http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines) on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 49-year-old married who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buying and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes and buying and selling bananas. She lives in Toboso, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly net income of PHP 1,200. Susana is borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Susana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Launh

texts.en:
Launh T., age 34, is a resident of Kompong Cham, a province of Cambodia. Launh T. earns a living by producing and selling clay stoves. She and her husband work together to produce stoves to offer for sale. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait one or two weeks for their order. For additional income, she also works in construction as a temp. 

Launh T. needs to make necessary repairs to her as yet unfinished house. She is asking for a loan in order to make repairs and to complete work on her house construction. 

She and her husband have four children. All four of the children are students and also assist with their parents' business when they are free from studying.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house and to finish its construction

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: buying & selling herbal products, tricycle transportation and farming. She lives in Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Felisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Felisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. N., age 26, is a seamstress in the garment industry. Sar S. N. has been engaged in this job since 2005 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband, who works in the construction field. They have two children and help each other support the family. Neither of the children are enrolled in school. 

Sar S. N. is concerned because their house is old and needs basic repairs. With these repairs, the family's living conditions would improve considerably. Sar S. N. would like a loan in order to buy wood materials for repairing the home.

loans.use: To buy wood materials for repairing the family home

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman who lives in Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store. Her husband Rodrigo, who is 41 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have three children who are 10 to 21 years old. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the college education of her children and house renovation. Susan is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines  - on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling Nipa, a local light roofing material. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Nipa business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Brenda is borrowing PHP 19,500 to stock up on Nipa to resell as this is usually the time people repair their roofs before the rainy season. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Brenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Gina Carba Group

texts.en:
Gina C. is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Gina is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gina C.’s Group.

To make a living, she owns and operates a guso production business (propagation of seaweed) and a sari-sari store, from which she sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately $75 a month.

In 2011, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her guso production business. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim A. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house in Kompong Tom province. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she grows rice crops from her own farmland. Her family has five children:  one of whom is already married and lives at home, while the other four are single. 

Yim A. will be using her loA. to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loA. will provide her with A. additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by venturing into several businesses: running a general store, buying and selling rice and charcoal. Her husband Pablo, who is 62 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 13 to 26 years old. Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gloria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the college education of her children. It is Gloria's dream that her children graduate from college.  Gloria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima A. is from the village of Gotokan Diot, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a banana and copra (dried coconut) business, selling in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately $55 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Zosima is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be her 9th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna G., 40 years old and a resident of Caloocan City in the Philippines. She is married to Arbi G., a mechanic, and she is the mother to their four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store where she also does a little direct selling of cosmetics, clothing and footwear. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of $9.50 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorna hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to be able to help her neighbors and community through her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Pilarina

texts.en:
Pilarina is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and an abaca weaving businesses. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,200,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of products for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Pilarina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Mrs. Emely A. is from the village of San Roque, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Emely is married to Victor A., a bus driver, and is blessed with four school age and two adult age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending, particularly rice cakes. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, which will be used as additional capital for her business. texts.en:
Mrs. Myrna M. is from the village of Gala, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a farming business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from this activity.
In March 2007, Myrna joined Kiva partner, PMPC, under the Barangay Official Livelihood Assistance (BOLA) program to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her corn production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments and educating her children.

This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and to save for future use, especially for future business expansion.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean S. is a 48-year-old married mother. She and her husband own a medium-sized kiosk next to their house in the village, where they provide bicycle and motor repairing services. The couple repairs vehicles for people who are passing in and out of the province. In addition, Chean S.’s husband buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because selling livestock is the main source of income for this family, Chean S. requested a loan for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla A. is from the village of Gata Diot,Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married and has one daughter which is now married. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month for these activities.
In 2006, Perla joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Perla is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her eight cycle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
