loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Anna Liza A., a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy A., a construction worker, and is mother to their four children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Anna Liza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to members of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns a living by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and other members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Anna Liza hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Azra Dildar Masih's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Mian Channu, a small city known for its agriculture industry, located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house. She is 36 years old and married to D. M..
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s animal sales business. He started this business ten years ago by purchasing a small number of animals. He raised them and sold them to butchers for a profit. With this loan, he will purchase animals (such as goats) and sell them to butchers to make a good profit.
Azra is very hopeful about the future growth of her son’s business and about a better financial future for her family. She has four other children. Her second son helps his father in his wall paint business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting an education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for resale

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin is married and lives with his wife and three-year-old son in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. His wife is unemployed and stays at home to take care of their son. Amartuvshin operates a motorbike taxi service, which he started in 2007. He has now gained enough experience in the transportation business and wants to buy a car. He is a hardworking and modest person who says," I would like to have a stable source of income." Amartuvshin is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to buy spare parts and cover the maintenance service fees for his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay maintenance fees for his motorbike

loans.name: Saba Allah Ditta Masih's Group

texts.en:
Saba lives in Mian Channu, a small city known for its agriculture industry in Punjab, Pakistan. She owns a two-roomed brick house there where she lives with her family.
Saba is 21 years old and married to A. D. M., who sells bricks. He makes contracts with different construction companies to provide them with bricks in bulk quantity. For this purpose he makes business contracts with a variety of brick furnace owners.
Saba is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and carry out her household responsibilities. She is recently married and has no child yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bricks in larger quantity for supplying to his customers. He has been operating this business for ten years and Saba is hopeful that a loan investment will bring better profits to her husband’s business. She is a new loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy bricks for resale

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en: Byambatsogt, 40, is married and lives in a house with his wife and three children in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed. His older son has some health problems and is taught by a long-distance tutor while his two younger sons attend a local school. Byambatsogt owns some livestock in the countryside. He began operating a motorbike taxi business in 2010 after his family came to live in the city to send the children to school. He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I am trying to make money in order to help my son fully recover from his illness." He is requesting a loan of 750,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Enhtuul

texts.en:
Enhtuul, 24, is married and lives with her husband and two-year-old son in Suhbaater province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her father-in-law's backyard. Her husband works as a public bus driver.
Enhtuul began preparing food at home to sell at a local market after she graduated from a vocational training course sponsored by the NGO, Mercy Corps. She hopes that she can operate the business successfully and make it her main source of income. Enhtuul is a modest person. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase food and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and materials for her business

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg, 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land that they own. Her husband operates a public transportation business.
Sarantsetseg opened a food shop with her husband in 2010 in addition to her job as a baker in a local bakery shop. She is requesting a loan of 650,000 MNT to purchase more food for her shop. She is trying to expand her business. Sarantsetseg is a modest and kind person who says, "Now my husband has a motorbike and I wish to help him to buy a car."

loans.use: To purchase more food for her shop

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is one of four members of this group loan. She belongs to Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. She came here seven years ago. 

She is 27 years old, married to A. and has two children. Her elder son is in kindergarten while younger one has not started attending school yet. He is only 3 years old.
 
Her husband is a loader by profession and operates a loading business. He puts loads like vegetables, fruits or construction supplies on his donkey cart and delivers them from one place to another.
 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new donkey cart. His current cart has become rough and urgently needs replacement. With a new cart, he will be able to load more and earn better profits by providing better quality services to his clients. 

Kalsoom is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him more profits in the future.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year she proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Shamim Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhter is a housewife who stays at home and tends to her household responsibilities. She is a very hard working lady and tries her best to give comfort to her family. 
 
She lives with her family in Mian Channu, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains two rooms and she has been living in it for 20 years. 

Her husband has a donkey cart in which he delivers goods from one place to another. He started this business 20 years ago.   

Shamim has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son operates his own donkey cart, the younger one is studying, while her daughter stays at home.
 
Shamim is a member of this group that has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She wishes to use her portion of the loan to improve her husband’s loading business. Now he needs a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and rotten and urgently needs replacement.
 
She is hopeful that this investment will be good one for her family and earn her husband better profits.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Felison

texts.en:
Felison T. was born in 1954. He lives in Yerevan with his wife, his son and his daughter. Felison's children are adults, but they aren’t married and they live with their parents. 

Felison graduated Yerevan State Engineering Collage and long ago he was working as an engineer. But over the last seven years, Felison has been engaged in a shoe-trading business. 

Felison imports shoes from Turkey and resells them in a rented stall in the Hayrenik market in Yerevan. Felison’s wife helps him in the business and so they support their family.
  
Felison asks Kiva lenders for a loan of  2,400 US dollars to buy new spring/summer season shoes from Turkey for his business.

loans.use: To buy new spring/summer season shoes for his business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed belongs to Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 35 years. She is 52 years old, married to S. M., and has three sons.
  
Her husband has a business of selling animals. He purchases them young, raises them and sells them to customers at a profit.
  
Khursheed herself is a housewife. She fulfills her household responsibilities very well. In her spare time, she also takes care of the animals by giving them food and water.
 
Due to poor financial conditions, Khursheed couldn’t educate her sons, so two of them started work early in life. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and does a loading business through it, while the second one makes shoes on order. Her youngest son stays at home; he is just 10 years old.
 
Khursheed is part of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sell them at a good profit.
   
Khursheed is hopeful that this investment will be productive for her husband and make him better profits in the future.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats for the animal sales business

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a member of this group loan. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both are young and getting their education. 

She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She is a very active and supportive lady who has been living in the city of Pakpattan for many years with her family. Pakpattan is a small city of Punjab province, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house.
 
She is a beautician who operates a beauty salon at her home and provides make-up facilities to her clients.
 
Her husband’s name is M. A. and he operates a grocery store in the market. Through his shop he sells daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, lentils and spices. People prefer to buy from him because of the quality of his products and his good rates.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to put more groceries into his grocery store for its expansion. This will help him fulfill customer needs and earn better profits. He has been doing this business for five years and Sakina is hopeful that an investment will put his business in a more profitable position.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, one of Sakina's loan members named Bushran is showing her sewing work.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Martik

texts.en: Martik B., born in 1965 in Koti village, Ijevan area, is married and has three children, all attending school. Martik has a plot of land upon which he grows wheat and raises cows and pigs. To facilitate future development, Martik’s wife and his mother help him a a great deal on the farm. As part of that development, Martik is requesting a 500.000 AMD loan to buy fodder and another cow and pig for his farm.

loans.use: To buy another cow and a pig for his farm,  as well as fodder

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo G. , 47, lives in the town of Bunawan with his family. He is married and has five school-aged children. 

Danilo is a farmer and primarily plants and harvests rice crops. He also raises pigs in his backyard. Danilo works hard to build his business and have a stable income. He also aims to have all his children finish college and be successful.

Danilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 47 years old. Digna is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Digna plants and harvests rice for sale. Digna also plants and harvests vegetables in her backyard. She works hard to sustain her family.

Digna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Digna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Digna is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta E. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 54 years old. Restituta is married and has seven children. 

To make a living, Restituta plants and harvests rice for sale. She does her best to provide the needs of her family.

Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Restituta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Ameen is one member of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 

She is a caring and supportive lady. In order to help financially support her family, she does stitching works. She learned this art before her marriage and now is taking full advantage from it. She receives orders from different boutiques and ready-made clothes shops and completes the orders on time to earn for her family.
 
She belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Peer Karian road. She moved there after her marriage.
 
She has given birth to two daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
 
Ameen’s husband is a very hardworking person. He operates a business of making wooden cots. He started this business 30 years ago and in this number of years he has successfully built a good reputation among his clients for his good work. He also makes other furniture like chairs and tables and sells to different furniture shops on profit.
   
Ameen has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy wood and nails in larger quantity for making good quantity cots for selling.
 
She is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to make his business more profitable after investing loan money into it.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameen.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails for wooden cot-making business

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush B. was born in 1965. She is widow and now she lives with her son, her daughter-in-low and two grandchildren. Anush’s two daughters are already married and they live separately from Anush.
 
Since 1982 Anush has worked as a seamstress and she takes orders for dresses, skirts, trousers and suits. Anush says her incomes from sewing is insufficient for the maintenance of the family and therefore she, her son and her daughter-in-low have organized a fruits and vegetables trading business in the neighborhood of Anush's sewing workshop. 

Thanks to their joint action they support their family and have been able to save a moderate amount of money to buy a truck. That truck will allow them to transport fruits and vegetables from villages to their business place.
  
Anush asks for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy a new sewing machine and other necessary equipment for her sewing business and to fill in the missing amount of money for truck buying.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and other equipment and to add to savings for a truck

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida S. M. lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its sugar and agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in the area of Peer Karian. She is 25 years old and married. She supports her family financially by making paranday, an ornament used to tie-back hair. She earns reasonable profits from her business, which helps her pay the utility bills. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and manufactures furniture on order. He runs a shop in the market where he fulfills the demands of his customers by making their desired furniture. He has been in this business for over six years. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy woods, nails, and furniture polisher in large quantities, which will enable him to manufacture furniture and earn more money.  Rashida is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain maximum profits from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase woods, nails, and polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 40 years old. Mercedita is married and has two children, ages 20 and 19. To make a living, Mercedita plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Mercedita works hard to have a stable business.

Mercedita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to buy rice and corn seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad lives in the town of Bunawan. She is 56 years old and married. To make a living, Natividad plants and harvests rice for sale. Natividad wants to improve her business and be able to provide for all her family's needs.

Natividad joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida N. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 46 years old. Nida is married and has four children, ages 21, 20, 19 and 7. To make a living, Nida plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Nida works hard to sustain her family and to provide her children with an education. 

Nida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nida is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seed and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 56 years old, lives in the town of Bunawan. She is a farmer and tills her own land. She and her husband plant rice and corn crops. They sell their harvest to rice traders. They also plant vegetables in their backyard. Alicia is a hard-working mother and only wants the best for her family. She hopes to have a better yield and income so she can improve her family's living conditions.

Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She cultivates her land where she plants and harvests rice crops. Delia sells her harvest to their community. She is planning to put up a sari-sari (variety) store in front of their house. Right now, she is starting small by displaying products like oil and toothpaste outside her house. Delia does her best to feed, clothe and send her children to school.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joserecto

texts.en:
Joserecto P. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 50 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joserecto owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joserecto also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages. He says the store helps to provide for their daily needs.
Joserecto joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joserecto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando lives in the town of Bunawan with his family. He is engaged in farming and owns the land that he tills. Armando plants rice and bananas at his farm and sells his harvest to the market. He works hard to provide for the increasing needs of his family.
Armando joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Armando is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and lives in the town of Bunawan. She is married and has seven children. Shirley is engaged in farming and, in particular, plants rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. She says that it is easier to sell to the market. Shirley also owns and manages a sari-sari store located outside her house. The store helps in providing for their daily needs.
Shirley joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shareefan Munir Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan lives in Pakpattan, a small city known for its agricultural industry in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives here in a two-roomed brick house with her family in the area of Peerkot. She moved here 30 years ago.
Shareefan is a caring lady who helps her family financially by sewing clothes. She has a good number of customers in her community who trust her work and give her regular orders every month. She learned this skill from her mother and it is of benefit to her in times of need. She is married to M. A. who is involved in a milk-selling business. For this purpose, he has three buffalo and two cows. He never compromises on quality and that’s why he makes good profits from his business every month.
Shareefan has six sons. Her two elder sons are daily wage laborers while the others are studying. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will not only be an asset to him but also improve his income because he will be able to sell a greater quantity of milk every month. He has been involved in this business for ten years and Shareefan is hopeful that he will benefit highly from the loan. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Francisca lives in the town of Bunawan with her family. She is a rice farmer. Francisca works hard to keep her crops healthy and the farm free of weeds and pests. Francisca also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Francisca works hard to provide her family with their daily needs.

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs such a seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such a seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 48 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 28 years old, while the youngest is 22. To make a living, Elizabeth raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elizabeth works hard to help improve her family's living conditions.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married to M. S. and resides in Pakpattan, which is famous for its agriculture industry, in Pakistan. Her house is located in Peer kot, which is a small residential area of the city. She moved here with her family 20 years ago. 

Her husband operates a business of selling construction supplies. He provides his services to different construction companies on contract and also to his regular customers. 

Khursheed is a very skillful lady and an expert in embroidery works. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and prepares beautiful embroidered clothes. 

She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Her son works in a factory while her daughters are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy construction supplies in bulk to expand his business. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and has vast experience in this field. Khursheed is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business after utilizing the loan.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for selling

loans.name: Ayishietu Maame

texts.en: Ayishietu Maame A. has been trading in food items, such as rice, palm oil and Fante kenkey (boiled maize dough), for 15 years. She works near Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is married to a driver and has three children. Ayishietu contributes to the education of her children. She is requesting a loan to add to her initial capital in order to expand her business. Her business plan is to add the sale of root vegetables to her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. bakes bread at Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. She is married to an electrician and has three children. Hannah has been baking bread for five years now. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour and other ingredients so she can supply bread in larger quantities. She hopes to re-invest the additional income she makes from the loan back into the business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is married to a mason and has three children. Together they take care of the family. Salamatu assists her husband in the general welfare of the home.
Salamatu cooks various kinds of food for sale. She displays the food on a table. The loan Salamatu is asking for will serve as additional capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Mma

texts.en:
Mma H. has been cooking food for sale for about six years now. The type of foods she prepares are banku, rice and so on. She works at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is requesting a loan to invest in her food preparation business. Her business plan in the next three years is to build a food joint. In the picture Mma is dishing up one of the sauces she serves with the rice.
Mma is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for their education, clothing, feeding and other expenses.

loans.use: To invest in her food business

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
Sadiatu Y. is married and has three children. Her husband is a gardener. Sadiatu supports her husband in educating the children.
Sadiatu sells bags of charcoal at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is requesting a loan to buy extra bags of charcoal to store. As the price of charcoal keeps rising she can make more money in this way. Sadiatu anticipates building a storage house for the charcoal.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is married and lives with her husband and 6 dependents. Her husband is a security man.  Alima sells charcoal in both small and larger quantities at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is responsible for the utility bills as a way of supporting her husband financially. Her loan will be used to purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.
In this picture, Alima is standing beside a bag of charcoal. The black polyethylene bags have charcoal in them to serve those who cannot afford the bigger bag but can acquire some in a smaller quantity.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. is married with six children and has completed her junior high school education. For the last two decades, Ekua has been selling Fante Kenkey (a staple in Ghanaian diet, made of fermented maize dough – shown in the picture) at Efutu Mampong in Cape Coast. 
Her income pays for school fees and utility bills. She plans to use her loan to expand her kenkey business, and to plough profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: She plans to use her loan to expand her kenkey business,

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. is married to a farmer and they have 8 children. Esi has been selling Fante kenkey (a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and wrapped in plantain leaves, as shown in the picture) for three years now. The income she earns helps pay for their children’s school fees and household expenses. 
Esi’s goal is to grow her business and the loan will allow her to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits into her business.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sekina

texts.en:
Married with two children, Sekina A. has completed her senior high school education. She is a teacher (pictured with her students) and also has an underwear business in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. 
She is keen to grow her school by supplying stationery and other items to enhance the academic work of the kids.  She plans to use the loan to acquire these learning materials for the betterment of the students. She intends to reinvest the profits into the building of a better classroom since the current structure is made from wood.
Her earnings help supplement her husband’s income from his job as a driver and also help to pay for their children’s school fees and some household expenses.

loans.use: To acquire learning materials for the betterment of the kids.

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan and known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has lived in the area of Peerkot with her family in a 3-room brick house for the past 20 years. 
She is a working lady and makes paranday (an ornament used to tie hair back). She receives a good number of orders from her neighborhood clients and earns a regular income every month, which is used to pay utility bills and other household expenses.  Kaniz is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons earn a daily wage, while her daughters are still in school. 
Her husband has a business selling fish. His business does well, particularly in the winter season. 
Kaniz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fish in larger quantities to increase his sales.  Kaniz is confident that her husband can earn good profits from his business after the loan investment.  

Kaniz is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fish for selling

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe R. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 53 years old and widowed. She had 5 children, but one passed away. Maria Fe struggled but she is determined to sustain her family. She says that, by God's grace, she was able to move on.

Maria Fe is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to her community. Maria Fe works hard for her family. 

Maria Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pay for labor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Married with three children and educated up to junior high school, Ayishetu A. sells secondhand clothing in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for seven years and her dream is to have her own shop instead of selling from a table. 
The purpose of her loan is to ramp up the volume of clothes for sale and also to expand the variety of clothes she sells. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further expansion. 
Her income pays for her children’s school fees and also contributes towards the household utility bills.

loans.use: To ramp up the volume of clothes for sale and also to expand the variety of clothes she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia M. is single and from Nyame Bekyere, where she has been running a slipper/shoe business for the past 13 years. She aims to grow her business and expand her range of products to include dresses. The loan will allow her to add dresses to her shop, and she intends to reinvest the profits to grow her business further. She has completed her junior high education.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to add dresses to her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is a hairdresser from Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. She completed her junior high school education and has been a hairdresser for the past 13 years. 

Hair weaving is popular in this part of the world and Faustina is keen to add on hair extensions, hair creams, and other treatments for her customers so she can grow her business. A loan will help her invest in these new products. She plans to use the profits to purchase a hair dryer. 

Her income helps supplement her husband’s earnings - he is a security guard – to pay for their children’s school fees and other household expenses.

loans.use: A loan will help her invest in new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ayisietu

texts.en:
Ayisietu A. is a single mother of one child; she is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. Having completed her junior high school education, she sells kenkey (a staple in the Ghanaian diet made from fermented maize dough) and palm-nut soup for a living. In the photograph, she is scooping palm-nut soup. 

Her goal is to grow her business to earn more money to look after herself and her child. The loan will be used to purchase more bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to boost her sales. She intends to reinvest the profits to grow her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to prepare more kenkey (fermented maize dough) to boost her sales

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is married with two children and is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She sells tuo zaafi (rice or corn balls, usually eaten with ground nut or green-leaves soup, beans, and cowpeas with shea nut oil and pepper.) 

Her husband is a mason and depends on her earnings to help pay for their children’s school fees and some household expenses. She wants to grow her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale. She plans to save the added profits to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale

loans.name: Domiciano

texts.en:
Domiciano is a married man from the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He owns and tills his own land there. He plants and harvests rice crops that he sells to rice traders. Domiciano also put up a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. He says it is always good to have an extra source of income. The store helps Domiciano's family with their daily needs.

Domiciano joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domiciano has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Domiciano is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
For two decades, Ramatu M. has been selling banku (a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize/cassava dough, usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish) in Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. 

She is married with six children. Her earnings from selling banku help her husband, a mason, with some of the household expenses and their children’s school fees. 

She needs a loan to grow her business in order to increase their household income. She plans to purchase more ingredients (especially maize) with her loan so that she can increase her production. The added profits will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar E. is divorced and the sole provider for her three children. She sells smoked fish in Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. 
She needs a loan to purchase more fish to grow her business. She plans to use the added profits to pay for her children’s education. 
In the picture, she stands next to the traditional oven used for smoking fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to grow her business.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara B. is divorced and is the sole breadwinner for her four children. She has been selling kenkey (a staple in Ghanaian diet made from fermented maize dough) for the past 20 years. 
To support her family better, she needs to increase her earnings by growing the volume of her business. A loan will allow her to purchase more maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. Ultimately, her dream is to build and run her own restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare more kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en:
For 10 years, Muniratu M. has been running a provision store in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. 
Married with one child, her income from this business helps pay for their child’s education and also contributes to some of the household expenses. Her goal is to save up enough to buy a piece of land, and she intends to do this by growing her business. 
The loan will allow her to buy more varieties of products to sell in her provision store, which will boost her sales and increase her customers.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of products to sell in her provisions store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua D. has made her living by selling porridge (made from millet and corn )for 10 years, at Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is divorced and depends on her income make ends meet. 
Her goal is to grow her profits by boosting the volume of porridge she sells. The loan she needs will allow her to buy more ingredients to make more porridge. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further growth. 
In this picture, Ekua is showing the soaked millet she is getting ready to be milled to prepare the porridge.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make more porridge.

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish L. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 23 years old. Charish is married and has 2 young kids. To make a living, Charish owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Charish works hard to sustain her family and be able to save for her children's future.

Charish joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charish has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Charish is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua H. is a widow supporting seven children. For the past seven years, she has run dual businesses of selling footwear and banku (a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize/cassava dough, usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish). 
Her dream is to build and run her own chop bar (local street side restaurant selling a variety of local dishes). She intends to use the loan to purchase more slippers/shoes for sale to increase her revenue. The added profits will go towards building her chop bar.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers for sale to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Adizatu

texts.en:
Adizatu M. sells porridge in Nyame Bekyere, Cape Coast. Married with three children, her earnings from porridge sales supplement her husband’s earnings as a cleaner. She contributes to their children’s school fees and utility bills. 
Her dream is to provide her children with a meaningful education. Her plan is to increase her earnings by growing the volume of porridge she sells. She needs a loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare more food. Also, the loan will help her buy in bulk to ease the pressure from inflation. The extra earnings will go towards saving for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare more food.

loans.name: Christie Ellen

texts.en:
Christie Ellen A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 27 years old. Christie Ellen is married and has 4 school-aged children. She is engaged in farming and particularly plants and harvests rice crops. Christie is currently pregnant. Her husband, who is also a farmer, maintains the farm. He makes sure the crops grow healthy and that the farm is free of pests. Christie is hoping for increased harvest and earnings.

Christie Ellen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christie Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Christie Ellen is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu I. is a widow supporting six children. She is from Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast, where she sells food items and runs a provision store. 
To provide her children with a good education, she needs to increase her earnings to save up for their school fees. She intends to do this by increasing her revenue. A loan will allow her to purchase more items to attract more customers and improve sales.

loans.use: To purchase more items to attract more customers and improve sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary A. is a 27-year-old, married man from the town of Bunawan. Hilary and his wife have two children, who are 1 and 2 years old. To earn a living, Hilary owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, his primary source of income is derived from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hilary works hard to support his family and to save for his children's future.

Hilary joined CEVI to gain access to financial services, which in turn improves both his ability to engage in business activities and his family's standard of living. Notably, Hilary has already successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hilary is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($275), which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru is a 32-year-old business man. He is married and has three children, aged 18, 8 and 5. All of his children are school-going children.
 
Umaru started his plastic utensil business in 2000. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Umaru opens his business every day from 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Umaru has a good loan repayment history. 

He needs a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) to buy more stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 354,000. 

In the future, Umaru plans to build a house and educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic utensils

loans.name: Musu J

texts.en:
Musu is a 41-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are 8 and 17 years old. In 2010, Musu established a retail food business because she was confident that it could be a means of providing a better livelihood for her family.

Musu is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL ($725), which would be used to buy more provisions such as sugar, milk, margarine, and sardines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 267,000 SLL. In the future, Musu intends to acquire her own store. She plans on educating her children with the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of this loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, milk, margarine, and sardines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional ready-made clothes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 40-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have three children, aged 20, 15 and 10 years old. Two additional dependents live with their family because they are relatives of her husband. In 2002, Fatmata established a food sales business because she sought independence in her work life. By working 7 days per week and 10 hours per day, she earns approximately 950,000 SLL every month from her business.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL ($925), which would be used to buy additional food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 203,200 SLL. With the additional income she expects to generate as a result of this loan, Fatmata intends to educate her children up to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is from Pakpattan. She lives there in a small house with her family in the area of Eidgah. Pakpattan is a small city known for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She came here 20 years ago.

She is 31 years old, married to T. H. who operates a printing business. He prints different books, visiting cards, etc. He is well-known among his clients for his good work and timely providing services. 

Shamim lives in a combined family system along with her brother-in-law and father-in-law.

Shamim is a very good house wife and does her household works very well. She is also a very caring mother who is raising her 3 sons with care and discipline. She has enrolled all of them in a school, so that they will get a good education and good jobs in their lives.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy items like printer toner, paper, etc. in larger quantity to continue the business of printing. He has been operating this business for past 20 years and Shamim is very confident that an investment will bring more profits to him, which will help her family to enjoy a better standard of living.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy printer toner, papers, etc., for a printing business,

loans.name: Florence M

texts.en: This is 56 year-old Florence. She is married and has 3 children aged 25, 23 and 21. In 2009, Florence established her provisions business. She began her business because she wants to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,303,200 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy cartons of tin milk, butter, jam, magarine, sugar, etc. for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 260,640. In the future, Florence plans to help her husband build a house for their family and to give quality educate to their children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions such as cartons of milk, butter, jam, magarine, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. lives in Getahovit village, in the area of Ijevan, with her big family, which consists of her husband, her son’s family with three children and with her parents-in-law.

For about 36 years Nora has worked as an accountant and simultaneously she and her big family have been engaged in pig breeding. They raise pigs and then sell pork to Ijevan city’s butchers. This activity helps to sustain Nora’s big family, which consists of 9 members.

Nora asks for a 750.000 AMD loan to buy a new type of sow for her farm, which will allow her family to gain more profit in future.

In the photo you can see Nora and her husband.

loans.use: To buy new a new type of sow for her farm.

loans.name: Haja Saudatu

texts.en: Haja Saudatu is a 47 years old business woman. She is married, but has no children. In 1979, Haja Saudatu established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she believed the business could be a means of getting additional income for her family. She opens her business at 7am and closes by 6:30 pm every day. She makes about SLL 1,000,000 profit from her business every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Saudatu has a good credit history. She needs this loan to help her buy additional medical drugs for her pharmacy. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Haja Saudatu plans to open one or two outlets as a way of expanding her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis se dedica al transporte D. carga pesada, tiene dos camiones D. los cuales uno lo maneja el cliente y el otro su padre, ambos formaron este negocio que hasta la fecha le está dando buenos resultados. El solicitante vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con su esposa y sus hijos su casa es propia D. material noble. Requiere del crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a sus dos camiones ya que anteriormente realizó gastos comprando llantas. Cuenta con buena capacidad D. pago, por lo que se propone el siguiente crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. José Luis has a heavy load transport business.  He owns two trucks, one of which is used by customers and the other by his father, with whom he set up the business.  It has been going very well for them so far.  

José Luis lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He needs the loan for maintenance of his two trucks since he had to cover the cost of buying new tires.  He has enough income to cover payments and, therefore, is requesting the loan.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren A. is 44 years old and lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Suren works as a bus driver and is also busy in animal husbandry. He says it is very hard work. His family helps him to raise cows and calves to support their family.
This is Suren’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for $1800 to buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a small venture selling men’s tops in one of the local markets. All her merchandise is characterized by high quality and reasonable price. Yelena is a workaholic. She works in the worst weather conditions and is ready to sacrifice time and rest to achieve even better results. She has been in the trade for 14 years. Currently, her gross income is about 30,000 grivnyas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 9,000 grivnyas. Yelena has benefited from previous lending assistance. This time she is requesting a loan of 16,000 grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. She hopes to receive additional income and help her elderly parents.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Erika Del  Rosario

texts.es:
Erika es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio sus ventas hace seis años, con el objetivo de apoyar a su familia económicamente.
En donde comienza a vender ropa, cosméticos, por catálogos y adquiere clientela, gracias a su esposo quien labora como supervisor en una empresa privada y financiamiento que obtuvo por medio del préstamo en Afodenic en donde sus productos aumentaron, y ha logrado la captación y aceptación de sus clientes, el cual vende al contado y al crédito.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara ropa escolar, cosméticos para lograr mejor demanda, por el curso de años.
texts.en:
Erika is a small merchant. She began her activity six years ago with the aim of giving financial support to her family. She began selling clothes and cosmetics through catalogues. She acquired customers thanks to her husband who is a supervisor in a private company, and she was granted loans by the microfinance institution Afodenic. She expanded her product range and successfully won and kept customers. She sells for cash and on credit.

She will use her new loan to buy school uniforms and cosmetics to meet the higher demand over the course of years.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of school uniforms and cosmetics to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a widow.  She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. This was a difficult time for her, but she recovered her senses and started work in order to raise her 4 children. She does stitching for her neighboring clients to fulfill the basic needs of the family. She couldn’t provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions.
Robina lives with her brother and cousin, who have a scrap business. They take orders from different factories and other scrap dealers and complete them to earn profits. 
Robina  also does her responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and tries to give comfort to her brother, cousin and children by cooking food and cleaning the home. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap, like used papers, plastic bottles and iron, in larger quantity.  That should enable him to complete the orders on time and to earn bigger profits. 
Robina is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Robina”.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.es:
Bernandina es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Santa Julia de Ibedia del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de seis años y gracias a la buena atención que brinda tiene clientela fidelizada. La actividad que realiza es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Bernandina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerveza ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a mother, 42 years old, who lives with her husband and her three children in the town of Santa Julia de Ibedia. It is in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She sells beer from her home. She has had this business for more than six years, and because of the good service she provides, she has happy customers. This business is of much help to her family; because of it she is able to help her family with economic needs. 

Bernardina would like to expand her business by buying more beer because the demand for her business has grown. She has requested a loan of PEN 1,000.00, with which she plans to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy beer to expand her business
